aflv9EBAdgjs39CZ8PsBlA.text: I've been waiting to come here....forever.  I came here to write a paper tonight, and I highly doubt I will get that done. It's quite loud & busy, even at 11pm. This place has a great atmosphere though! I ordered the Mad Max. It's pleasantly good & I can actually taste some of the coffee grounds...lol very rare. I will definitely be back again ;) maybe at another point in the day.

o8FKujO_tJtDUIavrUY9Jw.text: This place is awesome! Great location and open 24 hours. Perfect place for some late night coffee fix.  Update: 04.07.16 After multiple visits here, i will never again order anything after what happened last night. They served wrong drinks and I saw that these customers sipped and drank some of it and that same drinks were given to me. Exactly the same drinks! It was so disgusting. I assume they just changed the straw and the lid. Yuck. The hot drink was obviously consumed because it's not full anymore. After these drinks were given to me I told them that those are the same drinks that were given to the previous customer. No apologies, and just told me that they will make "new" drinks. But this time how would I really know that they really made new ones? Oh well, never again.

I did not like the product. Would never recommend.

What can I say, except this was the moment I had waited for. When I asked for an iced water...  ...I got it. Masterfully crafted. 10 out of 10. Always go. Never leave. Its 24/7. Better than the beat, because the beat is closed. Contrary to popular belief, the beat does not go on.

KCwqhHch-FE1ZAxe1M5PXw.text: Greeted by a super awesome funny barista!   They have so many different options of coffee. I certainly enjoyed a sip of the Kyoto style coffee (it's a slow drip brew...therefore super strong). I asked for a mocha and added black coffee and I love it!  The drinks tend to be sweet/sugary... So I ask for half everything!   Madhouse coffee offers deserts and foods as well!  It's a cool vibe. You see a lot of street art when walking in. None are offensive but some are just very.. Strange to look at.   This is a 24hour place where people can also go to smoke Hookah. Which attracts people from different places/countries/cultures.

I've tried coffee bean, cowgirl espresso, Starbucks, Dutch bros., etc. and have yet to have an iced vanilla latte as good as madhouse coffee. It was the perfect amount of sweetness and creaminess. 7tTd2IWiiaBetJMJLPlqGQ.text: I actually like this place but after today's experience I am disappointed. If today had been my first experience, I would have given it 1 star but it was my 3rd, so I gave it a 2. I walked in and it was pretty empty. I was the only person in line and wasn't greeted.  No big deal, but the girl that waited on me seemed really annoyed that she had to stop cleaning and come and sell me a cup of coffee. Also I would recommend that they have a separate station to dress the coffee. I like to do it myself and asking for a coffee stirrer, Splenda, milk etc... seemed like it was too much for the staff and had there been other people in line they would have been annoyed as it would have increased their wait. I love supporting local business so I really hope they can hire more friendly staff and get a milk and cream station.

SXjTcOB_U5IO6h3SItfw5w.text: Madhouse coffe was my favorite place to buy coffe. Before this situation.. As usually on Monday i went there to buy a morning coffe. I went to drive-thru  and placed my order. The coffe I received was kinda sour. So I asked lady on the front(her name was Alison) what kind of milk did they use? Was it a skim milk ? Alison showed me all her attitude to my question and made her face like I just offended her. So she said it was a whole milk. When I said that coffee tastes like sour and bittershe kept look at me with the same attitude on the beginning. When I start moving to leave the window she finally asked me"do you want me to change it?" It was too late already , so I answered "no, I don't ", in a moment I heard like someone yelling "you are f**king bi*ch!!"( check back cameras to see who was so creative) I was in shock!! Really it SHOCKED me. I just bought a coffe and was not satisfied with it.. I came back to the window but no one come there. I was running behind to my work so I didn't go directly inside the cafe.. when i called by mentioned phone number the same lady pick up the phone and was talking to me. She didn't give me a chance to tell nothing.She was talking and yelling on me. And all the time she interrupted me. At the end she just hang up. I tried to find the owner of this establishment..Marco.  Hope he will read this post and realize what is going on in his business. It's a shame for owner to have employees like they are.  They offended me . Just because I didn't like the coffee they made for me.. Unfortunately i will not go there any more. And it's really sad. I really liked that place.

RatgUySiO9n4Gkzh7hmQGA.text: Had a Groupon Now special for a $3 artisan bread sandwich. Brought a tiramisu obsessed friend. We ordered the Gobbler, Nutella tiramisu, and a red velvet mocha (blended).  My only complaint... My mouth was bright red after that mocha. Was it worth it? YES. I don't like coffee at all, but this was delicious. The sandwich was much better than any of the other Turkey/cranberry sandwiches I've had around town; probably because of the delicious bread and the melted cheese. I contemplated ordering another one but didn't want to be a total pig about it.  The tiramisu was good and I'm not a fan of tiramisu. It had a little too much of the creamy stuff on it for my taste but it was still good and my friend was very happy with it. The service was good and helpful. Will be back for another sandwich!!!

lDuvToHi7jm_0cidFRR0JA.text: visiting from out of town. overall impression: would frequent MadHouse Coffee often if i lived here.  friendly barista. not large selection of drinks but unique. smaller and cozier layout. smooth ambiance.

zz6-WNd-xQcn7sI_bvHslA.text: I used to love this place. Madhouse was my go-to spot for pre work coffee. They used to have a set up where you would go buy a cup for coffee, then fill it yourself at the coffee bar area that had about 8 different choices of coffee. This is perfect for me because I am entirely too picky about my coffee. They usually had bold, mild, decaf, flavored, etc. My favorite was when they had the southern pecan flavored coffee out. Then you would take your coffee to the cream and sugar station to fix it how you like.  After my job location switched, I wasn't able to go very often. I'm not sure exactly when they changed their entire set up, but it's completely different now. I went in awhile ago and saw that they didn't have their coffees out so I ordered tried to order a decaf at the counter. They said they didn't have decaf. Um. No decaf coffee at a coffee house?? They said I could get a decaf americano. If I wanted an americano I would have ordered it. I ended just walking out shaking my head.  Then, about a week ago, I decided to give it another try. I was with my boyfriend and we happened to be passing by in the early afternoon. I asked them what coffees they had brewing. They had one coffee they could give me. ONE choice. Even Starbucks has more options and their coffee is awful. So I bought it, hoping it would be good. I start looking around for the cream and sugar station and it was nowhere to be found. The girl behind the counter told me they didn't have one so I had to stand at the ordering counter and tell the girl which sugar I wanted and how much cream, which she handed over to me. And then I stood there waiting for something to stir it with, because there was nary a stirring utensil to be found. I had to wait for the counter girl to come back to ask her to get me one. How does this not slow down the line on a busy day? No, I don't want you to put cream and sugar in for me, I want to do it myself because this is America, dammit. Anyway, it was super inconvenient that they don't have a system in place for this kind of thing. And the coffee was awful. And lukewarm. I hate dark brews, but that was all they had. My boyfriend got some fancy ass blended drink that was awful and tasted like ash flavored ice chunks. He had about two sips and threw it away. What a waste of $10 and 15 minutes.  I'm a straight coffee drinker. And this used to be the place to go for variety. Sadly, I won't be back, much like the southern pecan coffee.

nEGjxsPBua6dt3A1YDWYDA.text: TLDR: 24 hours. Has food and drinks. Moderately priced. Owner is pleasant and grateful. Employees friendly, but not necessarily competent. Sells hookah. Free wifi with purchase. Has a drive-thru. Takes credit. Uses square trade.   I've been going to this quaint little coffee shop for quite some time off and on for about 5 years. As you know, I do enjoy supporting my small business owners, so I'm happy to give my business to modest workers. I've met the owner several times now as each time he introduces himself to me. He appears grateful and humbled for any business and potential marketing that customers have to offer. I would describe him as eccentric and a definite night-owl. He enjoys what he does and he treats his employees with respect. He has even noticed when we post things to Instagram. A great person all-around.   Let's get to the drinks. The matcha tea latte is very good. It's a little pricey, but it's well worth the price. Since I'm cheap, I wouldn't get it but that shouldn't deter you from getting one. The Nutella Mocha and red velvet mocha is great hot or iced. Word of caution: really sweet, especially towards the end of the drink. Ask for a water cup. In fact, get some food to wash it down with. I recommend the island of capri or the 4 x 4.   Speaking of food, their macaroons are pretty good and so are their chocolate croissants, especially warmed up. As for cost, their food is also moderately priced. Hey, someone's gotta make money, right?  Everything or mostly everything is made on-location so you're getting the real deal.   Let me know what you think!

vSIGTyt5HGqOr392UYjTzA.text: I used to come here all the time when I lived in the area. I have to say I was extremely disappointed with how things turned out. While my drink was good, the one thing I looked most forward to got messed up two times in a row. No big deal. Then he brings the iced coffee over and it was the worst iced coffee I've ever had. It was so watered down. It tasted like a cup of water with some sugar in it. It seemed like it was really old because he "remade" it very fast. I ask for the same thing at Starbucks and at Dutch Bros and it's always consistent. So I decided to go inside and ask them to remake it. The cashier just said "Oh that's just how we make it". Horrible customer service. Didn't even offer to make another one. You're better off getting coffee from the McDonald's down the street and will receive better service. Don't waste your time and pay for overpriced drinks at this place. The worst.

ORJzz5XHlMAc1jFIIn1yAA.text: This place is in my rotation of coffee places I semi-regularly hit.  I come here when I want a drink that's basically a dessert.  I probably don't want to know how many calories I'm drinking...haha. I almost always get the Monkey Mocha or Mustachio, they are flavorful, filling, and pack a heavy caffeine punch once I've added some espresso shots.    I wish they made the drinks a little less sweet though, and some of the workers are even more heavy-handed with the syrups so the drinks aren't totally consistent.  The prices are a little high, although the drinks are also available in giant size.  The food is just so-so, overall.  The menu is kind of interesting for a coffeehouse but too bland for my taste.

gamwEMClJrQbX2kE1Y5zuA.text: Recently I've grown fond of MadHouse Coffee.  Oh but wait, caffeine doesn't cause fondness... Reverb: addicted.  A few things that are the causes:  - drive thru - humorous names of menu items - open 24 hours - also serves sandwiches plus pastries - artisan chocolates - makes macarons - interior design elements is re-use of piping and wood - crazy fun art  Other than their prices being a bit more expensive, I enjoy their products.  Service is really casual and friendly.  Workers seem like they're all buddies outside of work.    I think I'm also becoming what I eat... an Innocent Bystander.  I'm just a loaded turkey in a Focaccia bun, smothered with spicy sauce that has a zing.  And I wear lettuce leaves.  While you're staring, why don't you grab yourself a Mad Cow, give it some Nutella White Chocolate Mocha; then watch it dance like Michael Jackson owwwaaa!

You only get free wifi if you order something, which is fine, I had planned on ordering a vegan treat but the vegan section was empty so I didn't get anything. I wanted the wifi, so I bought a tea- it was $3.75. Wifi or not, that's too much for a cup of tea. Then the login didn't even work on our iPad. Even the employee couldn't get it. So I wasted $3.75.  But the worst part, is that in the case, there were penis shaped chocolates with a sign that read "Dicks made by lesbians" What the heck is that all about? tZUASUu3aC0Kt33-i-S3dQ.text: I was in the area for a local meet and happened to stumble on to this pretty cool establishment. I came in and ordered the Hot Chocolate and I gotta say, I'm pretty damn impressed! Kai is awesome and I'd definitely come back!!

YaW3ZzEaDlshmnIjl2Wzgg.text: Came down here based off recommendations from a couple of friends.  First, I'll start off with the service. It was give and take. Both guys up front were a little awkward, especially after offering some recommendations. Payment process was easy, and our food was brought to our table, which was nice.  Secondly, and most importantly: the food. I ordered a green tea with peach sweetener. The tea was very watered down and bitter. It didn't taste like it had any flavor: just tasted like water! After mulling over the menu after what seemed like forever, I made my choice, but was still unsure. I admire the quirky theme of this cafe, but the menu is all different styles and fonts: it's hard to read, so it's hard to make a decision. My OCD was going off from this one. Ultimately, I chose the rabbit habit sandwich with pesto, sun dried tomatoes, and lettuce. The sandwich was nice, but nothing special. I felt like I've had this sort of thing at many places, but there was no wow factor. Couldn't even stomach the whole sandwich.   Lastly, I'll leave this on a positive note about the atmosphere. This cafe is cute and quirky. People look like they're genuinely having fun. Seating is very sparse and close together, which is my only complaint about that.  Overall, Madhouse is just an average cafe. It has a very hipster vibe. But I was so outraged by the lack of anything that I left this place in a bad mood. When it comes down to it, I won't be coming back here.

OqmAOf0tGPYQ36NlZKe-Wg.text: I've been going to MadHouse ever since I moved here 3 years ago. Nice hangout spot for friends. Love the patio seating. I appreciate the art they have displayed, the food is OK, coffee is pretty good, I love that they are open late/early. Play pretty good music. Good location.

WF01ku4DX9TcEyJ671vcMg.text: Ive been here since probably since the week they opened and i love it. The drinks are pretty good but what i like best about it is their service! Tasty sandwiches and macaroons they're even pet friendly! This place is a great chill hang out, perfect for studying or movie watching!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Mad House Sandwich! W/ Green Tea!

eu353V9EY2lb1k2knLHyAg.text: Gibraltar Review  The Pour: They don't roast their own, according to the barista, but use Intelligentsia, which is fine. However, the milk was scorching hot (gibraltars should be much cooler) which negatively affects the taste of the milk, as well as the espresso. I had to wait over 5 minutes until the coffee was drinkable.  Service: Barista was friendly, but as mentioned above tragically over-steamed the milk.  Ambiance: Not particularly hipster, average coffeeshop vibe. Clean. Cool wall art.  Conclusion: To be honest, it was probably the worst coffee experience I've had at a craft coffee shop. I'd (grudgingly) be willing to go back to see if the drink I had was an anomaly or not.   About Me / Review Criteria: -I only review "Third Wave"/artisanal/craft coffee shops (whatever you want to call them) -Nobody gets a 1 or a 5 star rating until I've gone several times -Reviews can't be based on just a select group of baristas, they all have to be equally skilled, or at least must all have a minimum level of skill -My star ratings are solely based on the drink, never on food, ambiance, or if the barista is emo or snobby (because that would bring down more than 50% of the shops), although I do mention those in the review -I don't claim to be a trained coffee connoisseur -My reviews are generally based on gibraltar/cortados (or cappuccinos), not espresso or drip/pourover coffee

fy4wOBNSSNt0K9R7apKeqQ.text: They have really good coffee and croissants, and they warm them up for you when asked. Service is iffy and this place is pretty expensive... I wish the prices were lower or I would go there more often

zpG8uwRZolXd_sWiYRzkKQ.text: When your flight is late on a Monday night, you are beyond jet lagged, and it's past midnight local time, where do you do next? If you are me, you head to the Mad House, and relax in peaceful bliss with a massive caffeinated drink! My choice is latte with almond milk but I encourage you to be more adventurous.   Plus, after flying for many hours, I'm usually a bit hungry having avoided the dreaded "airplane food". Problem solved! The sandwiches here are absolutely delicious, and available on your choice of three fresh baked rolls. Yum!  Finally, being a likely obvious first time customer, the service here was enthusiastic and friendly, helping us select from the varied menu! They brought our food out to us as we relaxed and surfed on free wifi (ask for the code after you spend a few bucks). Truly, we were lucky to find a spot to sit as this cool Oasis in Vegas was quite full, even at 1am on a Monday.

OqAntiCc_AUC3-iOTNKgaw.text: Great little coffee cafe to relax on the patio and kill a few hours. The coffee is good and staff is always nice. The artwork on the wall is cool. Half the patrons are hipsters and the other half are coffee addicts & connoisseurs. Fun place, stop in try it out!

_eU4cFAOI1N45qfCcRMp0Q.text: Great vibe and a pleasant surprise to see that they serve Intelligentsia Coffee!!! It's like I am back in the Midwest when I take a sip of my finely crafted beverage!   Tried the Gay Garden Boy black bean burger too!  Flavors were great and worked well with one another.

zjC1AlkA4xmORpOfv3Z_1A.text: Mad house & madhouse in one day? Problems, yes, I know. Mad house on eastern and pebble has no affiliation with the one here on s Durango and desert inn. (Hence the space between "mad" and "house"). Review... Same menu as mad house but this one is more extensive with a larger dessert selection and delicious sandwiches to choose from. They don't have my usual lox & bagel but they do have "another cowbell". Being a garlic fiend, I had to try.   Disclaimer: They have tv screens to coy you into ordering a five course meal. Just look away, you can fight the urge.   Back to it.. Cheddar, lettuce, tomato, garlic aioli with layered tender roast beef on focaccia was holy god good. Served on a cute cutting board too. Presentation A+ , sandwich A++ (insert Michael Scott reference here). I had it with a blended mad MAX instead of my usual mad COW. It's 9 pm and I'm feeling audacious. Blended coffee and chocolate covered expresso beans yum! This was the perfect savory meal. Rosemary in the focaccia and a mild bite from the chocolate expresso beans.. Can we all vote for madhouse to provide delivery??   Being open 24/7, I have a love/ hate relationship with this place. But mostly love. A must try and bring friends too. Nice patio area and cool art on the walls. I loved the spiritual bump signs.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coffee by madhouse, nails by mms
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast beef + cheddar + garlic aoli + lettuce + tomato on focaccia

-vt4IRxcXW-JW3Vbu-IPWQ.text: Found them on Uber eats. Ordered the hickster as a salad and the sweet potatoe stuffed. I thought the sweet potatoe was a very creative dish. It's like healthy comfort food. I love that I found this place because my Uber eats list is not great.

_XVHgKnJhG4BOGiliqS-lA.text: I've gone here about 5 to 10 times to give it a shot and honestly if you're not getting coffee it's a waste of money. We always order through post mates or uber eats at work and I love the blended nutella. Definitely wakes me up for a 12 hour shift. However if I'm hungry or want dessert, I always get annoyed for paying for an over priced sandwich. The sandwiches are small, bland, and basic. If they were cheap it'd be fine but they are like 1/3 of the size of a subway sandwich and you're paying 9 to 12 bucks! I've had the bread pudding, creme brulee, and nutella creme brulee which were all disappointing. I definitely don't consider those creme brulee OR bread pudding, and I've had my fair share. I've tried so hard to like this place but the only thing I ever enjoy is that blended nutella white mocha. And that's only on nights I'm okay being diabetic.

4IbghRLGqN92xXevzOPdcA.text: I love Madhouse. Great peeps, tunes and vibes. I also love the anti-propaganda decor, hopefully it's helping one or 2 people wake up.   I had the raw vegan brownie and a coffee to go with it. Both were delicious and will likely be consumed by m again in the near future

em5vOVdANv0BwgI8crHIBw.text: Stopped in for my usual addiction an ice white mocha, decided to try the chocolate croissant it was nice and flaky I just wish there was more chocolate chips, but definitely recommend it. photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $9 for this joke.  Isle of Capri sandwich.  No fresh mozzarella, no fresh herbs, stingy on tomatoes.

J2mh4jtV0xem5i2oLjXwNg.text: I ordered a drink and a sandwich here in the late morning on a Friday to go. My sandwiches came out about ten minutes after my order and I had to wait about 25 minutes for my coffee. The baristas are working as fast as they can, they're super nice and efficient, but as a barista myself, I can say this shop is set up in a very dumb way. The baristas have to walk all over the store for cups, to ice, to their espresso maker... The owners to this place need to focus more on setting up their baristas for success and then this would be truly great and fast coffee.

BmiCnOI-6QWHiZ70C7nLOQ.text: A different blend of coffee versus your average Starbucks type. Prices are much more reasonable and the sizes are bigger.

snRYScj_X-31RCcWk4so5A.text: The fast, friendly drive-thru service at Madhouse put them on the map for me. I had my little dog and they even gave him a treat at the window! (I've even heard they're dog-friendly at the patio area.) I ordered the Nutella white chocolate mocha and my roomie ordered the red velvet mocha. The Nutella drink was a bit watery for me upon the first sip, but when I got to the good stuff, it was indulging enough--although if I didn't know it was Nutella, I might not have guessed so. My roomie said something along the same lines about his red velvet drink. He couldn't exactly distinguish the red velvet flavor, but agreed he had an enjoyable drink. Overall good experience, and I would definitely like to sit down inside that artsy area with a book someday!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella white chocolate mocha and red velvet

lEbj-aJWzSn0_f4310NZSw.text: I am so glad that our Yelp Book Club met here last month because I have found a new coffee shop to add to my list when I need to get out of my home office for a change of scenery and do some work.  Plus, the coffee is really tasty too.  I tried the famous "Mad Cow", a hazelnut latte, and it was delicious.  But, the items that were calling my name were the freshly baked/ made in-house desserts and pastries. I ordered the pumpkin tiramisu (which is probably a seasonal item), and not only was the serving very generous, it was fan-tas-tic.   The place is quite small, but a cozy and artistic atmosphere. There are colorful paintings and modern art to inspire and simply take in.  And like many Vegas establishments, it is open 24 hours a day.  It is nice to know that if I need a caffeine fix or have a late night craving for some awesome dessert, MadHouse will be there. Plus, there is a drive-thru, so I don't even have to get out of my PJs.

V1snEzOs-ZqFqKSu1r1J6g.text: Best blended Coconut Mocha in town...and I got it with almond milk! You can't get this at a Starbucks! The customer service here is wonderful, the vibe is hipster/funky/fun, outdoor seating is nice and blocked off for doggies (and kids too). Definitely will go back next time I'm on that side of town :)

S9ZVrU6iBSLgOxcoulkd6Q.text: 2 words: hemp milk. Don't gotta say much more. Coming here is a "treat" for myself because I live all the way by the M. It's ALWAYS worth it. Nothing beats your biggest iced dirty chai with hemp milk. Not all the Jameson in the world. Thanks MadHouse !!!

kS1qW31LLonpmAG7knZ2Gw.text: This is my favorite coffee spot. I come here almost every night before work. I am one of their drive thru veterans haha. I usually go with the Michael Jackson or a caramel macchiato with hemp or almond milk. I absolutely love that they give you dairy free options other than soy milk. Their monkey mocha is also super yummy as well. I usually have to grab a sweet treat along with my coffee. They have a gluten free double chocolate muffin that I am obsessed with. They warm it up so the chocolate is all gooey inside. I love their pine nut cookies and macarons too. My only complaint is that the macarons are way too overly dyed with food coloring. I've had dye get in my teeth before lol. Also, I really wish they had gluten free bread so I can order sandwiches, but other than that, I love this place! They are awesome and the service is always on point.

iTJ7N73ZmWNJ5BeE3AedXw.text: I like red velvet stuff and have been hearing about this red velvet mocha drink at Madhouse Coffee, so I had to check it out. Pulled up to the drive thru around 11pm, score for them being open 24/7, and ordered the red velvet mocha, medium, blended. That's it. My total was $6.74!! I thought this drink must come in a gold cup, but that was not the case. I liked the drink, but they used wayy too much dye and my tongue, teeth and lips were stained red. Not so much a problem at 11pm, but be forewarned if you happen to get this drink on your way to work or something, it stains! So the drink had a little but of a red velvet flavor, but nothing too distinct. It was mostly a sweet, red, blended drink. I would probably come back here because they have some interesting drinks that I want to try like the monkey mocha which is pb and banana, and the nutella white chocolate. Also I like to support local businesses.

IExEzJy9VP5AimvFKODt1g.text: What a fun place to grab some coffee. Basquiat on the walls, fresh goodies in the case, and some darn good coffee to boot.  My husband and I continued our LV coffee tour with a morning stop at Madhouse. I initially was just going to get their iced coffee but when I walked in and saw some people OOOing & AHHHing over their blended beverages, I had a change of heart.  The atmosphere was fun & funky. While the space was small, every square foot had strategically-placed personality pieces. I love that have the most random items for sale - like clove cigarettes and random candy items. Sweet touch.  I asked the two baristas what they recommend. They said the white chocolate nutella flavor and the monkey mocha ice blended drinks were the most popular. We obliged and ordered one of each.  The super sweet ladies brought our order out to us and whoa - we were amazed. These are not your mama's frappucinos... there was a distinct coffee flavor and a combination of flavors that rocked my world. I cannot pick a favorite between the two - they were both equally satisfying.  This is a place we are sure to come back to even if it's a pretty good distance from us. If their tiramisus and sandwiches are anything like their coffee, madhouse might be one of our favorite spots in the city.  I think it would be a pretentious assumption to think this is some gimmicky coffee house BUT that is thrown out the window once the 1st sip is taken.... this is the real deal and I want some more.

VeTeaRFyWmwLg7C6GraLww.text: I just visited this place for the first time and loved it! A little pricey but a nice switch from the usual Starbucks :/ I loved the fact that my latte came in a cup so large I consider it a soup bowl! Also liked the atmosphere very much. It's not totally a convenient location for me but when I'm in that area I would be happy to stop in.

SzXD0xcAYHvtrgAYRlfaZA.text: Everything here is fresh, delicious, and the atmosphere definitely makes the whole experience. My personal fave is the Green Card sandwich on focaccia. No matter what, though, I'll always order a white Nutella mocha over ice. DELICIOUS

a33mPjqLZDs-ImX1Hz4Bpg.text: Madhouse is amazing.  Andrew is the best person there.  No one else knows the place like he does.  I like to get the Mad Cow and The Gobbler sandwich most of the time.  My other favorite thing is that they're open 24/7 and I'm up late.

5eV4jxL3sL5lO9tVryvr2w.text: So I was introduced to Madhouse a couple years ago at the on near Eastern, but I really fell in love with this place within the past month. This one is on DI and is 24 hours which really works out with my work schedule. I've brought a couple dates here for coffee and dessert, after the bar to sober up, but I'm a regular with Tiffany. Madhouse is a great place to unwind after work or get your day started. I usually order the iced green tea and the Ron Jeremy to munch on. Tiff gets the iced passion tea (non sweetened, because she's already sweet enough as she states) and the BLT. The sandwiches are amazing! A tad over priced, but yummy. The crowd here is very young and hip and the owner always showcases art on the walls that you can buy. I've fallen in love with this one painting of a masked monster standing over a maze, but I won't pay $2,500 for it lol. Overall I love this place, and will continue to be a regular here with Tiff.

owR4F1I_gYNvEJhmdQOqVw.text: I totally enjoyed the stuffed sweet potato with roasted garbanzo beans, walnut sauce and fresh tomato. Delicious. The latte was perfect. Cool vibe and cool people. Every seat had a charging station, nice. Staff was helpful and friendly. I'll be back.

VRwB-aPeKtNGUuPcyMmRVA.text: Been coming here for a few months now (usually 2-3 times a week).  I work from home and am working on my Masters through an online course.  Being able to get out of my house to work and do school is a nice change.  This place is really close to home and open 24 hours which makes it very convenient.  The prices are a little high, but you get what you pay for!  You'll find the food and baked goods are all hand made (often from scratch) and the cold drink sizes are pretty decent (I've not had a hot drink yet so I can't speak for those).    I definitely recommend the sandwiches.  I've recently been hooked on The Very Charming Pig (black forest ham, bacon, swiss, and marscapone) on ciabatta... probably one of the best sandwiches I've ever had.  I've had no issues getting custom orders (drinks and food) here and all of the employees and owners are very nice and accommodating.

4Oi9cmD6uBwX1lJ4QrgVmg.text: Love the coffee and atmosphere! Staff is super helpful and friendly! Great place to study.

D50Gr4r7sipOSA0eAnkw1w.text: What a find! My obituary will show that I spent a not-insignificant fraction of my breathing hours studying or doing research in cafes, so getting a hookup like this on Yelp while randomly looking for a place to work in town is a huge win. I love MadHouse's aesthetic: It's grunge-artsy with weathered homages to famous street artists such as Keith Haring and Jean-Michael Basquiat. Even the bathroom is an exhibit (won't spoil it by adding photos--you need to check it out yourself).   And the coffee is outstanding as well. Their pourover is an Intelligentsia Coffee single origin which is well-worth the sticker price. If you're in the area, do check it out!

wNnYo537Jq0lCyqb_ABcWg.text: They increased their prices and they are charging for ice water   A 32 ounce iced tea is $5.50, and it's $.50 cents to add anything to it! So with agave and milk it's a $7.50 iced tea.  Ice water is $1 Base price on their iced specialty drinks are $7 to $7.50 and everything extra is $.50 to $1!!  I ordered 2 smoothies, 2 iced teas and a mustacio frappe my bill was $68!!!! WTAF?!?!?!?!  SORRY NEVER AGAIN!!!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is my hand and half of my grease soaked $12 sandwich the smallest I&#39;ve ever seen! BIG GREASY GROSS NEVER AGAIN

1bAQ5w5wzyk0vQG0vgXw3g.text: I kept telling my self one day I will try it.  Today is the day!!! The menu isn't overwhelming at all.  Sometimes when I walk into a coffee shop I get overwhelmed at the menu because of all the different choices and substitutes and add ones that I can't even make a choice.  They have a good amount of choices that you can have hot, blended, or over ice.  They have milk substitutes such as coconut milk, almond milk, hemp milk, and soy milk.  They also have smoothies and teas.    Since it's kind of late in the day for me I went with the 24 oz passion fruit tea with added peach flavor.  It was refreshing!  It was the perfect amount of sweetness.    When I paid it asked if I wanted to join their rewards program and I did just as simple as adding my phone number.  The person at the cash registered explained that every time you visit and use the same card it will automatically give you a star when your total is $5 or more.  When you reach 13 stars you get a free sandwich!  Anything free is great!   I will definitely be coming back to try the blended red velvet!  Ohhhh by the way they also have Italian hot cocoa!!!

-EqzzGMFsnQmrwzMFFuBlg.text: This would be a 5 star if only the drive thru would move much faster! Omg every time I go it's literally a 15-20 min wait, not even exaggerating, even when I'm the only one in the drive thru. And I swear the staff is always high or something.  But other than that I love the coffee and that it's different than most coffee places! The Monkey Mocha is my favorite - must try! I've yet to try the hookah there but it does looks like a chill place to hang out.  I live all the way by the M Resort and I drive this one because me and my boyfriend love getting coffee at 2am for no reason and the one nearest to me isn't 24/7  but I'll still make the trip to drive here!  Suggestion: Larger hot drink cups! And make Eastern location 24/7!   Other than that, this is one of my favorite place to get coffee.

L1GhKM6vGIGzC0aAoOtHOQ.text: Their coffee is great and their wifi is adequate! Great place to study and chill with friends.

qD-Wc4mq5mTpTI8I8oicdg.text: Madhouse always has been and always will be my favorite coffee house in Vegas.  It's open 24 hours, the musics good, and the vegan brownie is gluten free.  The art changes every now and then and the social commentary is fantastic. This is where I order the most hippiest beverage I've ever had or described in my life: a hot matcha tea latte with hemp milk at 50% sweetness.  It's ridiculously good and creamy.

0Mym787ATJr3VV3RV7EhDQ.text: I moved back to LV on Tuesday night and went to madhouse on Wednesday morning and want to come as many times as possible!   I had my new roommate and my nephew and we all felt the same way.  We loved all that we ordered and the Italian Hot Chocolate was INSANE!!!  We will be back a lot and recommend it highly! Thank you Madhouse!

3OGYQt8oOyKwabTQJW9TAA.text: 24/7 coffee social house. We haven't tried any of their food here but the drinks here are okay. Closest coffee house walk across the street from Desert Breeze park. We came here just a little after midnight to grab our Red Velvet mocha, was not able to get his name but the guy behind the stand made our drink perfect. We are usually skeptical about ordering from here because our drinks often comes out tooo sweet but this time it was just right.  It's usually a packed house especially at night, they serve hookah sessions with limited flavors. Not to sure about the food though, we saw a few unproperly stored items which probably gave us a red flag but thats just us. Spacious parking area and wonderful customer service.

9-2olyS9k3gmxEXYAO0SQg.text: Small hipster coffee shop in Vegas, the crowd is mixed definitely not LA but they serve Intelligentsia here. Been away from Vegas for 3 years and not much has changed except the black light and art in the bathroom

CjvLSjZ-b5W5e7xu11FTiA.text: I ordered a $12 vegan bowl & added avocado for $2.25 totaling my meal to $14.25. To receive some lettuce & tomato with the avocado that I had to pay extra for for a $15+ meal is absolutely ridiculous. I've gotten food from here many times before & the quality has always been good. I'm just feeling completely ripped off & wont be ordering again

7HLRPu6wIlMhGiBUHt_7EQ.text: MadHouse Coffee is one of those must-see cafes. The kitsch decor, the pastry displays, and their sweet drip setup is all aesthetically pleasing. It's all very cool. The menu, which is posted on a blackboard above the register, is cute, but a bit too crowded. It makes it a little hard to read. They do have a pretty good variety of food and drinks though.  I've tried a couple of their mochas and lattes, and they're either too sweet or too watered down. The hot matcha and hot chai are pretty good even though they are really sweet. They're really thick and creamy, a classic comfort drink for the wintertime. The pour over is decent. The food is good, but a little pricey. I do like how they have plenty of vegan friendly options as far as drinks go.  All in all, definitely worth seeing, but nothing to write home about.

Cqt9qT7_3-0oW-5lJ3IlyA.text: First time visiting this place. Super impressed by thier Intelligencia coffee and their menu. Had a nice conversation with Marco. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stepped into this cool place!

miY201avfD0b5EQPGLXRtg.text: Great coffee and great service!  The avocado toast is slightly spicy and a perfect morning snack.  Our barista, Grace, was polite and friendly and even brought our dog a treat when she delivered the toast.  I'll be back!

They also have Vegan options which is great, because I'm Vegan and late night food is usually a extra challenge as a Vegan.  The reason why I'm giving them only 3 stars is because of two things:  1.  Prices are a bit high for both drinks and food.  There are definitely other places closeby where you can get more food for the money charged.    2.  I love getting salads at MadHouse but at least 3 x now they have messed up on my salad, rather than using Vegan cheese they've used real cheese.  These days it can be hard to tell dairy from vegan cheese, and the times I have accidentally had dairy cheese my stomach has suffered from it.  MadHouse employees - PLEASE PAY ATTENTION WHEN WE REQUEST VEGAN CHEESE!!!!

I got a blended Chocolate, Peanut Butter, Banana drink that was too die for. and I also got a scrambled egg, cheese and bacon croissant sandwich.  Everything was very good, my only complaint was that halfway through eating my sandwich i noticed the eggs were grey in color and that kind of ruined my appetite.   Over all I will definitely be returning even if only to buy some art pieces.

RupNBDnrTUttEnebjsLm_g.text: They really do have Intelligentsia espresso (but not brewed coffee--that was slightly-overroasted nondescript for my taste, but pretty good: seemed like a blend with a lot of something light).  If they didn't have a "one hour of internets for $4 purchase" thing I'd give them five stars.  Oh, what the hell, I can round up instead of down.  I was here five years ago when it had another name.  A little warm inside, but they must have massive A/C bills.  The house-made (nice to see someone that's careful enough to avoid the ubiquitous lie "homemade") "Nutella-misu" was interesting, but I'd have the tiramisu next time.  In Chicago or Minneapolis they'd have a solid four stars but in the great coffee desert that's Las Vegas I rate accordingly.  Also, they're really friendly and nice, though they didn't say much until I did.  Businesslike.

Tdutwhf-c6H6KG2x0gI2dQ.text: I love this coffee house! Awesome music, great coffee,  and friendly customer service.  Though, I bit pricey compared to other coffee houses.

bOeCJs7Y-pcJXsWXzMBXxA.text: Lovely little place! Stopped by the first time today and was pleasantly surprised. Atmosphere reminded me of home back in Long Beach (I moved to Vegas 6 months ago). The guy who took our order was friendly and our drinks were great and caffeinated!

pDgaKsE0wjl2w9MGopMUQA.text: I worked at Starbucks for almost three years so for a while I've boycotted any coffee shop other than Starbucks, or if I did step foot in a non-Starbucks coffee shop, I critiqued everything...  Putting aside my biases...  I went with a friend around 8pm last Monday. Once you walk in, you are surrounded by the delicious scent of coffee & a chill vibe. The coffee shop is pretty small so all the seats in the cafe were occupied, but they do have a spacious patio area **good thing I'm a smoker :)**  I was eyeing the pastries the whole time we were standing in line and was VERY tempted to try one but couldn't decide which. Seriously they have some of the most unique-looking, almost delicate, pretty pastries that I'm sure if I were to pick any of them, they would live up or surpass my expectations. Maybe next time ;P But actually, everything from the mugs, books, decor, etc. was unique. It gave the place it's own spunk =)  Well since that was my first time there, I was browsing the menu above for a good few minutes. The barista asked me if there was anything in particular he could make me even if it wasn't on the menu. I absolutely LOVE iced green tea lattes at Starbucks & I guess at MadHouse he's never made it iced only hot because the matcha wouldn't melt correctly but he would try.   So I settled with a small Iced Soy Green Tea Latte. He took a couple minutes to make it only because he took the initiative to melt the matcha with a little hot water THEN mixing it with cold soy, then icing it. It was superb! Starbucks doesn't even melt it for customers first --they just put the matcha, milk, and ice in a shaker and mix it the best they can with chunks of unmixed matcha powder sitting on the bottom of the cup in the end. But I will say the small size here is the same price as a Venti at Starbucks, for all those that complain Starbucks is over-priced =P  Customer service is HUGE for me so I definitely give MadHouse props for being so customer-oriented. I loved that the barista did the best he could for me. I also loved that he offered to remake it or make me something else if it didn't meet up to par, though I assured him it was fantastic.   I will be visiting every so often :)

Oeybv97BwPcVPkcF503F-Q.text: Greedy when it comes to Wi-Fi. Spent 19 dollars between two people and got a 4-7 dollar time allot for one hour. Drinks are expensive and super sweet.

DdhzCysAHiD030kjcnQhvg.text: It's a little pricey but worth it. They have good breakfast sandwiches and lunch sandwiches. My favorite is the island of Capri. The coffee is good but not great. 02rGtZElbczpddK2u2gKrw.text: This place is rad. The staff are super nice, the aesthetic has an urban, "Banksy" feel to it, and drinks are yummy. Didn't get food but it looks amazing. JSuNde8ksnVlYQLcxmaFsg.text: The coffee is amazing, the gobbler is incredible and Rose is the best manager this place has ever had. But the ginger .......well let's not talk about him.  Uggh....

IQAv8t66dHK_owsr7WgFxA.text: Ordered: Iced-Blended White Mocha 16oz - $4.35 Iced Cafe Mocha on the rocks 24oz - $4.75 Truffle - .99  I had a $10 Groupon for Madhouse, so we went here to study. The place is painted orange and has random tribal style paintings on the walls and lamps. I don't care for the layout very much. All the tables are two seaters, so there is barely any room for your laptops and drinks (beware of knocking something over). There are only 6 tables. That sounds like a lot, but many people take up one table for themselves, so Don and I had to sit at the counter top area along the wall in very wobbly bar stools. We weren't greeted when we came in and no one helped us for about 5 minutes (2 of which was spent just looking at the menu and pastries). One of the girls came up and took my order. She was very friendly and suggested a I get a truffle when my total came up to just $9.10 and didn't charge me for the extra ten cents (truffle was .99). I'm guessing the wifi code must come on the receipts, but I wasn't given one so I didn't get a code. I went up to ask for the wifi code so Don and I could both use the internet, but was only given one card. When we both typed the code into our comps, it said only one can use it at a time, so I just let Don use it. I was just a little annoyed though because we were both customers, even if it was under the same purchase. I guess they're just overly protective of their wifi here. The drinks were very good though. I don't ever order blended beverages because they tend to be expensive and a little too fattening for my taste, but I decided to splurge since I had a Groupon and it's Thanksgiving week anyway ;) The blended iced mocha wasn't too sweet and tasted like it had a hint of hazelnut in it. It was perfectly blended (no ice chunks) and very refreshing. The truffle i picked out was Pralina con tartufo and it tasted just like Polveron! It didn't really strike me as a truffle, but I still enjoyed it and it was only 99 cents.  Overall, I wasn't very impressed with this place. Coffee shop layouts and ambiance are very important to me since I spend most of my time studying in them and I just didn't like the overall feel of this one. When we went in they were playing some sort of experimental shoegaze and it was a little too loud and distracting for my taste. The bright orange on the walls and furry lamp was also too loud, but I understand it's part of their "Madhouse" theme. Since the drinks are good, I was thinking it'd be nice to just sit outside if I ever come back, but only one of the tables outside is covered by an umbrella. The rest of them are all out in the sun, covered by nothing. If anything, I'd come back and use the drive-thru to order a drink and maybe a pastry, but this isn't the type of place I see myself going to so I could study or do work.   Tip *Make sure you really PULL the bathroom door closed before you lock it. Don thought he closed and locked the door...until he got walked in on by one of the baristas. Then he came out and they were all whispering, giggling, and looking at him.

1zcAIh_-FdbRg82hz6U_kQ.text: Used to come here all the time, but the last few times through the drive through I have paid a different amount for iced coffee every single time! A large iced coffee is supposed to be 4.70. Time #1 the guy argued with me that it's 5.79... He thinks I didn't know he was adding his own tip and not telling me? What's worse is he was so flippant about it and quite frankly a brat. The second time I went through it was 5.70. Again, adding a tip without telling me. Let's be real I always tip a dollar anyway, but the fact that they are now doing this and lying about the price of coffee and then also doing it for personal gain is bs. I order the same thing every single time so the price shouldn't be changing. If I go inside and see the usual baristas who are awesome - it's always the same 4.70. Quit lying to me and trying to pull one over on me as well. If you question the price as well the cashier will just bald-face lie. I have no tolerance for that. Don't know if I'll ever go back. There are lots of other coffee joints in the area that will be checking out now.

nMULorq_YO81vHwlDGIUsw.text: You know, I loved the environment. There were a lot of interesting art pieces hanging on the wall and super comfortable chairs to sit on.  The service lacked a smile but it was quick. I got a iced red velvet mocha, and there's not really much to rave about it. It tastes super sweet, but I suppose that was the point. The desserts looked really good though.  There was an outdoor area and it's open late into the night so if you ever need a quick coffee fix, it's definitely convenient.   I may try it again with my boyfriend, but it won't be any time soon.

a25ybwBLI3o6eL-PLlnBAQ.text: There aren't a lot of smaller/mom and pop style coffee houses in Las Vegas (Compared to the Pac. NW where I'm from where is one on almost every corner) so Mad House is a nice choice if you want a break from Starbucks.   They have a ton of options and many more flavors than say Starbucks, which is great if you want to change it up. The reason I'm giving them three stars instead of more is the service. The people are friendly and all but they really, really, I mean REALLY, need some more training. Ordering there is a huge task and they mess up frequently. In fact, the only saving grace is the kids are the window are nice so it's hard to get super fed up with them always making mistakes.   My last two times there my order has been messed up. My second time there my order was messed up... it's happened several times.   They also don't seem to keen on the common coffee lingo. "I want a medium iced-latte or a medium coconut latte" usually turns into them asking a dozen questions just to get the order right. If I order an 'iced latte' they then ask, 'what flavor did you want?' 'you wanted that iced?'... last time I ordered a non-fat coconut latte I got 'so you want a latte with coconut syrup?'... um, yes, when someone orders a latte with a flavor, that means they want that flavor of syrup. Trying to order multiple drinks at once is even worse.   I would like to think the kids just haven't been trained that well, but it really makes me just want to hit Starbucks when ordering is such a hassle. But the coffee is good and they have a drive through window, which is nice in the morning on the way to work, but even that is loosing it's charm.  When I first went there, the drive through was quick. But that also seems to be slowing down. Not sure if it's due to, again, staff just isn't trained well and it takes them a long time to make the drinks, or if like this AM, the girl at the window was busy flirting with the guy in his car after handing him his drink. It's cool to be friendly, but when someone goes through a drive through, they are doing so to be quick. Not sit there for 10 minutes while you have a giggle session with the cute guy ordering coffee.   This place could be a go-to if they just fixed a few things.

gmh8_VcQ-lE1A9GQDAEA2Q.text: Situated across the street from the sprawling Desert Breeze park off Desert Inn Road, MadHouse Coffee is certainly a spot to indulge in your coffee cravings. The best part? You can do it at any time. This cozy little spot is open 24 hours a day and if you somehow happen to end up in the mood for one of their red velvet mochas or a "More Cowbell" sandwich at 3 a.m., then fret not, for your solution is down the road. The Only downside? The second MadHouse spot, off of Eastern and Pebble stays open from 6 a.m. - 10 p.m., but that's still good enough for most. The atmosphere of MadHouse certainly lives up to its namesake -- or at least the interior decorations do. Ranging from bizarrely painted tables to hairy lampshades hanging from above and a very odd rendering of the Mona Lisa, even the hookah placed off on a shelf adds to it all. I'm only left wondering where the Cheshire cat has run off to. The best part of MadHouse comes in the form of their decadently delicious drinks. I had the "Monkey Mocha", which is made up of a blend of peanut butter, banana and mocha, then topped with whipped cream and some chocolate syrup. Yes, it was just as perfect as it sounds. Other indulgent offerings are on the menu as well, ranging from the red velvet mocha to the "Mad Cow," a hazelnut latte. Since the coffee shop also emphasizes its bakery and sandwich creations, I decided to give one a try and went with the "Island of Capri." Featuring the wholesome goodness of focaccia bread, freshly sliced mozzarella, tomatoes, balsamic vinegar and oregano, I suddenly felt like I was at some cafe off the coast of Italy, before looking out the window and remembering the sad truth of, well, being stuck in Vegas. While there isn't much space for studying, nor any tables fit for a large group study session, this is the perfect spot to quickly grab a drink (its drive-thru equipped!) at any time of day, and if you're hungry too, well, look no further. Originally written for and published in The Rebel Yell: unlvrebelyell.com/2012/0...

k6Hdi1QPC0Ie41tNgMztKg.text: MOST IMPORTANT: they don't know what a cappuccino is.  They do not know how to make a cappuccino. I was unhappy that my cappuccino had no foam. They claimed that cappuccinos are traditionally prepared without foam and went on to describe the differences between a Starbucks cappuccino and a traditional cappuccino, condescending to me like I was some coffee-commoner. I asked them to make the cappuccino correctly with foam and they corrected me again.   ACTUALLY a cappuccino is traditionally 1/3 espresso, 1/3 steamed milk, and 1/3 wet foamed milk. The difference between a latte and a cappuccino is the milk content. Latte has a lot of milk, whereas cappuccino is a strong coffee" They kept asking if I was confused and I wanted a latte with extra foam (uh a latte should have NO FOAM) which is not a cappuccino and that is what I ultimately received.  It's pretty pathetic that they don't know what a cappuccino is, and that they have the gaul to act like they do and correct customers.  The pistachio drink is full of some awful green syrup, artificially flavoured. They offer a lot of these sort of awful artificially flavoured frappuccino types drinks. If they were flavoured with real ingredients instead of cheap syrups I bet they'd be delicious! Their sandwiches are pretty good. Not a great quality of bread or meat. 67JT7YlTU7Frhth9oZbpMg.text: TL;DR: I loved the Crushed Coconut Mocha - Blended. Super delicious. Mocha plus cocunut, who would have known? Plus, they have signs that say "Fuck Trump" on the restroom. Who wouldn't approve of this place?   I stubmled upon this place based on the reviews and was interested in checking it out. Once you walk in, you'll notice the relaxed and chill vibe. Lots of cool artwork on the walls, including two monkeys that have bananas as guns. The menu was hard to read, but I knew what I wanted even before I got here. Staff was chill too - no issues.   I came on a pretty quiet day, so the wait wasn't too bad. I ordered and got my drink in less than 4-5 minutes. If you need WiFi access, you have to ask for an individualized code.   For a medium-sized drink, I paid about $7+ with tip. It's kind of on the expensie side, but it's pretty worth-it. I read another drink that compared this to Starbucks, lol. It's not the same.  Overall, I have no regrets coming here. I wasn't there long but it seems like a great place to meet up with friends and enjoy the company paired with a wide variety of foods and drinks.  I had a Nutella white chocolate mocha blended drink.  It wasn't too bad, but definitely sweet.  If I didn't have diabetes, I do now! My friend got a regular coffee and carrot cake.  That was one of the best carrot cakes I have tried in years.   If you're looking for a new and fun place to try, take a step inside Madhouse coffee and enjoy the sites and sounds it has to offer.

mVEFfjvttEUkss-9rWY49Q.text: ***Updated 4/5 Stars - 6/30/18 at 6:35pm***  Marco the owner reached out to me after reading my 3 Star apologizing and asking if there was anything he could do to make it up. I believe I was accidentally overcharged since the burger should have only cost $13.99 + tax but we all make mistakes, right?   However, THAT is what a great business owner is all about, hence the reason for my new 4/5 star review. It seems he truly cares about the overall customer experience and wants to understand how to be better, I love that.   ***Original Review 3/5 Stars***  I drove 20 minutes out of my way to visit this place because I heard through the grape vine that they had the impossible burger here. I should have read most of the reviews about the price - eek!  PROS: + They carry the impossible burger + It was pretty tasty 3.5/5 + Non-vegan place with vegan options  CONS: - $18 for ONE impossible burger  - Out of my way (I live in Hender-tucky, ah-hem I mean Henderson) - Drive-thru lady overcharged me at first (seemed like an honest mistake) - Not that I need more fries but it only comes with like five lol  I always love when non-vegan places have vegan options so cudos to you for that; however, I definitely wouldn't go out of my way again for the impossible burger, especially when Vegenation is right around the corner.

NfySVudhmyRN3Q5K6ZK7mw.text: Decent place to hang and have some coffee with friends. Quick bites aren't bad but this place is pretty small and kind of average. More of a kickback coffee shop, great to hang out at night. Wouldn't recommend getting the hookah though.

3KAark4E-eNN4OEmk1lu6A.text: Madhouse is a GREAT local haunt for everyone, from the quiet bookworm to the pop-punk freelance blogger. Always chock full of laid-back millennials like myself, this 24/7 coffee shop is queer-friendly and full of delicious meals, treats, and blends. With an environment straight out of The L Word, you really can't go wrong here - whether you're seeking a quick caffeine fix or looking for a place to hit the books. I recommend trying an iced chai (not to worry - they have milk substitutes!) with their stuffed sweet potato, which is divine!

_RNJLWVckfGzx2Gc5BSW7g.text: I used to frequent this place often as I really liked their iced coffee.  Talk about a business totally going downhill.  Prices are up and quality is down.  I think the owner must have developed a bad case of Trump Derangeament Syndrome with all the anti Trump messages on full display.  They even had a naked trump sitting on the counter in front of where you drink and eat.  Plus what kind of owner thinks its a tastefull decision to sell chocolate penis desserts in their display case?  It seems stupid to me owners will interject their business into politics when all you're looking to do is buy a quality product at a fair price.  I think a business owner can put any sign up he wants and make any political stands he wants.  I have no problem with that. sJs-mPvPb0LHQxHEkH2pTA.text: This is a great coffee shop with an artsy vibe. The drinks are awesome and you won't have the feeling of a corporate coffee house. The food here is also very good.

5_NgPLzKAAeSXoG5m2bxQw.text: This 24 hour coffee house has great potential but falls short where it matters, consistent quality of drinks and customer service.  Madhouse does offer a wide selection of non-dairy milks, great for people with allergies. I usually opt for coconut milk but they also have almond, hemp and of course the ubiquitous soy. These options are great to see and I wish more coffee shops would follow suit.  Prices for some items are a bit steep, something that would be perfectly acceptable if the quality was consistently high and service on point.  Unfortunately the dodgy employee training and high turnover rate here result in drink quality that is hit or miss at best and customer service that is essentially nonexistent.   My usual drink here for months has been a blended Matcha with coconut milk. When made properly it's excellent. When ordering at Madhouse the barista's do not usually repeat the order back to you to confirm, they simply say "ok" and start making your drinks. After getting several Matchas made with regular milk when I ordered coconut milk (and paid the upcharge for it), I started asking the person who made the drink if they used coconut milk before accepting it. After I started asking I found that they used regular milk by mistake more than half the time. If you get the wrong milk the drink has to be remade and it's done in a hurry. Every time that I've had drinks remade here they are not properly blended until smooth, filled with obnoxious chunks of ice.  After getting three drinks in a row on three separate visits made with the wrong milk by mistake and then remade without being properly blended, I decided to go back and raise the issue with management.  My last drink at madhouse was a blended matcha that I was unable to drink because it had large chunks of ice that got stuck in the straw every time I tried to take a drink. I happened to get the drink at the drive through on a Friday morning with some friends on our way out of town for a road trip. After already holding everyone up by getting my drink remade due to the wrong milk being used by mistake, I wasn't about to drive back and have them re-blend it yet again. Instead, I went back with my receipt on the following Monday when I was back in Vegas to see if I could get a replacement. I was told by "Ricky" who claimed to be an owner (I have no idea if he really was) that there was nothing they could do. He said that if they replaced drinks with just a receipt that everyone would take advantage of it to get free drinks. Maybe some people would do that, but what about the rest of us? This kind of policy will just alienate their paying customers whenever they encounter a problem and have a legitimate complaint.  With better employee training and a more customer-centric approach to service, this would be a great little coffee shop. As is, Madhouse is probably best avoided, especially if you have dairy allergies. I'll be making my matchas at home now and saving the $11 I was normally paying to Madhouse for them so regularly. Shame.

kxzLl1etYXt1yj7jlrUR3A.text: I love madhouse. The staff is always friendly, knowledgable, and helpful. The atmosphere is great, the place is filled with art and cool decor. Coffee and snacks are good (some snacks are a little hit or miss but the staff can help you make a good choice), and it seems like there's always something new to try. I worked remotely here once when my heat was out and it was fine except I went outside to make phone calls because they do have (good, not annoying) music playing. Would be a good place to study or write, or just hang out, if you can handle background noise and music. They have a patio so even when they're busy half the crowd is outside and there is usually somewhere to sit.

25cMjpTEckcveFAYgGIpvQ.text: If you enjoy quality coffee do not go here!!! Especially through the drive-through. I drove up on a Sunday morning there was nobody in line and I waited over 10 minutes! I ordered a regular latte. What I got was a cup of hot milk and some espresso. No body to this coffee at all. So bad i threw it out.

1MG3P4-X8qjytAnfP1ZLXQ.text: In all fairness, I must disclose that I think of The Cheers Theme Song when I think of my relationships at Madhouse Coffee.  The crew at madhouse are delightful. They are individuals who speak freely, wear their own clothes, and are permitted to wear there piercings and hair how they like---though it is a 'madhouse' it's never excessively wild. I find it entertaining when a car comes through the drive thru and one of the guys puts on a silly voice for the customer on the other end. It is all good fun--- Marco, the owner is Genovese and his northern Italian styles have proved he is savvy in coffee, music, decor, and more importantly; business. He has hired a great staff. The girls are all cute and sweet. The guys are all friendly and hard working. Though the girls work harder :) Several of them are getting good at following Marcos expectation of "Latte Art"  Looser and tastier than Starbucks, (the closest Starbucks is inside of a Grocery store) Madhouse is quaint and available. The drive thru is quick. The table arrangement is comfy and flowing.. I never feel boxed in when I am in the dining room. The patio is also a nice place to relax. The occasional rush of cars west or eastbound on DI generally leaves more silence around than traffic noise. Basking in the sun overlooking Desert Breeze Soccer Park, sometimes a hookah bowl might help to pepper a warm moment.

4D3EDtw0nm8rKM0dMMnZ1w.text: awesomeness....raw vegan brownie and numi organic teas. and choice of almond milk and other milk and soy alternatives.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. organic camomile tea latte w almond milk

2dY7NDllCKndLB_ZIWisBw.text: I'm a pretty basic guy when it comes to coffee. Iced coffee, a couple of shots of espresso, a little cream and sugar. I generally go to Starbucks out of convenience. Although I appreciate better coffees, it's not always an option and Starbucks is everywhere. I realized how truly awful their coffee is after tasting coffee from Madhouse. They also had croissant bread pudding and Nutellamisu! This place is awesome!

NYqR94XnuK-WFcEiThyPiQ.text: Gave our order at the speaker. Pulled up to the window waited 20 mins and the person came to the window and said 'sorry we did not get your order' , so we drove off.

d_gCajHPOlCDwEcX-V3kOg.text: I'll start with one of the best features: open 24 hours a day!  There's no lock on the front door!  This place is cute, crafts some great coffee & tea beverages, knowledgeable staff, and some fun/tasty food.  I was here for the CMYE and enjoyed a cup of basic coffee & an almond croissant.  The coffee was strong but medium in character, which is good for the "house" coffee.  The barista asked if I needed room for cream; always good.  The croissant was almost perfection: flaky, lightly sweet, buttery, & with good almond flavor without being overpowering.  FYI, my benchmark is the almond croissant from the Orange Inn in Laguna Beach.    I believe there is free WiFi, but that may now be de rigueur in most coffee shops.  Marco, the owner, is very friendly & pleasant & works nights (mostly).    This may be my new 4am drive thru spot if I continue this downward spiral of staying out late on school nights.  If you're in the neighborhood, it is late, and you come across all peckish, I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.

lHBEtDzmfpM2kkyjNSFpxA.text: A few nights ago, my wife needed a place with free wi-fi that was open late. So we decided to give MadHouse a try.  We each got a sandwich. I got the Green Card on ciabatta, and my wife got The Madhouse on focaccia. They were both pretty decent. My wife also got a Mad Max blended coffee drink which was quite tasty.  It's a pretty small place and the seats are only moderately comfortable. However, I like the interior and the workers were very friendly. They have a selection of several board games as well.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green card and Madhouse sandwiches

GpLj38ASw1xvrINBWiNdNA.text: The atmosphere is hip and the staff is friendly. The coffee was average and so was the food. I'd like to say I'd try it again but it's not likely.

UdZGOoaMxc8-b9Z8zzuFWA.text: Yummy sandwiches!! I had the gobbler with lettuce and tomato! It was very tasty especially the creamy cranberry sauce. I just wish they had red onion, I asked but they don't even carry any onions at all! Open 24 hrs is a plus!

c6Wzk2UleGDMY_Rr1a6nlw.text: I used to love hanging out here. The sandwiches were always delicious, and the blended beverages were enough for one day's worth of dessert. Yes, the prices are on the high end of the spectrum, but they're totally worth it.   Why two stars you ask?  I loved this place so much, I decided that I wanted to work here. I thought I was hired when I was asked to come in to start training. Three days of training for two hours went by. After the third day, nobody told me when to come in again. What ruined the whole thing for me was how I felt so out of place from the rest of the baristas. I asked twice without a reply when to come in without receiving a response until a week later. Without letting me finish my training, I was let go. Very unprofessional.  They claim to care so much about their customers. At the end of the day, we're all customers, whether we're employed by them or not. I'm not coming back here.

rC7EenWJljcv-DVXkHqdnQ.text: My all time favorite coffee shop. Open 24 hours!! They have great drinks, my favorite cold beverage is the Grasshopper with almond milk. My favorite hot beverage is the Mad Cow. I really appreciate all the different milk alternatives available. Almond, help, coconut, and soy. The food is really great too. I love the artwork around the place, which you can buy. I love all the character and the outside patio is a place I could stay all day, watching the cars go by.

ypaKkpHF-6-8yyNzKJn6ng.text: Favorite place to study. This place will not disappoint. Great staff and fresh coffee. Cool atmosphere!

p_gucE_ke8IvuGuiCyMmVA.text: One of the best cappuccinos in town! Easy. & their drive-thru is open 24/7! I will go out of my way to get this specific drink from them. It's over 25 mins from my house. I'm not sure about their other drinks. I'm somewhat of a purist when it comes to coffee. But, I do appreciate that they use Intelligentsia Black Cat roast. I highly recommend it!

9ZwEtyt9R6J6AFGAnAyCOA.text: They have so many drink options and I love it! The atmosphere is great and I love that they have a chalkboard in the bathroom so you can leave messages for everyone. Haha!

SM9rfRO1D0DhBS2LNMKdrw.text: Let me start by saying the coffee is on point!!!! So delicious! The owner was really friendly & the atmosphere was really awesome. The cheesus Christ & The gay garden boy were pretty awesome too! There are only a few things that didn't go so well.they messed up 3 things on our order all of which were fixed as soon as they were told, there was no high chair, & my friend said the chicken in the sandwich she ordered tasted & had the texture of pre-made frozen chicken. For the price of the sandwiches the chicken should have been fresh in my opinion. The last thing to happen is, we were given the wrong sandwich, when the server realized what he did after going back inside the cafe, he came out and grabbed it from my table, apologized and took it to the correct table. I had not touched the sandwich yet, but he did not know that because he went back inside. I would have been upset if I was the other customer getting the sandwich. All in all service needs a little work but, I will defiantly go back for the coffee it's seriously delicious!
