The food is unbelievable, especially the sandwiches: the same goes for the coffee. Really, if you're looking for an authentic feel good coffee vibe roll through. It's dumb lit.

fNNaOAhirm70o1GYuE13Hg.text: So I am in law school, no big deal. I had a final exam at 9AM last Saturday and on the way to school I decide to stop for a coffee and a breakfast sandwich. I am starving and I have a three hour exam so I need something to satiate myself.   I get the breakfast sandwich and while driving start eating. A big long brown hair. YUCK. No hairnets Madhouse?  I am thinking of suing for punitive damages.

vPVB0ELXPZmDa10uYzKrmA.text: We love Madhouse. I get the Mad Cow with extra Mad and Hemp Milk. My daughter and my boyfriend love the Monkey Mocha with Hemp Milk. Sometimes ordering can be a pain with the speaker being right by the street and all but they always have a smile and great customer service. Love the decor too but we mostly stick with drive thru.

Nj2hcFziSlme0ckMN_V_Dg.text: Normally, I really like this place. But, this morning, I came and ordered a drink with soy milk and I don't know if maybe it was busy and someone forgot but I can tell it wasn't made with soy. Mainly because I've gotten sick multiple times at work and my breathing is really wheezy. I should have double checked it was made with soy myself but I also trusted they made it correct. It won't keep me from coming back but this is something that definitely needs to be made aware of.

553my2pJB8POD4lyj4C4xQ.text: This is the 2nd time I've tried this place and something went wrong both times. Ordered delivery tonight, the Rabbit Habit and the sandwich did not come with all the toppings! It's missing the huge iceberg lettuce. It's a vegetarian sandwich with 4 toppings and 1 of them is missing. Unacceptable! Plus the sundried tomatoes are SO hard that I can't even bite into them! Seriously not over exaggerating. It's 3am and I want to eat so I'm not trying to bash this but I can't even eat finish after this one bite! So frustrating that this sandwich with delivery was $16 and this is what I get!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CU_rRt5qMbezn8pcAVVLGA.text: This is my neighborhood coffee shop. I LOVE everything about it -- from the ambient to the coffee to the fact that they are open 24/7!  I can only comment on their vanilla latte and their teas because those are the only drinks I like to have. Their pastries are nice, too although I would like to see a greater variety. I haven't eaten any of their entrees, yet; can't wait to try their gnocchi, the owner is Italian so I'm sure the dish is quite legit.  N.B.: If you are a Trump-supporter, you will feel... out of place.

gRs6DEm9y87yTZsUm83zBQ.text: What a cute little coffee shop.  Coffee and mango smoothies were delicious.   Didn't like the swearing staff while my kids were there though.   Place has a "rebellious" too cool for society feel, complete with stickers everywhere, a naked Trump doll by the register, and other Socialistic type trendy art.  To each his or her own but I doubt I'll return.  If your craving coffee and trendiness divey-rebellion this place is for you.

fUhYxX69Aw_wH3x_0goPxg.text: Four stars is pretty accurate for this place, but I vote three because of prices.   After ordering an iced coffee (we were presented with large and medium as choices), a red velvet mocha iced in small, an egg cheddar and sausage croissant and a chocolate croissant.... And paying $20 bucks.... I'm going to have to file this under "when I have too much money to spend on a big coffee and small breakfast"  Everything was delicious, employees were friendly, good atmosphere... But man, we were shocked by the 20 bucks. I guess it probably almost on par with Starbucks, but they're quite brilliant at not offering up the prices on the food. All food items don't have prices, whereas in Starbucks you can purposely avoid crazily prices items. We thought, how much could this be? Our jaw dropped at $20, and with the iPad they use for checkout, no receipt was provided... Too bad. (I later found out my girlfriend accidentally chose the "no receipt" button when choosing options on the iPad).  Could have asked separately for the receipt, but we were still sticker shocked and just walked away.   If you have the money, want to pay Starbucks like prices for some better specialty drinks, and don't mind paying a lot for small amounts of pretty good food, this is your place!  Like Starbucks, I'm sure if you come in and keep it mega basic like a coffee and a muffin, you'll be alright, but what was I thinking agreeing to a hot egg sandwich?!  My biggest drawback, and why I give this 3 instead of 4 stars, is the VALUE of the place. We spent 20 some bucks at Babystacks Cafe and got a huge breakfast with unlimited coffee refills. Delicious pancakes, a server to take care of us, all for similar price as madhouse. Even worse, at the German Bread Bakery, we got double the food with a coffee and spent more than 60% less than at Madhouse. For awesome quality pastries.   I just can't justify spending this amount on coffee and small sandwiches. Also, we spent 20 bucks and got a voucher for 2 hours on wifi... I thought ok great, girlfriend put it in her iPhone to skype with her family, and I went to put it in mine... And apparently one user was all it was good for. I probably could have asked for another code, but why so stingy on wifi?

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar and sausage egg croissant and chocolate croissant with red velvet mocha and iced coffee!

72LuV9tnC-3U2RP8T4DzEg.text: This is one of my regular spots for coffee. There are quite a lot of reasons why I come here regularly. The coffee itself is amazing; definitely some of the best coffee I have ever had. The different experimental flavor mixtures they have going on are all fantastic. I also go there regularly because the atmosphere is super cool. They always have great music playing, and the general vibe of the place is very warm and welcoming. Finally, I frequent this place because all of the staff that work there are very friendly and awesome. I could not recommend this place more. Check it out!!!!

GCzSMNI0mKLYjvK79uB-AQ.text: Love this place. Clientele reminds me of coffee houses around college campuses.  Great staff, clean environment, wide variety of coffees and eats.  Open 24/7.  Addicted to their Revelvet Mocha Combo with a chocolate croissant on the side.  Great outdoor patio.

yU_nU-7moTKpVjUJTZ4obQ.text: I came in , I told the lady it's our first time .  She didn't  say a word at least give us her suggestion. she placed our order on the table she didn't say anything.   I ordered grasshopper , it was delicious . I'll order less sweet next time .  The owner was very nice to reach out to me right away and fix the bad experience .

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

co_q9E2IJD7QLy1AAyv0Gg.text: Been here 3 times a week since I found this place 4 weeks ago!  Perfect for me because it's close to my job but I'm pleasantly surprised how good the coffee sandwiches and most of all the customer service is!   I'll keep coming here as long to get my caffeine fix :)

b2bv6W2235iZFAzMEywDmQ.text: REVIEW UPDATE:  (Typing fast. Apologies for grammar)   -why is every negative review (143 to be precise) under the "Reviews Not Currently Recommended" section? Are businesses able to pay for this?-   The owners of this place need to provide their contact information (an email, etc.) I just spent 14 minutes in the drive through for a cup of coffee. Clearly, the only thing they care about is profit and not the quality of their service. This is unreal. If I could have, I would have left the drive through but I was stuck in between cars and now, because of your absolutely shite slow service, I am later for work. What exactly do you plan on doing for your EVERY DAY customers for this inconvenience? These delays are not isolations; they are every day issues. Even your employees do not care to apologize because as the gentleman said: "I ask for help every day and they just ignore me. Sometimes I am here by myself. Talk to Rose." Well, ROSE, for the money we throw on the $5 coffees and $9 croissants here, you can afford to hire another person!   WHY are your employees taking Uber orders when the have a drive through full of angry customers already?  By the way, if you can't tell, I'm PISSED off and I am especially pissed off that I managed to sleep 2 hours, leave for work 15 min earlier than usual and now be late. I come to Madhouse almost ever my morning and this was my last.   Original Review:  Admittedly, the 1 star is not for the quality but for the service, rather. It is just WAY TOO SLOW. I come here way too often and know it's not just an isolated incident here or there on busy day. It's slow on slow days! There is just no sense of urgency it seems like or perhaps the owner needs to put more people on during rush hours.   Also, the prices are just outrageous. One size latte or cappuccino is $5 and $7 for a breakfast item. Those are Strip prices. Granted, every now and then they send a $5 coupon.   I love the staff and the quality but I just dread waiting at that window and my bill.

CPO5IKRx3VHJ1kSZZ-wNPw.text: i usually always love this place but today i ordered at the drive thru and got the threesome w/ avocado and my friend got the white chocolate nutella mocha frappe . the girl at the window seemed a bit rude but it wasn't a big deal cause maybe she was having a bad day or something. then when i got my order i tipped her still. after i left i realized she didn't add the avocado which is super annoying cause she did hear me cause she charged me the $1.75 for it . honestly regret even tipping now .

Americano coffee for him. - The drinks hit the spot. - Funky little coffee house at Desert Inn and Durango in the Von's shopping plaza. - They have hookahs here! - Keith Haring theme is kinda retro and very cool. - I'll be back to try the "Michael Jackson" drink:  white chocolate and regular chocolate coffee drink. - I'm a fan of the red velvet mocha.

n6zJTjBKgsaBAZZ8UvacDQ.text: Great place. Good food, STRONG coffee, friendly staff.

ylIezZRXQZp9086I31BEig.text: Delightful little coffee house- get your caffeine and sugar fix here, 24/7, complete with free wifi. Fairly creative coffee offerings, pastries and desserts made in-house, cheerful and friendly staff, and great music.  Decor is colorful and welcoming, lots of patrons sitting around using the wifi with their various devices. Would feel comfortable coming here on a weekend to get some grading or lesson planning out of the way, but I imagine it may be difficult to find a seat sometimes- seems to be a popular place and it's a bit small.  Went for the red velvet mocha- tasty and unique but a bit too sweet for me. Raided the dessert case and snagged 3 different macarons and (at BF's insistence) a small order of the tira-mousse. The macarons were large and perfect, and I really appreciated the bright colors and variety of flavors- green tea machta, white chocolate raspberry, and mint chocolate chip, in order of preference. Kind of a sugar overkill for me, could not have more than a nibble of each but really liked what I had. The tira-mousse was too much. I didn't like the texture or flavor, but BF and his friend really liked it and could have had more.   Though I liked this place, I'm not big on sugar or caffeine, and found this place a little pricey- for the above order, with a moderate tip, came to over $20. Ouch.

4GY6hfatv0pQKhRDGBNHQA.text: The drinks were good, service was okay but drinks were pretty pricey.   Lots of people hanging out smoking hookah and playing on their computers. Pretty cool college like atmosphere. Even the staff seemed to fit the mood. They were nice enough but not super friendly.   The matcha green tea blended was good, tasted like green tea ice cream which I love. My fiance's monkey mocha was very flavorful and a nice blend of chocolate, peanut butter and bananas. Though it was good I did think it was pretty pricey. Two 16 oz. drinks for almost $13. A bit much in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mad max and green tea
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Matcha green tea blended and monkey mocha.

fUwkRs7BU4ITBvBxE1IQpA.text: When it's not crowded, this place is great. Espresso is high quality, staff is friendly. Wifi isn't convenient - have to get an Internet card with a time limit, based on dollar amount spent. Sometimes they add a key to the bathrooms and sometimes the music is straight bass. I've always assumed they were trying to make it less accommodating so people don't stay too long. We don't have many coffee spots 24/7 in Vegas - esp not good coffee... so I tend find myself back at Madhouse when Sambalatte is closed. I've been coming here for over 10 years, back when it was an It's A Grind without the odd decor and the loads of people. Writing a review now because they'll give me 50% off my next coffee and I want a next coffee.

IX-fTzR9fg8vsiykiROjQw.text: OK so I got to check this place out and I have to say I did really like the coffee I got which was the pistachio latte also known as the mustachio! However I bought two drinks today and somehow cost me $14! How in the hell two drinks cost me $14 makes absolutely no sense at all so as much as I like the coffee I most likely will not be going back.

JZ4kmahMHETkGStgdrUu-A.text: I love MadHouse and my favorite drink is of course the Monkey Mocha!  I come from San Diego, CA to get that coffee and the MMocha.  Everyone else there has been really great and personable.  Awesome food and even when there is no where to sit, people will make room.  It is just that homey of a feeling.  I highly recommend it!

hWc-NLrM6thSGgKJunFzMg.text: Came here with my best friend for a little coffee date to catch up.   It is a very cute place in the southwest area. I ordered a nutella white chocolate iced. Wow it was delicious. I could not have enough of it. Now I am craving one writing this review. We were in there for quite  a while just chit chatting. I ordered the Nutella White Mocha and hubby ordered his Iced vanilla latte and one sip, we were in coffee heaven. They were both delicious!!! We definitely found our coffee spot every time we visit Vegas.

0n4Ys34SmH532-ijAYiwig.text: I'm so mad that  I didn't come here sooner to not only try the coffee, but to study. Usually I have a VERY hard time studying in public places, and I stay away from parking at coffee shops for hours on end. Madhouse has a great vibe, and everything about the shop is just right.  I also never order blended drinks, but Madhouse has THE BEST blended Nutella drink on the menu, so it's hard to be "good" and not order it. My friends all ordered food, and for a small coffee shop, I was super impressed with the presentation and how tasty everything was.   The only thing that I don't like is that you have to keep asking for a new wifi password every two hours. I'm bummed that I didn't find this place at the beginning of the school year!!

RhJcdwn29wSBaIayDKAELg.text: Make sure you try their Dic* chocolate treat that reads "Dic k made by les*bians Under WiFi setting that says "Trump is a cu*nt" set up by one of the employees as no one else was in there besides us and them  What a bunch of freaks  Sad.

pPFdovhjud_zSotq0Z-BXg.text: Excellent cheesus christ with added fresh tomatoes!  The crushed coconut blended with whip cream and an extra scoop of mocha was incredible!!  I think it'll give that popular coffee shop Sbucks a run for their money!    The delivery was spot on!!!

gZgfeJDJaoxXE0PfEbzWaw.text: Always a great coffee drink and sweet treat! Stellar service and customization options.

lpla4k4Pw4ZpYGK4OkL2sg.text: Cool hangout and definitely different food choices but the prices are a bit on the high side as well.

3MCFnB5Ktn_oJ7I6z39O9Q.text: I ordered an Italian Hot Chocolate. Had I know I was going to receive a cup of chocolate, I would not have wasted my money. I went out of my way to visit madhouse and I'm upset and I feel ripped off. Because I am pregnant and cannot have anything with caffeine late at night, I thought the hot chocolate would be a good choice. It was much too hot to enjoy when I received it, and I had driven about 20 minutes away before I realized that it was a cup of chocolate. NOT A BEVERAGE. This was also my brother's first time here and he ordered the same thing and we both had to take it home and alter it to make it an actual beverage. I want our money back.

EvRYmJxIdxt1k3nGJ6-Msw.text: It's a cool hang out spot if u really need to since it's 24/7 , music isn't always the best but if ur into it that's cool to. Only good drink is the Nutella one .

cMGHtVlQStf0s802qREmGw.text: Avocado toast is super dank. Friendly service and delicious coffee. Thank you Madhouse! Love you long time

bAgy30GkLj3rKFLsUeH-GA.text: Went early this morning, only one male employee there. We ordered coffee in the ceramic cup since we were planning to stay for a bit and we order some pastries.   At beginning I can tell he employee was bit annoyed by our presence(how I can tell? From my one of my line of work as hiring behavioral assessment) I hd a feeling this one is going for an argument later for some oddly reason. (Keep reading...)  After the coffee comes in paper cups.. I was kind of wonder did't we ask for the ceramic cup? We kind of just let it slide this time. Later, since pastries never really show, we went to the counter and pick them up ourself  shortly later my partner asked for plastic cutlery and napkins, the employee went and accusing my partner been wrongfully and rudely asking for it!  If I am not mistaken this is a food and beverage establishment?! And asking for plastic cutlery is been rude to employee like "Do you hv silverware and napkins?"  The employee went fully engaged with my partner. Saying something about we hv to be nice to him because he is serving us!?   I told my parent let's go and leave and never come back here and not forget to let the world knows what hd happen here.   All and all, pastries were good, coffee is bit on the warm side but good, customer service is a zero or negative. Table service? got a bit of it.   The employee never brought us the food other than two paper cups coffee which we did request ceramic cup he agreed during the order and forgot during the delivery.   For the quality of pastries , I might consider go back for it. For quality of services of any kind, I don't think I ever go back nor recommend anyone to experience the level of customer service that my partner and I received today.

T79PDEZZedWInkXBEzIvig.text: I've been coming here since I was 16 (I'm 22 now) and I'll be coming here as long as I can. Such an incredible spot!! The vibes are always good, the employees are always super sweet, and the drinks/food are always on point. The owner is super friendly and the energy is so positive in there, I've never had a bad experience

qXpB4FAhw__mPUKiGHOGdg.text: Good coffee, the variety was plentiful. Little "edgy" atmosphere, always fun, and the food selection looked great; many vegan options. Nice and friendly staff.

iQb5PWDKsf9eq2hdHUAXeA.text: Never a caffeine miss at MadHouse! I'm addicted to the walnut sauce in the sweet potato food item! The drinks with intelligence coffee beans all pretty phenomenal!

mMzD4BYAMEhCX4FKUuwh0Q.text: Always get the avocado toast and cold brew. Great vegetarian options and the staff is always super nice.

_HqNYRB1j7Wq4NJx2YiwbA.text: such an amazing place and cute environment! everyone is so nice and welcoming and i really enjoyed my drink and everything was amazing

xxFpYGU74xc__VJSq-TaqA.text: ***UPDATE**** The owner reached out to me and has been very kind in helping with my issue which I appreciate very much.   This place used to be my favorite place to get coffee and a quick bite to eat but recently my experience with them hasn't been the best. Whenever I go through the drive through it seems like they do not listen when you are ordering and make you repeat the order at the window more than once because they seemingly can't understand it the first time. I went to madhouse recently and the girl at the window got our order mixed up even though we repeated it like three times. She gave us ALOT of attitude when we told her and said "I guess I'll remake it" with a lot of attitude. I do not know where they hire these people but they definitely do not belong in customer service.

g-Qg33XmuXqYRhf_Wst6SA.text: Really liked this place. I was surprised to find a coffee shop that was open late. I was craving some coffee to help me stay up and study. IT was a very chic and hip atmosphere, it was really busy and lots of traffic especially it being late around midnight. I really like the design of the interior, many quotes on the walls however that bathroom is a totally different world! I ordered a large iced Michael Jackson, which came in this gigantic cup. I drink coffee all the time and I can't remember the last time I got a caffene rush, however this definitley gave me the push to stay up and complete assignments, study and fulfil a full 12 hour rotation shift the next day.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mega size Michael Jackson iced coffee
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoyed this GIGANTIC cup of iced Michael Jackson! Perfect for pulling my all nighter study sesh!

BkfO4zCAy0tv3TOZgz-9wQ.text: VERY OVER PRICED! A regular cup of coffee is $2.75?!? Come on! Sure, the coffee is descent but if I wanted to pay that much for a coffee, I could go to Starbucks! The food is awful & options are extremely limited. The nutritional value you will get will be a 1 out of 10. seriously, don't go here!

xikkCKvomByUGqFE17JzgA.text: In my experience this place has very good drinks but as of late the service has been absolutely horrible ...there should be no reason why someone sits in a car for 15-20 minutes to get an iced Americano.

wgFsGOg1SGwcafb7ZqAleg.text: Love the coffee, food, and prices, but I have to agree with a couple other reviews. There is always someone new there, and this time there was a new girl in the drive through. All I have to say is her customer service needs to be worked on. She couldn't remember which drink was which, and threw one of sandwiches in the trash so we had to wait ANOTHER 10 minutes for our other sandwich. Then as we drove away we realized we never got our card back, so when I called, she hung up with, "K bye." These might not seem like a big deal, but when you work in the hospitality industry, the little things matter. And all of these were very annoying. They definitely need to work on their customer service skills a little more.

rhc8kazSmSmJEiBEn3SPVA.text: WALKED IN, greeted right away.  ordered the Iced Chai.  best iced chai in my life.  so good i want to get another one actually.. right now. i'll be back see ya later. lol

l8gS69e81X1D4KWjQ4g66g.text: I had the Red Velvet Mocha it was a good Fix to my coffee addiction. I Love that they have a drive thru especially when I'm stopping by at 2am. They have a patio area with a few tables to enjoy the lovely weather while it lasts. I will defiantly be back :)

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Mocha $5/6 bucks

7w0OuOM4S571Ab9Dw4eGnw.text: Fantastic coffee shop. I'm here almost every day, and it's always amazing. The food is delicious and the drinks are superb and the people are absolutely wonderful, and unbelievably sweet. The owner is an absolute sweetheart and loves his customers.  I couldn't love the atmosphere here more. Between the music, the people, and the beautiful art they feature, it's the perfect spot to just sit for hours. It's completely unique and refreshing, and being here is a relaxing experience.  The Japanese matcha green tea smoothie is my favorite, and I order it every time. Every sandwich on the menus is delicious, but I have a soft spot for their Tiramisu and French macaroons. It's open 24/7, perfect for late night cramming or a night out with friends. Everyone that I've brought here loves it. This is my go-to spot, and has been for about 2 years now.

Xxd05eQ97ReitUXM-ha5kw.text: Formerly known as It's A Grind Coffee, the MadHouse Coffee shop has a ring to it's name and if it does to you as well, it doesn't mean you're clinically insane, it just means that you heard what I heard when it was mentioned it was under new management. We're told never to judge a book by it's cover, even if it's good or bad, but what's the reality of things? We always do. For MHC's sake, I judged it by it's cover (the front of the store) and thought it to be a real chill spot to share caffeine with some friends, chat, and let time pass with smiles and laughter! There's even a little game (courtesy of Irish G.) that you can use as an icebreaker too, but I'll get to that in a little later... When MHC was IAGC, I had their chai tea latte and it was a pleasant cup of spice! Glad to say that it hasn't changed along with the name. Miriam C. and I enjoyed a chai tea latte a late evening some moons ago (open really late! get the schedule here: facebook.com/TheMadHouse..., their website is down) and it was the same spicy chai tea latte that I got the last time I was there. There are a ton of new things inside the coffee house like mugs for purchase and board games to complete this coffee house jubilee! Unfortunately, their website is down so I'm unable to post their current menu. The space is a smidgen too tight for huge groups to come and kick it, but the patio is equipped with chairs and tables to occupy, but majority of the time it's crowded. Free during the winter to freeze your toots off though! I've enjoyed spending a few hours galavanting here and look forward to more occasions to come back! The coffee house has a real artsy feel to it with original paintings on the walls and tables which authenticates it as a real "hip" joint to be at. With the new management's changes, MHC has some potential to be "hipper" than the downtown coffee houses that's been springing up like gophers in the spring if they can provide entertainment there. I think that would brand it as the hippest coffee shoppe off the strip! Oh, and about that little game... Irish G. noticed there are a few crowns hidden all over the coffee shop in the paintings, on the furniture, EVERYWHERE! I believe she counted 4, but I counted 6! Can you beat 6? I'll be back for another unique cup of whatever's brewin' at The MHC shop soon!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Busy

JA1xvcO2erjc1NTWnDCBvA.text: If nothing else, props to MadHouse for being 24 hours (I wish more places in Summerlin would offer late night hours).   It's also pretty cool that you can experiment with menu options and order online, although I do wish that they would include nutritional information. (The one thing I prefer about Starbucks is that I know approximately how many calories I'm consuming with each order, because their website has a nutritional calculator.)   The drinks are good. There's a lot of variety, including some pretty unique options that you can't find elsewhere. I also appreciate that they carry almond milk, since most other coffee shops don't.   The selection of pastries seems pretty standard.   I wish they had more seating. But aside from that, I think this is a pretty cool place (and, hey, there's always the drive thru...).

pqaTUa-A_Mt_iFKz8huafg.text: This is my coffee house of choice here in Vegas. It is the closest to me and it is open 24 hours. I love the art deco done by local artists here. The seating area is smaller but they have a decent sized outdoor patio area. I love their selection of drinks and usually bounce around between their Red Velvet, Grasshopper, and Monkey Mocha drinks. They have a good selection of sandwiches, muffins, and a couple desserts. I just love the vibe in this place and of course, there is free WIFI available. The staff is friendly and they do a great job maintaining the cleanliness of the shop. This place does tend to get busy towards the evening when they break out the hookah. It's a great place for me to come in the mornings and work from my laptop for a couple hours and have a drink along with a muffin.

N0Bsfv2FmIk8-J_VLZtyDQ.text: Absolutely love Madhouse! It's open 24 hours and it's the most happening coffee shop in Vegas. The ambiance is great and all the workers are always so polite (especially Jessie and Mike). 10/10 would come again.

pbkOdzQoenwr9ByvE4kPqQ.text: I'm not in the mood for bitter invective, ad hominem attacks or sporting a split bill between Juvenalian bathos and a sustained coloratura soprano of high brow.  The espresso I ordered was not only sour, but also very acidic. I'm not a scientist, but I'd place the pH level between hydrochloric acid and the battery variety.   Upon reaching my lips I was obliged to not recognize it as any form of liquid suitable for human consumption. My appetite became permanently dead as the horrid filth sifted through my mouth and proceeded down my gullet.  To simulate my ordeal simply imagine this: you are about to vomit, a teaser dose comes lurching out of your esophagus so fast that the epiglottal warning consonant fails to sound and you are forced to swallow (perhaps you're in good company and wish not to embarrass yourself). That taste and that feeling is the Madhouse espresso experience.  So let's say you don't really drink coffee, and you're more into supporting mom and pop businesses just because it's not an evil corporate giant. Fair enough.  The owner was walking around barefoot that night. Last year I saw the man, Marco is his name, dusting an unboxed loaf of panettone with powdered sugar and the fugitive dandruff flake or two. I don't fault a man for accidents, but please, do not give Intelligentsia Coffee a bad reputation, hire some competent workers and upkeep your machines on a regular basis.  The macarons are delicious, however, though not without some Head and Shoulders.

0ZvlN87Sj15pb-b54wIc8g.text: It's 12 am and a couple friends and I wanted to get some coffee, so we drove all the way out to Madhouse!   When we got there the inside was packed!!! But there is also a patio-like area outside for customers to sit.   I definitely recommend their blended red velvet mocha. This was my first time trying red velvet mocha, and it was super good!!!

aGDdi1nFB-KBrD12ft_sVw.text: Great coffee place. Generally we like starbucks. But this place is better.  I had the mocha late and Christine the red velvet. We split a chocolate muffin which was really great tasting buy not on my diet at all... VBG :-)

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great coffee place. Generally we like starbucks. But this place is better.

kmvK0BPZC63H7FpkKJrZlA.text: I'm a Starbucks junkie, so when I rolled up to this place, it was to try the red velvet mocha that I have been hearing about.  -1 Star: I typically like to try a new restaurant prepared; I like to go to their website and see what they are about and what kind of drinks they have.  I tried to do this for Madhouse, but their website didn't work.   -1 Star: When I pulled up to the drive thru, their menu is posted so high up, that I actually could barely read the first few items from my car.  I had my head out the window.  When the guy asked for my order, I asked about the red velvet mocha. (apparently it was at the top of the menu, in which I couldn't see).  I asked for a medium with no whipped cream.  I think the total was $6 something.  Out comes this ginormous red blood coffee drink with a bunch of whipped cream.  Whatevs.  I drank it and it was DELICIOUS!  It's like eating a red velvet cake in liquid format.  Sooooo good!  This was definitely more like dessert  than a coffee drink.  I won't take a star off for this, but the red coloring dyes your teeth red.  So before you go to a meeting after drinking this, swig down some water or brush your teeth, otherwise you might look like you've been sucking blood all day.   If I want a dessert with some caffeine, I will definitely head back for the red velvet mocha.  The drive thru peeps were nice too!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium ice blended red velvet mocha!! Delicious!!

bbWLJRfUFFbc-0k5bhoYmw.text: The monkey mocha is so bomb! I am addicted! This place is so cool and they have a drive thru opened 24 hrs!

hXYMNJXThpxSPgPk5YzQIg.text: Stopped here on my way out of town today and was helped by a young guy in a tie dye shirt...didn't get his name. He suggested his favorite drink, the iced mad cow, and it was amazing! 5 stars for an awesome recommendation, great service, and tasty drink.

twPjR78LjpIW5t1NvBG0Ag.text: They are a bit pricy but they offer quite tasty coffee, the macaroons however were very stale and much too sugary. We absolutely love the breakfast sandwiches, they also have great crossiants and a very chill atmosphere.

5mAULIBb-EDUsR0x0-YYqA.text: I like the food and the location, i love to eat on the patio! Its always packed when i get to go, the service is not that great so thats why i give it a 3 star.

uyAoNwB8vWQ8JCWEsmb4HA.text: FINALLY an awesome place that is high quality & is 24-hours!! The hibiscus tea is awesome. Only thing I can say is EXPAND and you will get even more business...too overcrowded at times to sit & relax, which would prompt me to buy more drinks, then food, then sweets, & maybe more drinks :))

XFep9fT6DECVVGzvXkSS_g.text: This place is really cool. The coffee is delicious, the people who work there are so cool as well. You can actually get on a personal level with them which is really nice to know. They'll remember you and your orders! Their hookahs are where they lost me. I'm a huge hookah snob. Allll their hookahs are cheap. They use coconut coals which is good but I feel like if they got an $80 Khalil Mamoon instead of a $40 one, this would be a 5/5 instead of a 3/5. You're going to get people who don't know anything about hookah, and people who know very much so it's nice to have at least one or two nice hookahs there, just for those people. $13 for a bowl is ridiculous when it's coming from a crappy hookah. I can't even enjoy it. Also, instead of wrapping it in foil which just isolates the heat and makes it hard real easily, they should get net cages so that way if it drops, it wont go every where and it won't get so harsh. You can tell the owner doesn't know anything about hookah and it's not a good move in their part if they're selling it. I'll be back, but not for the hookah.

zK5fmY2Dl62oxqoRzjDKqQ.text: Feels real instead of synthetic like that "other place". And guess what, unlike "that other place", this place has almond milk ( the fact that"other place" is getting almond milk 9-29-2016 is no excuse. ) It is obvious that other place has their head firmly up the dairy industry's ass.  Independent places have always had almond milk.  Also, Much better music is played here and they have live bands sometimes.

h4BEZAMBNsjJjMGJ4Lej2A.text: Coffee is pretty good!  But very expensive...like really pricey.   Also the vibe there is horrible. I can't stand people who think they're better than everyone..the place is swarming with rude hipsters who judge your every move.  & that's probably why they offer a drive-thru option! LOL! the drive-thru takes a LONGGG time though & I was the only car in it. So if you plan on getting a quick coffee before work, you might wanna leave your house a little early.  Overall it's all an alright place. So if you have the money to pay for overpriced coffee & you enjoy "know it all" hipsters then this is the place for you! Otherwise I recommend just going to Dunkin Donuts. Just as good coffee, better prices, nicer people. Or invest in a coffee machine so you can save a bunch of money overtime!

SnSJjFhjIh90sdlFiAI1ew.text: Drink prices are a bit higher here than at other coffee locations in town. Their blended drink menu was impressive and pretty tempting but my friend and I needed a caffeine boost so we stuck with lattes instead. We were greeted with a what's up by one of the workers and then we proceeded to order a medium green tea latte with an added shot of espresso (our current favorite drink) & a medium hazelnut latte with one less pump of sweetener. The green tea latte came out to be around $6.50-7 and the hazelnut latte was about $5.   I liked how drinks are brought out to you. There were a bunch of people sitting outside and their food and drinks were brought out to them. Some people were studying inside but I felt that the music was too loud and it was too dark.   2/5: The green tea latte was ok, it lacked a strong matcha flavor in my opinion but wasn't overly sweet like other places I've been to. My friend said that this drink was a lot better at Starbucks... and I had to agree with her.  1/5: hazelnut latte. Not sure if it's because I ordered it less sweet, but it almost had no flavor. I felt like I was drinking hot milk with a hint of sugar. The espresso shots (not sure how many they put in a medium) wasn't aromatic, smooth or strong. I was extremely disappointed.   I think I saw a few cars in their drive through so it's nice that they have that option. There were about 4-5 people working and they all seemed pretty busy. I also saw that they had some baked goods available for sale but their macaron was really cracked but it was still on display. I liked how a worker gave a patrons dog a treat.   Although it's a far drive and I probably won't be ordering anymore lattes here in the future, their blended drinks look promising.

PVv5ijyl3lCuJJ96T4xUhw.text: they're always so friendly here & the red velvet frappe is awesome. I always study here and it's usually busy but there's usually spots outside

z9XhOMFUOU3Vjl_Wxp_fXA.text: This place has such an awesome vibe inside and out. The staff is super friendly and chill! The usual suspect is bombbbbbbbb!! I got a mocha and a cold brew, both were perfect!

EUW7fRUaMV4M4YIL23JSTw.text: Wow. What a GEM! My sister in law, daughter and I had the munchies (and a hankering for caffeine) in the late afternoon. I knew I didn't want Starbucks, so YELP helped me out  In all we had: a latte (beautifully done!) Apricot croissant (yummy) Monkey  mocha (omg!) Nutella-misu (rich and delicious) Classic croissant (light, flakey)  Everything was delish. We will definitely stop by again!

zzF7xVDd9pTQ9sORzjzhZA.text: Amazing music, perfect interior temperature, lighting is easy on the eyes, and still to this day there is none a burnt creation.

nz6FRlWxlRobEEc93_M-IA.text: Its a nice spot to study with a group or solo. The drink options are great!

dMecVfDeEsMra1BaKqUmlQ.text: Open 24 hours a day with vegan options!! Hallelujah !  As well as delicious dirty chai with plant based milk.  The food is nothing out of this world but for a coffee shop and the convenience of anytime this place gets 4 stars.  The staff is always friendly, the music upbeat, and it is clean.  Edited 3/29 to 5 stars for their expanding vegan menu and options!

qdVM_pxtxxJEeJlbCnaLFg.text: Cool relaxed staff, come here to study all the time with no problems. For those of you who want to study, come during daylight because it gets pretty loud at night. Coffee tends to be a little sweeter than other places so I usually ask for half sweetener and an extra shot of espresso. Also, if you're a fan of nice aesthetics, it's a cool hang out spot too.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b5j8UiAhtsLIbWKLK7Pdkw.text: I have been here several times recently, and the newer management and staff have really seemed to make this a go to place. Several years ago I went to this location and I was not impressed with the staff or the vibe. I am glad to see that it has improved. Clean public restrooms and a positive vibe!

QkGcW6qM-ZmUPwgZxzy7BQ.text: Much happier with this coffee shop, as of late. The food and drinks are good now. More importantly, the dining space is cleaner and cooler than in previous years. Good taste in music too. I like this place much better now!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FS1CUO4AOOwE70ZS03g0MQ.text: This is place is seriously the highlight of my mornings. I literally come every morning to get my Iced white chocolate mocha and maybe a muffin if I'm feeling a morning snack BEST THING IN THE WORLD! Love this place, the chill environment and decor and the staff are always so sweet. Definitely recommend this place to anyone

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KVT6J0nvuoUw9pnxY5DiwQ.text: I ordered the iced vanilla latte here and the quality of the espresso is perfect. The layout on the inside would need a little work only because there seemed to be a lot of things going on. It looked like a nice artsy gathering with so many colors and graphics.  Customer service would need a little work. When I was ordering the cashier seemed to be talking to the barista and wasn't really attentive to my needs. I'd bring my friends here only if we had a place to sit, this place was packed!

ZMmm2ZUKM5TopayktHQ9TQ.text: Great place to go and have a coffee. Cute and arty inside. Good coffee, sandwiches, nice pastries on offer, wifi, friendly barristas, and it's open 24/7!! What more can you ask for?    Also have drive-thru :-)

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Capp and Ham, egg &amp; cheese croissant!

rXoxqvu9Odk8HBAJXAyYxg.text: Love this place... funky art.... great coffee... lovely food.. and nice nice nice variates!  I always get just a house decaf... and it's  soooooooo smooth!  Xiao gets a red velvet... she says it's the best around. The sandwiches are thoughtful. .. great combinations! . And the fact that it's open 24/7 is just the icing on the cake!

cDs14Pow8vkeOEIJytvt3w.text: Very good latte! Wasn't overpriced at all. Place looks dope! Side note lots of cute girls here. Lol staff is very nice. I would come here more often if I lived closer.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rlUFssD0QkNbmRWf4GT9sQ.text: Pros:  1. Great quality coffee/lattes. 2. Matcha TO DIE FOR. 3. Sizing options - their large is HUGE, and much larger than the competitors'. It's too much for me, but at least you've got options.  4. Fantastic baked goods/desserts. 5. Open 24/7. 6. They occasionally send coupons via e-mail.  7. Cool vibe/environment. 8. Super speedy service at night. 9. Free wi-fi. It seems like the majority of people come here to work.   Cons:  1. Really expensive. I buy Starbucks every day, and this place is too rich even for my blood. I mostly only visit at night when everything else is closed.  2. If you do go during the day, especially through the drive-thru, the service can be super slow. I suspect the owner is there at night and keeps everyone on their toes. 3. I don't love the sandwiches.   Highly recommend: Red Velvet Latte or Matcha Latte/Frappe   Overall, I think this is a great coffee joint, but it's just too expensive to be a daily habit for me.

WyQXXh6ROiFHUFkzd-7z_Q.text: First time yesterday, and I'll be BACK!!  Party of 3 and we ordered all 32oz monsters...cake batter was red velvet, nutella was yummy, but by far the winner of the 3 choices was the monkey mocha...  So we learned we really didn't need 32oz of all that sweet plus coffee beans!!  However, you can't stop drinking this stuff!!  Can't say anything bad about this place, because we went via drive thru but I do want to return and sit for awhile...  It's a drive, but it's worth it!!  We're headed back there this morning in fact!!  Two days in a row?  WHAT!!?!!

Cagjaix7jL_0uqFijxIP7A.text: Madhouse Coffee is my favorite place to get passion tea! It's $4 for a large iced tea, but it's something I don't mind splurging on. The large is HUGE, so it definitely will last you a while. It is 100x tastier than Starbucks's passion tea, especially with a pump of mango sweetener!  Also, their coffee is pretty decent too. I would recommend the drip blend (Ethiopian). It's absolutely delicious! I would say Madhouse brews some of the best coffee in Vegas.   The service here is always good. The people who work here are really friendly and personable. Plus, whenever my dogs come with me in the drive thru, the people taking my order always give them treats!

9vDd8fjhDmKww4YLacRMXw.text: Lots of really great coffee, does pour over and even some fancy types like this slow drip japanese style. The service is nice and the music/ambiance is really good. Popular study hangout spot since it's 24/7  I've been here a lot lately and all the staff is awesome.

nU4htY7mR6kiimfa8GxplQ.text: Horrible service. If you will work at drive thru you've got to learn how to smile and answer politely on your customers question. Dang i was just asking if you guys have any soda. Learn how to smile!

HRa18faUO-4ysXurE1OCNg.text: Unique & cool atmosphere. Friendly staff & clean place. Able to just bring your laptop & hangout! The food there is great& it's close by too. Got the " wannabe " sand which & it was really good. They also have drip coffee too. First time here & hear nothing but good things. Glad I tried it !

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;wannabe&#34; sand which ! Super good !

DYM3od97gP_b4OkFe3GZ8w.text: I tried the Monkey Mocha, Mad Max, and Grasshopper blended drinks.  In my opinion, the Grasshopper (mint & mocha) was pretty good, Mad Max was too bitter and I didn't get a jolt from eating the coffee beans, and the Monkey Mocha was good (the first time) with lots of banana and peanut butter flavors mixed in with the mocha.  Buuuttt the next few subsequent orders of the Monkey Mocha just tasted like mocha and ice.  I think $8  for a medium (plus a tip is encouraged by the jar and space on the cc payment system) is just too much.  Also, be advised even though they have healthy desserts, they don't use real ingredients like banana in the Monkey Mocha... it's all syrups which I confirmed with the barista.  Unfortunately, I won't be back even though I very much wanted to become a regular since it's right on my way to work. ... Why was my review removed?

QhdRBTpPyZngRfMo2Y1a9w.text: Nice vibe, ok seating, but the internet access situation is absurd. The page wont load properly and the passcode they give didnt work. Find a solution because this is dumb.

_n0MXjHv1kC5BpOhNujO5g.text: Members of The Yelp Book Club discussed the book "Argo" by Antonio Mendez and Matt Baglio, which was made into a motion picture that recently played at theaters nationwide, starring Ben Affleck in the role of CIA agent Mendez, who led a group of Americans out of a hostile country and to safety.  The book is about what until now was a little known tale of 6 U.S. Embassy workers in Iran who, with the help of the Canadian ambassador to Iran and some stagecraft by the CIA, escaped being taken as hostages like their fellow workers after the overthrow and flight from Iran of the Shah.  In pleasant surroundings those in attendance noted how the Iran hostage crisis came to be, and observed how ironic it was that over 30 years later, Iran is back as arguably the U.S.'s chief adversary.  It was clear to all assembled that the 6 Americans would all have been taken into captivity as additional hostages had they not been hidden from sight for over 2 months and later spirited out of Iran on an airplane following implementation of a bizarre film production cover story that worked, with the assistance of some very professionally prepared False papers.  It was difficult to not make some comparisons between the book and the movie, including how the film gratuitously added some Hollywood-type hyped up action scenes that did not really occur, like dramatic security delays inside the airport, and a last-minute chase of a commercial jetliner by crazed armed revolutionaries in motorized vehicles on an airport runway desperately trying to block the plane holding the escaping Americans from taking off.  We also found it to be ironic that the freed Americans were told that they could never write a book about what they experienced, only for former spymaster Mendez to write one himself several years later.    But times change, and there was no longer a valid reason for this interesting and heartening tale of multi-state collaboration and cooperation, misdirection, courage, and fulfilled hope to remain untold!

r4JMb7yRneKdgazZjrdNdQ.text: Always good vibes here, nice place to study take a breather and always a good place to spend time with friends and catch up. The teas are my go to but every time I've had coffee it's been phenomenal.

Also, great that they are 24 hrs! A bit of a distance from me, I hope they open a location closer to the North Las Vegas area. Quite a calm atmosphere, and the people that work there are all very nice. They also have Hookah, and patio area for which to smoke it. Very small location, great for studying with a couple of friends, or quick lunch meeting. They carry soy milk, almond milk, and coconut milk, which is great alternatives if you're like me and can't handle the taste of milk anymore.

With that, I usually don't complain about quality when the service is good, but in this case both sucked. Bad first experience !

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EOFgU2_tpaavVBR--CtsJg.text: I. Love. Madhouse.   From the food and drinks, to the urban street art, to the games, to the vibe. Being open 24 hours is also such a convenience. The whole crew always makes you feel comfortable and I've never had a drink I was unsatisfied with here. I just tried the Wannabe and just the aroma of it was mouthwatering. I recently learned that everything on the menu is handcrafted, which is a giant thumbs up for them.  At first I wasn't a fan of having to purchase a certain dollar amount in return for a couple hours of free wifi, but it was actually a clever idea for them to do.

SQqJhULck-cWGkR0LYuXaw.text: I tried the Nutella white mocha iced with almond milk and the Green Card sandwich.  The REAL Nutella adds a fantastic thickness to the iced drink, the white mocha rounds out the choco-fab flavor.  The smaller size was still HUGE.  The sandwich was thin sliced turkey with lettuce, tomato, and fresh avocado smashed into the beautifully fresh focaccia (don't worry they have other delicious sounding options).  Good portion, very fresh, definitely not pre-made and sitting there.     Now I'm sure the 24 hr/driveway thing is tough to staff, but it was a little quiet on the greeting side of things when I came in. I get it. Hipster coffee shop, no need for the fake smile and small talk. Just pop your head up when you hear the door maybe.   Also the pricing is kind of vague. I was starving (my bad, I know) so I didn't question it until later when I was charged $15 for my drink and sandwich. In my travels, I have yet to spend quite that much on lil ol me at a cafe. I think perhaps the barista was sleep deprived and rang me for something extra. Eh. Yolo.   Lots of seating, nooks and crannies galore. I could get some studying done there.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patio looking in.

t5WDI_eXTmW8FVfYOBsWqA.text: Place is super cute! A lot of awesome art on the walls and all over!! My boyfriend and I were expecting a bit more out of the experience and service but all in all the green card on a baguette is really delish! They also have a drive thru which makes everything so much easier when wanting to order on the go! The only sad thing to say would be that they do not have enough room to suite all the guests that could come here! It's more of a young urban feel. If a family of 4-5 came in, they would have difficulty seating them. BUT!! Besides the seating food is good. Most def will stop by for another sandwich or something else to try! Thank you Corey for the suggestion!! Super good. ^_^!!

zjA10M-41UL8grFTeWmkLg.text: Absolutely my favorite place to be. I literally come in everyday no exaggeration. I've shown my entire group of friends this coffee shop. I've met so many amazing people here.  The food is spectacular, the coffee is amazing. The wait is skittle long sometimes but it's worth it.   Unfortunately my favorite baristas are no longer working there :( Andy and Janet were by far the BEST employees: they made this place feel like a home, and I always get so warm. Nothing ever felt transactional with them. They knew my name, my order with all the specialities to it with the first time meeting them. They had my drink ready as soon as they saw me walk through the door.  I literally would spend hundreds of dollars here, get 5 or 6 coffees in one night, not even REALIZING what I've spent, because they made this place such a welcoming environment. They ALWAYS put the customer first.  The rest of the baristas are nice, but they don't make this place feel the way Andy and Janet did.  I will continue to come here on a daily basis. It's the only coffee shop open with the hours I work. I will forever love this place. I just hope I can make that connection with the baristas again, because I think it's a HUGE contribution to the overall atmosphere of the place.

They have Tons of vegan/milk alternatives and a Variety menu of good quality   I'm willing to pay a little more for the things I like want and ESP quality however this place is still a tad over priced  The wait it always long - I get it tho bc they are making everything fresh and it's a small place with a small staff servicing inside and the drive through   I prefer to go inside bc the last time I went through the drive through I waited over 10 minutes   The few times I've come here for 2 drinks it's always atleast $13+ and I get the small or medium size

AFIJQWdlgfAcIWx-7GhUbg.text: I've been coming here for YEARS. However, recently this place has become incredibly messy. The bathroom being the prime example. For awhile now they've had black lights in the bathroom, for "aesthetic" purposes, I'm assuming. The bathroom is not the place. Bathrooms are about function. When entering, its impossible to tell if the bathroom is clean or not. Earlier today I went in to use the bathroom and I'm so glad I used my phone to check the toilet, because the seat was COVERED in urine. I looked on the floor and there was also urine everywhere. I've seen dive bar bathrooms in better shape than this. I don't know what happened to this place. I really enjoy coming here and spending my money, however I don't know if I can deal with the uncleanliness. Management seriously needs to crackdown on employees and the maintenance around here. I'm here for hours at a time, and can honestly say it is seldom that I see an employee check the bathroom to ensure it's clean. This cafe is always busy and cleaning the bathroom throughout the day should be standard. Especially for an establishment that serves food. This is disgusting and unacceptable. Overall things seem to be rather untidy. Overflowing trash cans, tables left dirty with dishes that sit for several hours. I've worked in food service and in retail for years. I know things get busy and sometimes there just aren't enough hands to get everything done, but most customers are here studying, not actively ordering food/drinks and there's always plenty of staff. Having someone in charge of running through and cleaning isn't that tall of an order.

I can't remember the name of the one I got last time but it had chicken, pesto and arugula and it was DIVINE!!! Service is super. Everyone is a gem and you can tell they love their jobs.  The reason I only give 4 stars is because the past few times I have gotten iced lattes they just... didn't taste good. It had sort of a watered down day old pot of coffee taste. I've even tried different milks/flavoring to see if that was the problem but it didn't make any difference. I'll keep tryin'. P.S. thanks for changing the provocative logo on your cups! It was very sexy but not appropriate for the schools I was substitute teaching at! Yikes

TL8D5vED-kRVykxlw-zrdA.text: So decided wanted try different coffee shop this week. MadHouse Coffee is one that been on the radar. I know not much left to review. My first impression was like different vibe in no way feel like your traditional coffee shop. Not only do they have traditional pastries in really display case, also have glass jars of pastries, and then comes to food. They really have nice variety of sandwiches from hot or cold. The 24/7. I know of one Starbucks that open 24/7 so having more then one option plus with more food options. MadHouse Mahalos! The decor hard described modern with twist...maybe. The two monkeys in suit straight out of pulp fiction cool decoration. Original artwork that believe you can buy if you want. The counter area next to barista making all the java art. Different spot chill at not only do you get see all the magic happen but relaxing spot read good book. Me coffee and good book go hand in hand.   The menu like that chalkboard. I know they have few signature drinks. I figure start with the matcha green tea. It was awesome. One thing that feel stood out compare other coffee spots same one. The color was vibrant green, smooth, and flavor amazing. The red velvet that one need try next cause never heard of that one before. So like the creative MadHouse offers for java lovers!!   The staff is five stars awesome. The gentlemen took my order explaining the menu being my first time. Notice wearing my Colorado Avalanche Forsberg jersey. Next thing know talking hockey stories. It was cool. I think of great coffee shop not only about great java, great spot random conversations, read great book mention earlier, and MadHouse definitely has all of those things. They also have drive-thru.   No doubt will be back and just make rotation of coffee shops on my days off now.

hRht3KcMGrPjLndY3czbkw.text: the bathroom is not dirty you guys are just trump supporters, get over yourselves. the coffee is expensive but it's bomb and comes in large quantities. i like this place it's cute and yummy.

8pKTOxsC2-ovZJaK79Nr7g.text: Heard great things about this place.   Always drove past this cafe but I never noticed it was right there in the side of the street on dessert in.   As soon as you walk in you are hit with a quick wave of heat, it's super warm and cozy inside. So warm that there's kids smoking outside with their tshirts. It's 35 degrees outside. This coffee joint feels like a Brooklyn hipster cafe. I can dig it, inside pretty much resembles everything you see in Brooklyn and much more.   I jumped in around 11pm and was served instantly. Ordered three desserts and a cappuccino. The desserts beyond awesome just like the speed of the entire staff. The tiramisu x2 and the macaroon. Mind blowing how good the tiramisu was, I knew I had to order two right away just by looking at it I knew. Did not regret ordering two before I even tried them. Especially the pudding inside, probably my favorite part of the whole experience.   The cappuccino, now that's very basic. Beans, poor and the milk was cold. Only looked pretty for a photo.   I still recommend it, I like this place. I know I'm coming. Can say I'm definitely returning to try more on their menu. PS I also tried the blend strawberry smoothie. It's cold but damn that thing was bomb.

Visited here on a Wednesday around 10PM with a couple buddies. There are a huge selection of drinks and food.  I just ordered a hot chocolate drink since it was like 35 degrees that night. It kept me warm.   Great atmosphere and vibe to chill for a bit. They have wifi also. Met a few people while hanging out. People here are really nice

yJBlYeXLVBn3cy3oolBtOA.text: This place is awesome! The employees, the hookah, the coffee, the food. Highly recommend to anyone. A lot of people come here to study as well. Very chill atmosphere with outside seating as well. Gets busy during the summer so grab a seat quick!

3jG35T1aRtDpxZzrPY3Gzg.text: Honestly, every creative being in Vegas has been to Mad House and LOVES it. If you have not, get your booty to it!! The menu is delicious. The place is so lovely that it can get packed, but it is worth the elbow-to-elbow work stations when you have the opportunity to meet amazing people. I hope you all take the time to give this place a try.  xoxox, WhoseThoughtAnyway

kwxfE13Sig_FOooOW8pHxQ.text: I just had the most horrible experience here. We just witnessed the owner, Marco, throw a bag of bread and yell, "what is this?" to one of his employees. Then, he proceeded to throw another bag of bread to another one of his employees sitting outside, who was off the clock. I don't care how badly an employee has messed up, an owner or manager should NEVER treat their employees the way he just treated her. It makes me wonder if he can treat them like that in front of customers, how does he treat them behind closed doors? The only good thing about this place was the coconut cold brew that those nice employees made for us. I will NEVER return to this place in my life, and I hope no one does. A person that treats people that way does not deserve any business from anyone. I hope all of his employees find somewhere else to work.

dv5mlYbTVdh0dxNKU9emjA.text: This isn't your typical "fast food" style coffee chain where everything is the same and get what you expect.  Mad House takes an absolute position to this and created their own style whether you like it or not.    You still get your study space if that's what you want to achieve.  Heck, if you want to get sun burned and sit outside, you can do that as well.  They seemed to have created a neat following here and you'd be missing out if you haven't tried it.   Oh yeah, the coffee... that's good too.  I roll with the cold brew these days and it was just as I liked it.  They even use nugget-style ice which is a huge plus.

SS6bsszSC6345NuzdKgymg.text: the first thing that greeted me inside their doors was a doggy!!! i was so happy to see a coffee shop that allows dogs inside & not have them stay outside, the coffee was an absolute DELISH! we ordered the monkey mocha with almond milk & a nutella white chocolate latte iced, it tasted exactly like the name not just pure milk & sugar like other places do. i cannot wait to make this my go to coffee shop. friendly staff, quiet, peaceful vibe not that big inside or many chairs but over all its a place with G r e a t coffee!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xSI6VKsdZVN777vJrhncLg.text: MadHouse Coffee is my go-to study night coffee place. I really love that they have healthy options. The atmosphere of this place is really nice as well! It has a hipster touch to it. Great great place !

gYHNF5yeCMCreR7aOJqkXg.text: This place has some delicious coffee and some amazing food but I do think I'd like to see more vegan options available.

W0MeLq_9tMfYNFXnE6tfqA.text: Well I am so glad this establishment is open 24 hrs because I can order a Nutella tiramisu whenever I want. It is a bit more on the pricier side but I spend just as much at Brew Tea Bar. I mean it depends how much you like coffee but I'm more of a tea drinker so I'm more hesitant to spend when I come here. I always come in the early morning so it's either incredibly full and busy or it's empty. The service is pretty spot on but that's because I see the same barista for the early morning shift :-)  He's very nice and super quick so I never wait too long for my drink.  Now for the drinks, they're pretty good. I recall ordering a red velvet latte once and then I stuck to a mint mocha afterwards. Both are delicious drinks and I do also recommend trying out the other desserts. They have vegan desserts and the drinks can be substituted with soy or almond milk!  There's plenty of seating inside and outside and the decor is majestic, very.  You really can't go wrong with doing homework here either. Overall I'd still come here to hang out with friends, do homework, or eat my tiramisu by myself.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A 24 oz grasshopper on the rocks  (Iced mint mocha)

U1momdWg90O1tmq7UEA_Lg.text: I'm MAD ABOUT YOU...you know who you are.  I'm also mad about this coffee spot.  I thank Antonia and Renzo for introducing me to this place.  Very hip Urban vibe with a fair amount of indoor seating and plenty of outdoor setting.  Love the decor!  The art on the walls that were made by local artists, kinda Urban hipster...very cool.  I've noticed plenty of locals come here to chill.  Being 24/7 makes it more inviting, and par for a city that never sleeps.  Madhouse has a great selection of goodies such as hot/cold coffee drinks(including the water drip cold brew), sandwiches, and various desserts(made in house), even macaroons. They also have Hookah to Relax you while you get Jolted from your coffee...hmm              One Vegas scorching summer day (is there any other?), when I first laid eyes on you, I mean Madhouse.  You know, Vegas=my ### is on fire=something COLD to drink.  I chose the NUTTELA WHITE CHOCOLATE MOCHA.  Later finding out it was a local favorite.  I can taste why...outstanding drink...an absolute must try!   I also had the LOONEY TUNA, which I wasn't too crazy mad about.  It was good, just not great.  Didn't taste the red apples, almonds, and for sure couldn't tell what 'few secret ingredients' they're talking about on the menu item description.  I like my tuna very looney, creamy with a lot of flavor and texture. The CROISSANT BREAD PUDDING was a tiny bit dry, but good.  I like my puddings tender and moist to the touch, yet firm enough to keep its shape.  Now I know why I'm mad about you.              What a great coffee house!  From a Yelp bookmark(never been, but looks good), to a regular(looking forward to going again)...already have 2 under my belt.
