Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0jItDLUJ7HsoMnrgvAhCog.text: I went to Madhouse today because I enjoy the occasional Monkey mocha. Today, it took forever to get my order and the barista had the hardest time understanding my order. My husband was practically yelling into the mic. Then I received my drink and the lid was loose on it and spilled half of it onto my top. What a lovely way to end my 10 hour day.

Qsfk60fXM_j7ClsmfeqU7Q.text: Manny and David are awesome  I've never had an issue with service but on Monday evening they kept the drive through pretty speedy while maintaining personality AND kept accountability on all that I ordered great job guys!!!

qrjftAmdAqH89hqp6SrIpg.text: Never been before today, very cute inside. The place is a bit dirty.  The young man that helped us was very nice and helped.   I'll try it one more time because their cold drinks look amazing.

x-YBsBacs1jX-yqalC04pg.text: Nutella White Hot Chocolate?! I am in! Not to mention.. this place is open 24 hrs!! I was in Vegas for over a month, and was on night shift... this place saved my life! It takes you to your happy place! I tried a sandwich once and decided to stick to the coffee and hot chocolate, though. It wasn't anything special. Either way, this place is great and has more than one location so you can get a Nutella White Hot Chocolate almost anywhere at ANY time!

4RK7BUUbtaGLPZ0v044tiA.text: By far one of the coolest coffee houses in Vegas.     The artwork, the employees, the food, the coffee all just amazing!    It has become one of my weekend rituals of getting the nutella coffee.    Youll be hooked after the first cup.   See everyone soon!

Ux3uqaJppGGjHwPpAirhIw.text: Went thru drive thru and was greeted. Told him to give us a few minutes because it's our first time. He said to tell him when we were ready. The menu display is horrible. I was on the passenger side and I had to duck down to see the top half of the menu. My husband was ready and gave him our order but we didn't get a response. Waited another 2 minutes and said once again we were ready but again, no response. We gave up and left. That's bad customer service. We won't be back.

mhPeAVrE436_RwPAcPYZ3w.text: I love this place! They have great service, are open 24/7, have yummy food, an array of delicious caff/decaf options that appeal to any palate & house all kind of geek friendly gifty things. They make their pastries in house as well as their menu items. -none of which have I ever been disappointed by. They cater to lots of different dietary adventures. They carry dairy, sugar, fat & even gluten free items for those less able to tolerate such things. Thank goodness this place is right near my house! It's my home base for meetings, whenever I can.

fUjv-e09D7l2urmbGAikTg.text: Always passing by this place but never actually going in, I finally decided that I might as well try it. I loved the vibe that I got the second I walked in and the staff was really friendly. However, I was a little disappointed in the menu choices. I don't know what I was expecting; probably more of a Starbucks/boba tea place feel and I didn't really get that. I ended up getting the green tea smoothie and one of the strawberry macaroons, neither of them being anything special. It's a place to go to just hang out and catch up, but I don't think you should go out of your way to go here.

tb6IvLTqygEU2hfnQzIBiw.text: I have been coming here for years now. It has an amazing atmosphere, good coffee and offers hookah. Its one of my favorite 24 hours places to go and hangout in Vegas.

_JEaW71aRhPxms8wKYmFRw.text: Yummy drinks, cute and cozy atmosphere, people with personality. Get the Monkey Mocha, but be forewarned - if you have an addictive personality, this drink will give you nothing but trouble.  That is all.

1zjD9AFklnN6XnlstPuDEQ.text: One day I was pimpin' down DI with a bitch who just done OD'd on some D and whipped my whip into this ogre slit of an establishment. My tale is short but has a decent girth (4" last time I checked in the Home Depot checkout line on what was coincidentally the last time I was allowed in a Home Depot). Some Romanian ass in a bumblebee coupe (Porsche) was servin up some mean Joe at a place that allowed the public to DJ as long as they wanted to play Gorillaz or Radiohead.   I can't bring an outside drink? How am I supposed to sip down some lean while I'm playing mafia in the checkout line? How am I supposed to get that sweet pineapple juice jizz taste for the honey I bang in the Pulp Fiction bathroom? If you want better coffee, take a shit in a cup and ask for a free refill at the nearby Roberto's. You won't be disappointed, unlike if you come here looking for anything but some wack ass scene kids lookin' like they high as a kite and just dropped they asses out the womb of 2007.

yePwEAfnlI8W-uNG2ZU_zw.text: They have a great owner and friendly staff. Their food is great compared to corporate coffee shops. Right by the Park and seating outside just give you European cafe culture feeling.

EDkW87hPXq5YBQV6YU_bxw.text: Love the vibe in this Coffee House.  Very unique furnishings and friendly staff and owner!  Would highly recommend!!

wbR9esn9vHrydN5W2IfYpw.text: Really neat to be able to hang in a coffee shop at any time of day. the blue haired employee seemed really knowledgeable and served me a delicious pour over! But, we had to yell to hear each other, the music was way too loud!

tABVA76NttEnnM6Y9yDQnw.text: Nice change of pace from the usual coffee I drink.  I wish they had a few more locations around town for convenience.  Thumbs ups for MadHouse Coffee.

jkvjh6KmaOHUNSzWk9nYZQ.text: The coffee here is good and the employees are nice. They have some healthy food options BUT today I saw they had French Macarons!!! They make them in house and I had to try one. It was Awful. I love my Macarons but they have to look and taste right! They tasted stale and it wasn't pretty like a macaron should be! The outside was not smooth and the inside was way too chewy:( It looked like it had exploded. BUT I do t go there for the Macarons I go for the coffee. So I'll return again.

vssnKHQoPQjLbZ9rUHLVsg.text: My favorite coffee shop for sure. Their food is great too! Every time I go in there, the staff is very attentive and friendly. It's pretty chill and the artwork is fun to look at. Good vibes and great coffee here.

sov_w85XMZ7wFYKeZGc41Q.text: Came here after eating at Sen to pick up some pastries for my folks who were watching The Kid at my brother's house while The Wife and I were on a date.  The place looks like a college coffee shop set way the hell of off campus (UNLV was a good 10 miles away).  The crowd was grungy, they all had their computers, and pompously sipped away while writing their blog praises of the OWS movement.  Ok, I'm stereotyping.  But hell, it's my review.  To the pastries...the tiramisu was good - I liked how light the dessert was and how it didn't try to overpower anything with an excess of amaretto or espresso dust.  The ricotta version of the same dish was meh - I didn't like how the cheese taste came back into the dish so easily.  The apricot pastry and cherry turnovers were good - they even heated them up in a spot oven like the Subway folks.  The aroma filled up the car and tempted us to tear into them in the car.  We didn't though - we wanted to give the 'rents first crack at the goodies.  Didn't try the coffee as it was already 9:30pm and I wanted to make sure The Wife could sleep so I could sneak out and go gambling with my bro - but maybe next time if I'm back in the area.  Prices were tad high but hell, when you're on vacation, you try to pretend not to notice.

SgZxb8r7awvDsLQxeSQzHg.text: I went in just for a treat a hot chocolate the crew suggested an italian hot chocolate. I have never had it before and being italian I am so ashamed. When it came I saw a thick and creamy cup of chocolate. When I tried it it was hot creamy decadent goodness I will have again it warms the heart.

uxXpNnhOKLXrKSeX0ZZ-5Q.text: No bueno! I ordered a blended caramel and my husband ordered a vanilla latte. My drink taste like ice and his seriously taste like a cigarette. No joke!

6PlUqbn3azFJASKApaU_rA.text: . super chill ambiance, great service, threesome sandwich on soft foccachia bread so good & proper cappuccinos ! first time here & won't be my last !

pV9Hr3pf7tQzAMK1cq0Lww.text: Went here last Saturday had the nutellmisu! Yummmmmmy! It was amazing! Any chocolate lovers out there should go attack that thing!

W2QeyfQIxZjDwOZk-rZV1g.text: With expresso running through my veins...I guess it would be an understatement to say that I am always in search of a good coffee shop to make my next destination.    A friend has been telling me to try this awesome place out...of the 5 mins i was in this place..I was terribly disappointed at the customer service they provided.     I ordered 3 shots of expresso with 3 pumps of toffee nut over ice.  Seeing the price of the triple shot (2.50 + flavor shots)...I questioned the girl helping me when she quoted Over 3.50...She told me that if i order this over ice...it costs more than if i ordered it hot. (#1 reason I didn't think it was right).  So i told her to just give me a cup of ice on the side.  She charged me $2.81.  i was fine with that... I got my drink and poured about 2 tablespoons of half/half in my espresso.    Then the owner came up to my table, and said that if i poured milk in my drink next time and poured it over ice, he'll have to charge me more.  (#2 reason i didn't appreciate this place) I was a bit confused so i asked for clarification about my drink and to my disbelief, he said the next time i came in his shop and ordered my three expresso shots with flavor shots, I'd need to pay for if I add a splash of milk to my drink since he has something on the menu like that.   First of all, The amount of half/half i added was nothing amounting to the 80-90% of milk which goes into a latte (its was literally only a splash), I order the drink I wanted like any good customer would and used a bit of the condements (which i thought was free to customers who purchased something from the menu) on the side...and to have the owner come over and haggling me about it was unacceptable to me. Although there might have been a small difference in price (0.50), I didn't order the latte because it wasn't what i wanted.  He rudely made it a point to tell me that he'll be charging me for a drink i won't be ordering.      I was upset so i returned the drink to the girl who helped me and told her that although the expresso was good, I wasn't coming back.    Totally no sense of customer service...for a $0.50 difference...He lost must more since I won't be bringing them any business.   I recommend Saxbys in Henderson.  I live only 2 miles from this coffee shop and I drove over 30 minutes to visit madhouse coffee.  NEVER AGAIN.  ******   Update 8/18/2011*****************************8  I honestly don't think the owner was trying to be a pest....in retrospect, he was trying to ensure that his place stays in business.  But a tip for a consumer would be, there are better ways to approach the situation.  It really isn't good business to charge someone more for ordering expresso over ice vs. Expresso hot.    Secondly,  I order what i order with coffee because I like the taste of it.  if there was a stipulation as to how i should order my drinks because management doesn't like it simply because he isn't able to weed a penny more from me, I just don't come back.    This only employs other coffee shops that don't do that.  I pay less, but in return, I give quite a bit of tip. :)

tbpMDWnuP0aRS8iQmce6kg.text: If there was a zero star option, that is more appropriate to how I feel. My family & our dogs have come here for the four and one half years since it was "It's a Grind," when my Mom went through the drive thru to order catering for her party, the next day. The barista had her drinks made that day, not Halloween, as she asked. On Halloween Day, mom had gone through the drive thru just an hour before the party, buying more drinks for early party goers with out any mention by Madhouse employees that she wouldn't get her party order. My husband & I called just before we went to pick up the drinks...we were told that my Mother could get credit for half of what she paid?? She paid full retail for each of the $6.75 chai lattes, now Madhouse wants more money? That was inexcusable! As my husband and I walked away from the counter, a barista taunted us with either "we leave, or he'd have to call the police." Mom ordered & paid, their barista got the date wrong, we got nothing & were insulted...dudes, you have forever lost good customers who tip. There is an awesome Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf nearby.

5kFLxKivB8ytUDq4t-tdtg.text: I recently had the bad experience of going to madhouse coffee. Not only are there prices rediculous (5.50 average for a SMALL drink) there facility is disgusting.   I took a look behind the counter and all the stuff they use to blend drinks , steam milk, cut meat/food, was literally all piled in a tiny sink. They literally didn't even fully wash out a blender before starting another drink!! The owner is also a reason I would not go back. He gave me just a not good feeling and I have heard my friends say he is rude and arrogant . Wifi is NOT free so you have to spend a certain amount just to get an hour of wifi, and whn that hour ends you have to purchase something els from there dirty coffee shop. I've tried about three pastries. The tiramisu (sour), crossant (incredibly dry) and a macaroon (only decent thing ) . I even know someone personally who went here and got instant diarrhea . Will not be coming back although the people and hookas and young crowd make it look like the place to be. All I can say is they have nice employees . That is all.

dDARXqHMMo5SO1np4l1RXg.text: The staff has excellent customer service skills and their warmth and friendly demeanor makes you want to go back again.  This owner is smart to recognize that customer service is as or more important than product and has an excellent crew working in that store - especially Deanna!  Well done.  You will keep my business.

4s2GkmHLWJjROURTq1kv9w.text: We are very disappointed with the service we received by rude staff today .. Coffee house sadly needs a good cleaning as  floors and tables were dirty last few times we visited .My salads are always good not great and portions have seemed to get smaller while prices are still a bit high compared to other coffee houses. Service slow and hardly no customers . Plus every time we go in they are always out of an ingredient on the menu. The staff seems more concerned with giving free stuff to their friends than actually waiting on real customers. My drink was made incorrectly and extremely rude female employee argued with me and said she would have to charge me for a new one .Employee went on to say that the drink was fine and  continued to argue her point.My huband's iced coffee tasted like coffee was brewed day prior but after awful attitude from employee over my drink we gave up and left. Well they lost my business and my  family's as well I have many choices and Mad House will not be one of them. Dunkin Donuts has fresher coffee right up the street and have very clean lobby with friendly staff.

a0PdBju7QI608k_sv18yhA.text: Open 24 hours. Free Wi-fi Great coffee and pastries....

TKJeWYHnj52yUT4ArIcKrA.text: Very friendly staff. They also have Wi-fi, which is a bonus! Large variety of decaf or caf drinks, as well as some teas and smoothies.  The only issue is that their sweets are a little cakey and just okay. It's like eating dough rather than a muffin.

1W7wQFxRfc_OpqbWEwsSIg.text: Like the coffee, does not have that starbucks burnt taste.

OKFnco_uwVukz4poASgIvA.text: I've been looking for a 24 hour coffee shop ever since I moved to Las Vegas.  Going to the strip for coffee is just to far out of my way. My sister wanted some coffee and I wanted something hot, so I decided to try the mudhouse hot chocolate which was recommended to me by one of there very nice baristas. They brought it to my table which was nice, I didn't have to stand around waiting to pick up my order, or hear my name; and they brought it to me in a ceramic mug, which gave it an extra nice touch! It was heaven in a cup, very delicious! I also got a chocolate croissant. They warmed it up in the oven and it was very tasty and complimented my mudhouse hot chocolate fabulously! My sister tried there new peppermint bark , which is made with white chocolate and peppermint. She isn't a peppermint fan, but loves white mocha, so she gave it a try. She loved it, it was rather sweet but says she would order it again. They also brought that over in a ceramic mug with whip cream and candy cane sprinkles! She had the Chicken Parmesan sandwich, I had a bite it was so warm and tasty. The bread was very soft!  We are defenitely  making this our spot. The owner came over and introduced himself, and all the staff was really nice, they seem to enjoy what they do and were great with welcoming us and making suggestions, cause in a new place I don't always know what I want. I thought the ambiance was very chic, it was a True coffee shop, not some chain that all look a like and the staff has to be nice to you! which all feels so fake anyway. This place was real and down to earth. I heard they are pet friendly, so I will be bringing both my dogs over. It's cool cause the dog park is right across the street. I can get a hot coffee before heading over to the park!

EKj6__Yl20_MOewbKWT3mw.text: Great place to sit and chill out for a few hours, especially when one has a midnight hankering to go out without imbibing liquor.  Staff is always friendly and talkative.  Comfortable seating, but can get crowded pretty quickly inside. Usually always enough patio space though. Lots of students seem to frequent it and I see familiar faces most every weekend.  The coffee & tea isn't all that fantastic however (though where is it that good in this city?).  Standard shake tea bags (loose leaf should be a standard by now) and coffee that's been sitting too long in their carafes.  However, their friendly atmosphere and eclectic music make up for this shortcoming in my opinion.

ZxfIaQsmAjox6eANWvu1mg.text: the worst coffee shop ever, over priced and gross.... I found dog hair in my coffee... They even charged me for tap water.... This place is uncomfortable and obviously more worried about money than customers.. I'll never go back..

aPOHdZFvXVMDMrBYQkhIkQ.text: Not bad. Pumpkin spice was a little watered down so I called and the owner Marco said come back and they'll give me a complimentary drink.  Came back 2 weeks later, ordered the salted caramel mocha and it was pretty good. A little too chocolatey, but the service was good and they have a ton of different flavors.  The little ones had a hot chocolate and it wasn't too chocolatey. So..my verdict..it's 24 hours.  How can you beat that?

LLDHXtl05yql6gwKEbnL3Q.text: I've been going here for many, many moons.This place was great for awhile, then it got a little shady (I watched a barista do some pretty gnarly stuff foodhandling-wise, not malicious but obviously the result of poor or no training), and now I'm a pretty big fan again. I gave it another try after staying away for awhile and I'm pleased I came back.  The drinks are good - yeah, they're not cheap, but the quality justifies the prices IMO. Food is good but a bit pricey for what you get. An $8 sandwich should come with some chips or fruit or something and the prep is often inconsistent. The presentation (wooden boards) is cool. If I get hungry while I'm there I'm generally satisfied but if I can wait til I leave I will.  Pros: Vegan options (they even have a raw vegan brownie and truffle at times), alternative milks (coconut, hemp, cashew, almond, soy), freshly made gourmet chocolates (apparently the owner is learning the craft, which is pretty awesome IMO), good quality coffee (the coffee actually tastes yummy, not burnt like SOME places...), nice mix of people, friendly vibe, nice employees, local and not chain/huge coffee conglomerate  Cons: Seating is ragingly uncomfortable and the internet is only accessible via 4-hour codes you get by request after you've purchased something (this policy seems to change all the time though - sometimes there are codes, sometimes there aren't). Clearly the owner doesn't like squatters, which is and understandable concern but still funny since there are always people hanging out for hours anyways, they're just smoking hookah instead of staring at their laptops. Oh, and the music is borderline awful at times. Setting a vibe is one thing; earsplitting EDM is not. If I wanted to be at a club, I'd go to one. Used to have actually coffee cups and plates, now most stuff comes out in paper to-go cups and food containers. It's also really crowded sometimes but that's good for Madhouse, just not so great when you get there late and there's nary a stool to be had  Overall, I recommend it, even if I want to say I don't so people like you will stay out of my seat. :D

FxvRH_YV7nR-vFxuFKCx7Q.text: Terrific coffee spot. It has a strange sort of fast food feel what with the drive through and the staff all wearing headsets to take drive through orders, but one cannot deny that the coffee is excellent, the wifi is free, and it is a good spot.

q1zByuB6_slsNJwi0rXXdg.text: I have been twice now and have loved their drinks! It is a nice and clean place to work from, it is a little small, but I have never had a hard time finding seating. The employees are so friendly and give great service! Also, they are so quick finishing my drinks. The other patrons here are very friendly. I am adding this to a list of my favorite coffee places to frequent!

wGxZNoOWVzyVP6yxSEGs4Q.text: I've been here a few times and the food is usually decent, today it was terrible I ordered a BTL pretty simple it's 3 ingredients well turns out 1 of those ingredients wasn't (just because it's green doesn't make it lettuce it's some random garnish) and some kind of cheese puree please also slice the tomato not squash a whole one into the bread. I don't know but today it was terrible which made me focus one the decor, now I get the whole focus on information but this is just a barrage of negativity and visual of death and hatred toward conformity to a level of it I'm being honest disgust. I want to drink coffee eat and relax not be bombarded with social justice on a level of revolutionary status let's be genuine here you're serving food and drinks not marching down the street to stop some random thing MSNBC was spouting this week that mildly annoyed you and you have all the free time to spout your just learned knowledge which you didn't know about 10 minutes earlier but know is the most important thing in life and needs resolving this second, relax please and have some positive visuals about your obviously biased agenda placed about the establishment at least that way we're not staring at a naked starving child holding hands with Ronald McDonald and Micky Mouse or some gas mask wearing person surrounded by death, did i miss the memo when the leftist was about hatred towards anyone not following their polices I thought it was about free thought and equality and none conforming seems like it's now more towards push this shit in your face so much and if you don't like it you're a disgusting bigot... i just want a nice cup of coffee and a fresh sandwich in peace. I ask you nicely after my rant to just chill and stop trying to over do it...

f3AKHOTbRD2eQLwzuFfOew.text: Yelp 100 Challenge * 100/100   Madhouse coffee is located less than a mile away from where I live and I can't believe I have kept myself away from this Hippie, San Francisco-esque coffee shop for so long!  Late Thursday afternoon and pretty tired out from schoolwork, I came here for a More Cowbell sandwich treat - roast beef folded into a slice of herb infused focaccia bread and topped with cheddar, lettuce and tomatoes - and a Nutella white chocolate frappe.   As if they weren't filling enough, I made an effort to take myself out of study mode to appreciate the cool artworks around the cafe and random funny deets on the cashier. That fed my artsy soul pretty well and I came out of there physically and spiritually refreshed. For $10 or more spent, you get a wifi code. There's a patio out for peeps in need of a smoke and did I say this cafe is open 24 hours?   Coming here to study again soon and get things done!

7mYEwmhOr4yOb0Wwj0_xhQ.text: I feel like they put their soul into the way they make their drinks and that's what makes it so good:).

bgLzRmbBE1hGUQUAHX5Big.text: I don't frequent this place often since I am not a coffee drinker. This place is always packed with mostly college students studying and a mix of other folks. There are outlets available if you need a quick charge on your device. The chocolate croissant is pretty good and they have a variety of coffees and teas. They even have some sandwiches and other light fare on the menu. A nice place to get your chill on!

t7NbVDm3J4olRIgl1y2B4A.text: I was very excited to see this coffee house pop up in summerlin and it's on my way to work. I thought they were associated with the one in Henderson but I learned they were their own entity. Either way they are open 24 hours, the staff is awesome and they serve intelligentsia brew which is one of the Better brews available in the las Vegas coffee shop market.  I love the coziness of the place, the quick and quality brews as well as the drive through. And don't be shocked by the lower prices for stuff that other coffee shops overcharge for. You can get homemade desserts like tiramisu here for as little as 5 bucks. Plus they have nutella tiramisu for all you nutella lovers- as well as a nutella latte or red velvet latte.   They have a cute outdoor patio too so when the weather is nice you can always hang out there and enjoy your coffee. I thought it was a nice touch. Not all places have  that.  So I've been here a few time now and I'm enjoying it so I will continue to go back until it becomes trendy......

quQxRv1YANx8CPGocWNApw.text: Love spending my free time here! Perfect for doing homework or just simply hanging out with friends! Great milk alternative options, very vegan friendly. Amazing environment and 24 hours. The baristas are all really nice and actually have conversations with you if they aren't super busy!

w6FRwNFLDWr37ub5nb7kng.text: We had just been out for breakfast so we could not partake of the great looking almond croissants, the Nutellamisu or other pastries here but we were so happy with out crushed coconut mocha and regular iced mocha today. In fact, my husband did not even know why I did a rapid fancy turn in to Madhouse Coffeehouse when I did: it was because after moving to Las Vegas we had not yet experienced a cool coffee shop. And I don't mean the other place- the one everyone else goes to. I saw Madhouse!!! This is that cool shop I have been craving!! And it is a few miles away but knowing that the looney tuna and the pastrami sandwich, Intelligentsia coffees and a place to relax is here: this is priceless!!! Staff are great.

wqNDJR70oU3zrcuOGZGf8Q.text: Great place to get coffee and some grub late at night or when everything else is closed. Chairs are not too comfy but hey, nothing else is opened other than starbucks.

NtCKqgIFHzL9GYmgCs8izQ.text: This place is nice, I got their Red Velvet coffee and it's great. A really nice environment and friendly staff. I'd come check this place out.

_J3z6aNvOQXNzRxuFPN5gA.text: always love coming here. the overall vibe is always really nice and the crowd is friendly, employees and customers alike. their customer service is always great!  they have super yummy vegan options and their dairy alternatives are bomb :)

gAoGNRG4P_rfQWaHoFTMJg.text: I've noticed Anti-American propaganda that they've displayed in the past and tried to look away and forgive them. I've had plans to bring friends, clients and coworkers here (I work for a large company), but plans have changed. I'll never understand anti-American people who live in such an amazing nation, yet bash it and condemn people who are patriotic. Freedom of expression and choice is what makes us great! But their expression is hateful. It must be sad to live in a place that you despise. I'd like for them to name the countries with better fundamentals, way of life, etc. No country is perfect but America is certainly a place to be proud of! If you have a family member who has excelled, wouldn't you be proud? Don't be afraid to be proud of this great nation! Go USA!!!!

iiQYQ9smJrU_xwl4plXIxg.text: One of my favorite coffee shops to go to in Vegas. A regular place for me for homework and to meet with friends and student organizations. Great atmosphere, friendly staff, great drinks and sandwiches. Definitely recommend the Island of Capri sandwich.

A50rSmohJFRqMLt8KfwA7Q.text: I searched for a popular 24 hour coffee house and MadHouse came up on Yelp. Upon walking in i liked how cozy the place felt and spotted a nice comfortable chair to sit in after ordering.  I am a sucker for a Caramel Macchiato, so when i saw it on their menu i immediately knew what i wanted.  The lady who took my order was incredibly nice and easy going. Also you can choose to have your coffee in a ceramic cup too! pretty snazzy!  I find it kind of interesting they sell smokes and hookah tobacco here. I saw they were selling a hookah setup in the front along with packs of cigarettes and other smokes behind the counter.  The man who handed me my caramel macchiato saw my vape and said i was able to vape inside. I said "really?" in a surprised look and he said as long as there's no drugs, there is no problem. Now, i wouldn't be filling the whole cafe with vapor but i love to vape with a good cup of coffee and since there's no problem vaping here i believe this is my favorite cafe.  Short but sweet. Definitely give their coffee a good go if you're in the area. Friendly customer service and great tasting coffee in a home-y and comfortable shop. Will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium sized caramel macchiato in a ceramic cup alongside my vape!

zW5Bmt4G6q-tiIo80wyx0Q.text: The coffee is great but it's easy to feel a bit out of place with a bunch of body shaming Trump haters. Ironic, that the owner, a 1% er, uses propaganda to distract millenials from the fact they just dropped twenty bucks on coffee and a pastry. Very insulting to those who don't subscribe to your politics. Guess body shaming the President is okay if you're one of the "intelligencia" patrons of Madhouse. The rest of us have to live in the real world. Boo Madhouse! Sucks cause I used to think your artistic flair was cool, but over time you've become pathetic. I wish you'd get back to business. A business that served great food and coffee and was more inclusive of those who don't necessarily subscribe to your politics. Your 'artistic privilege' crosses the line and is a slap in the face to those of us who have spent thousands of dollars in your establishment over the years.

cskADLBWVwWlHaGkn95Zlw.text: I love coming to MadHouse. My favorite is the monkey mocha...peanut butter and banana with my coffee!? Yes please!  The atmosphere is great too; an easy place to study or meet a friend just to hang out.

ceIklDTpNbdyQuwa6JKDTg.text: I went to try this place out since my coffee shop I usually go to was out of the way. I can tell you I regret not driving the extra few miles. The service was okay. The owner/manager was just standing there fraternizing in front of the register while I'm standing trying to make an order. Then they stand in the middle of the already crowded walkway not giving a crap who needs to maybe.. walk by? Idk maybe that would of been nice. As a conservative and firm believer in this country some Of the propaganda made me sick to my stomach. that a place like this can actually stay afloat financially having a TV up that just trashes our president with memes? Like come on? Then you go into the bathroom and it looks like you walked into a 3rd world countries bathroom. With quotes on the wall saying Freedumb is Slavery.. or communism fought for our rights not our army? You won't be seeing me back at this shit hole. For the liberal whack who seems to be the owner of this place Freedumb got you that Ferrari you are driving.

KpEHtiOd7o8CLaRpV_8waA.text: Good coffee, friendly, and nice place.   Greedy with their wifi need to spend at least $4 to for 1 hour and over $7 if want to use any longer than that where other coffee places have unlimited

GxyZbhfKgEp0LjXfEOnaOg.text: I decided to make a drive out to get my coffee, and that morning, I didn't want the usual Starbucks. Glad I decided on this cute little 24-hour coffee shop. That's right, 24 hours.  The ladies behind the counter were helpful, even though the one who took my order seem to be new. However, she rang up my order quickly and was very friendly. Unlike Starbucks, if you order regular coffee, they have a few selections off to the side you can pour yourself. That's when I saw that you can even purchase cigarettes from them. I'm not a smoker myself, but just thought that was definitely unique. I guess for the late-night coffee drinkers...  After getting my coffee and sesame bagel, I thought I'd definitely come back here. It's a nice change up from the chains coffee/bagel shops we see so often.

pxONrJvWaV5UfGkFg0f8yQ.text: I had the tiramisu and I usually get frapps or smoothies  Love the vibe except the drinks can get too sweet.

HCGvisxRNIa0vatjh3PW1g.text: Love the hot Chai Latte here!  We order ours with almond or soy milk.  Tastes so much better than Starbucks/Coffee Bean!  Relaxed atmosphere and open 24/7!!!  So glad it's around the corner from us!

EzU5W1-EZFi1kpZVJ1RUiA.text: By far the best place to get your coffee and hang out with friends, the ambience is cool. All there desserts, coffee, sandwich and pesto salad are amazing. The owner is super nice and really cool. The staff are friendly. Once you come here you will definitely be back.

enlLxJ3QrOpCOBBeWe5bsQ.text: ***Update: I ordered one of their strawberry smoothies and didn't like it, it tasted like a melted snow cone tbh they just use syrup. Everything else is pretty good tho.

vnM5Ag7K8oTpk5pFIudabA.text: Weird service at drive through but I still love this place.  Cool location(right across from the park), huge variety of drinks, and good WIFI!!  You can come here and just sit in a corner for hours without being bothered on a comfy couch if you're lucky enough to score one. The coffee shop is very comfortable and even has outside seating for when Vegas weather allows you to enjoy the outdoors.   They have a ton of options when it comes to drinks and desserts. Great place to hit up if you have a sweet tooth.

T3qD8FODUom-Wnco_x9cAQ.text: I like that they are open late, but not a place to spend long periods of time (aka - not built to be welcoming to people who want to camp out for several hours on a laptop), and that's what I'm looking for.

7v57eyokkOYGmULB5MW44w.text: Came here for brunch on Sunday. The white chocolate nutella mocha was extremely good.   I had the Supermodel as a salad. It was okay. The usual suspect sandwich was a little greasy but overall okay.   The prices are definitely inflated and the wait was equivalent to that of a sit down restaurant.    Overall, decent overpriced food. Good drinks and ambiance.

B7A7QxdsFr9-aRmNjbEX7Q.text: It was pretty great! Vegan sandwiches and drinks are great. But the raw brownie almost broke my tooth, about 5 unsightly hard pits inside

2JNt0cUQ3L5zwTRkuShP0w.text: Made a quick stop here while waiting  to get called into the DMV down the road.  Went through the drive thru and ordered a blended mocha monkey, hot matcha latte and a "Usual Suspect" sandwich on baguette to split.  The mocha monkey had real peanut butter blended into the drink which you can definitely taste and the matcha tea latte (which is my go to drink) was nice and smooth and not too sweet.  I usually like ordering the matcha either after dinner when I am looking for something not too heavy and/or sweet or in this case something light to go with my breakfast sandwich, the matcha delivers every time!  This was the first time we ordered a sandwich and decided to split it just to hold us over until lunch.    The usual suspect included scrambled eggs, cream cheese,cheddar cheese and bacon.  We decided to order the sandwich on baguette, the baguette was soft and crusty on the outside and the combination of the fillings made this a perfect breakfast sandwich.  Definitely want to come back and try more of the sandwiches there.  *The Large blended drinks are really big, we were surprised of how big it was, probably could've split this between 2 people.

bZRIpfMo-eiIfLSDXwduZA.text: Hands down favorite coffee shop in Vegas. From the interior design, to the great guest service it's the place to go for the best experience. Best cup of coffee I've ever had. Get the White Mocha, hot or on the rocks. You won't regret it.

rxQujo30aQ2EfZh1OSPVDA.text: Our first visit: awesome!! The best nutella coffee !!! The pastries are delicious and good service... And pet friendly:)

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qe7Y1AL6CD_6FMJvO2fgCw.text: The food and drinks are good, but the service is slow and kind of hit or miss. I like the patio area when the weather is nice.

D2rrhmfAhioEKDsEh-JMdw.text: Ok I've been here 4 days in a row already. It's great! The tea is refreshing, the blended Nutella is delicious, the blended red velvet is heaven, the French macaroons are so yummy, and the raw vegan brownies are so moist. Seriously try this place.

ymtOezmQpUewqilhLSDmug.text: Atmosphere is good but music too loud. Also coffee is good but their prices are 33-50% higher than everyone else. Would not come back due to pricing and loud music.

fwZpUOwx7LDnPtVt23inFg.text: This place is 24 hours!!!!! Coffees, teas, smoothies!! You name it. This place is for all those who crave late night coffee, or even delicious treats. I love this place, they are always friendly and always consistent.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I am in love with their Macha tea!!!

JFkxYZg3GWKd89jYgZyLmA.text: Love it here. So many options. Kids love it too. They do all the drinks no coffee for them. Its a great atmosphere. Very cool. The employees are so amazing. We always have a blast going through the drive thru.

BJjwxFuR1puABl8KCXwudA.text: This coffee shop is amazing. I live downtown and whenever I'm around I've gotta stop and get my Nutella white chocolate mocha. Service is great as well. They make sure you love your drink or else they will make you a new one. Stop by and stay caffeinated

FR8r7vZ2k5CIfI4CFx1ZVQ.text: The food is sub-par, but the drinks are always great. The reason for the one star is because the service always sucks. One time I ordered a red velvet blended and they literally forgot my drink. My friend who ordered after me got hers fifteen minutes before I finally went up and asked what was going on with me order. Turns out they forgot and I had already paid for my drink....no apology just a quick here you go. That's only one instance, I could keep going, but here we are.

ksBP-OhHgeOZcK6LswD2pg.text: My Girl turned me onto this place, I like the "Mad Cow" it's a Hazelnut latte, very nommy! The staff is always very nice, they will even add sugar and whatever you want for you then this is up there with my other favorite coffee house which you can see in my reviews. They have some  awesome tiramisu and muffins here. They are also a great bakery.  If you find yourself on this side of town, I would recommend you give this place a go. I do not think you will be disappointed.  They also have free Wi-Fi :)

uNaG_DR5JzkHW4f7DMjFlA.text: Nutella tiramisu! And delicious cold-brewed coffee.

_AwNxgf7ciFN1hWYZL6v5w.text: I absolutely love Madhouse Coffee. I was shown this place from a friend, and this has been my go to cafe for awhile now. I've tried almost every drink on the menu without being disappointed once. The 24/7 availability makes it even better if someone needs a quick fix before work, or a place to relax with a hot cup of coffee and a hookah.

BXQyGSoYlQtWGfriWgg3tA.text: Funky set up, in a good way with a unique style. Well run, with surprisingly good customer service and really tasty treats and drinks. There are even healthy lunch options, which I love!

IxkOm5utHo72unBbiXi8MA.text: Good food & good service but dirty place! Couches are ripped, food residues from everywhere, windows are dirty. I didnt like it. If you charge $3.95 for a cup of coffee I'd expect more.

3hOWpqX9yu6Q9LboElD2pA.text: If you like coffee and pastries, and need a place to socialize all hours of the night because you're under the age of 21, this is the place to be. Open 24hrs for your convenience. Good selection of coffee and pastries. Not a great place to chill or study, very loud atmosphere. They play house and electro music, haha. Feels more like a lounge, minus the liquor. Very friendly staff.

wV6P2V5G9dQ5Pk6gE3hlKQ.text: It's A Grind has been a place that I'll end up at with my partner(s) in crime after a long night.  We love to wind down with some coffee and conversation, and It's A Grind makes for a great place to do just that.  24 Hour coffee shop?  With board games to help entertain yourself?  Yes please.  If you stop by and see me there, challenge me to a game of Othello.  I would say that I play this game 90% of the time I stop by here, and I barely lose, so bring it on!    It's A Grind offers customers a selection of coffee, smoothies, blended coffee drinks, sandwiches, pastries, cigarettes, cigars... You can kill some serious time here depending on what you enjoy.  Overall I enjoy the fact that this place is 24 hours, but other than that it's just another coffee shop.  If it weren't for their hours, I don't think I would stop by so often.

G24SKHXunyWgnLvM6fI5hA.text: This place is my safe haven. They have quality coffee, they even make bear figures with the creamer! It's open twenty four seven, which is perfect for any fellow insomniac - like myself. They even have a pulp fiction pop art piece in the bathroom. Overall, a phenomenal place - although if you're going in hopes that a fellow stranger will befriend you, this probably isn't that place. Go with a group of people, or a friend.

_Z00hkqzDYYdPHip-nkOQw.text: Had a Chemex here, pretty good coffee.  Alongside a chill environment and being open late, it's also a great place to study.

9cZ8dJnAmC_sziRm4DI4gQ.text: I love the service here, I have been coming in for years now, I like being able to work on my computer anytime of day, and also have a nice vibe of people.  Kudos to Marco (the owner)

AxWrUK0jQSnU8SAUTIr2fA.text: Where have all the good coffee shops gone? Lap dances: No problem. Lap tops and lattes: Now, that's gonna be tricky. I just read that Rejavanate closed its doors, and even though I don't believe everything I read, I did call the other morning and no one answered. I am thinking they are gone. So, here I am at It's A Grind, which is a chain. Sunrise Coffee is just too far for a lazy afternoon.   This location has a charming Las Vegas patio, and every time we drive by, there are at least 20 caffeine fiends living it up in the sunshine. I always say, "What is going on there?" Today, we found out. I think part of the secret is that this is a fiend's paradise; they sell both coffee and cigarettes, including American Spirit for all of you health conscious smokers. They also sell cigars, flavored cigars, and hookahs! If you have a legal mind-altering addiction, um, I think they have it, but just to clarify, despite the name, they do not offer lap dances.   The vices they do offer are pretty much all wasted on me because I generally don't do coffee, and I don't smoke. Still, there is something for everyone, and my something happened to be a 50/50 today. If you covet creamsicles, this is the spot. A 50/50 is fresh squeezed OJ blended with Ghiradelli White Chocolate, and it is genius blended with goodness. Yum. They also have some sandwiches, breakfast bagels and Nutella.  The crowd is cool. The service is friendly. I wish it were a little bigger, and I wish they had couches. Also, the WiFi is not limitless. You have 4-hours to get in and get done. Still, the patio is nice; they are open 24-hours, and the 50/50 might be habit-forming.

jHqGWZJ6syD0oWrsjLtpWg.text: Love the Nutella white mocha blend & the threesome sandwich :) vibe there is awesome and great service! and i like the fact they keep the hookahs outside so it doesn't interrupt those not using the hookah. Going back to try more coffee and blended drinks!

oZLWVoKVvDtap_jeDEqj0Q.text: I ordered a Latte and they made it with drip coffee. The latte only tasted like frosted milk. I asked if I could have a shot of Espresso and told them my latte didn't taste anything but milk and they told me the espresso machine wasn't on. They turned it on and gave me a shot of espresso and charged me for it, not to mentioned I tipped the associate for my latte. Worst customer service!!!!!! Especially that we had to wait 10 min before to order because the 2 associates were chatting in the back. Will not go back there......

2cGOF2P6IPXBTYGl-hmDRg.text: Great little coffee shop. I have been coming here for years and they are always pleasant and continue to add products all the time. The beat gnocchi I've had and coffee thst actually keeps this night owl awake. You also can't beat that it's 24/7 and allows for a nice cigar with your chappacino. A vegas must!

Q_EJIDj99NvYnx-FtEKclw.text: I love this place. The drinks are good, the crew is friendly, and it's open 24 hours. I've never gone in with anyone but I've never felt alone here. It seems to draw friendly talkative patrons.  I've had intelligent and interesting conversations with people I didn't know two minutes earlier. Their food is made to order and right in front of you so you know it's fresh. I felt comfortable enough with here to bring my ferret with me, and as soon as I did the crew was happy to see him and greet him when we come in.  They have a great little outside patio for smokers or people who want to sit outside. At this point it is sort of my second home. The prices are also really good, coffee or tea and a healthy sandwich is under $10.

O9eCKhbH5P4HRNnB78400Q.text: Stumbled on it  accidentally, what a find!!!  Coffee is great, but their Nutella  drinks and deserts are to knock your socks off if you like Nuttella, they also have a very yummy hot coco!!!! Must try

6Jq9eS2n71nQVxeon1EVbQ.text: Had the grasshopper iced coffee. Better than dessert! Great little gem with a good vibe and good music playing.

uxooFEc8XhFhHl7AOGFuEQ.text: Stopped by for a pick-me up latte and was genuinely surprised at the rich flavorful brew. Like the fact that it has homemade items. Tried a coconut macaroon and was delicious and fresh, bursting with flavor and larger then the ones they serve at Manon (which can be great or dry). Staff worked quick in executing  the order and they have a nice indoor or outdoor seating area to relax in, before moving onto your next destination.

aHDoVrT9dnc4SSsTmOsL5w.text: It was "It's A Grind" but now "Madhouse Coffee." Free wi-fi, good crew, open 24hours, and they added more sandwich on meun.  nice... I was enjoy their crepe. If weather will be warmer I'll stay outside patio and enjoy my latte.

wyNhlJIoLFHbg7oIqiT9QQ.text: I go to It's A Grind probably 4 times a month, due to it being close to where I work...I usually get an egg and cheese bagel or croissant, which are usually satisfying in the mornings. I also order their "freshly squeezed" orange juice...which is really just Odwalla orange juice...I was a little bummed out about that at first, but got over it.   I do not enjoy their coffee at all. I think its some of the worse coffee I've ever tried from "chain" coffee shops. Pleh, sorry IAG. I believe I've tried maybe one of their pastries before? They have a decent size selection, but I don't ever order anything.  They sell all sorts of things here. I've been going to this It's A Grind since last year and they seem to always be adding new things. Shirts, mugs, cigarettes, cigars.   Also, I tried one of the sandwiches they just started selling, wasn't too impressed. Wouldn't order another one...

SN8KBHreNuDwTsOScijpbA.text: Great, friendly service. The red velvet mocha is delicious! Dessert in a cup!

1NkpUjpG5q4-ZCswISmPUw.text: came here at 2 in the morning for a little hot chocolate with my boyfriend & I can say this place is super cute. nothing like Starbucks & the staff are friendly. this was our first time here so we took a few minutes to see what we really wanted & the lady was super patient with us & joked about how we didnt even take that long at all. we went to go sit down & expected to be called up to the front when our order was ready but she brought us our drinks instead which was very nice. really clean but it can get busy & the only thing i don't like is how the couches are literally right by the register. other than that, I will be returning.

dsGZhiBUNS7jcPuxihqBTA.text: I was not impressed. The girl who served me was sick and barely had a voice. I don't want to get sick! I got an espresso and it was way to bitter. A good espresso is about 18 seconds of pouring time, it tasted of about 30 seconds.

bFbiBJ4-la18EEta55-g5Q.text: Their food is delicious! "The Very Charming Pig" is my favorite! Coffee is amazing and great customer service! I love love love this place!

GY3bJbYw9QSQQYol8SnGqw.text: I only heard this after I ordered the coffee but apparently they are only known for their sugary drinks. I don't drink sugary drinks so I ordered a regular black coffee. I wouldn't recommend this place for people that enjoys nice cup of black coffee it tasted very weak and acidic.

8VCobP9vPP8llQfmnXl_1g.text: Bad service. When I waited for one of the three people to acknowledge they had a customer...three more people came in to line up as well. Finally she acknowledged me then told me I had to wait because someone else was in front of me....although I saw no one. Then the guy with change to pay finally got helped. Terrible service. Then the wifi is turned off on you after an hour. Totally lame. I will never be back because its just a hassle.

FsOGRHNpCBZN3gofgISklg.text: I go with my husband and our dogs every weekend.  The coffee is wonderful and the atmosphere second to none.  We love to sit on the patio and relax.  Quentin and Roseanne not only make excellent coffee, they make their customers feel like family.  Marco, the owner, has a great place.  We are True fans.

QuBMJI_vRtgEtg21AJkTUA.text: Good genuine service. Will definitely return. The barista had a great sense of humor. And the place is open 24 hours.

HqQ7-zI3o5zm0KCxY0a3xw.text: this place is so perfect, they are open 24/7, perfect for late night study, not really a coffee drinker, but the tea was awesome, well nothing could go wrong with tea lol they either serve it in ceramic or coffee cup, i also had the pesto salad, which was delish... they also had pretty looking macaroons, so if ur on a diet, better turn away from them... they also serve hookah.. so in conclusion this is the perfect spot for a study session or just to simply hang out... definitely will be coming back for more late night study session... love this place, wish they would have it north side

IRl4z_z7-65ngWmzKnNdeQ.text: Just passing thru on a road trip. Happy I stopped here! After grabbing some actually good pastries for the road from a French bakery up the road (bc the reviews for this place seemed like sweet desserts were more their forte), I needed coffee. The large iced coffee was humongous, and coming from Chicago, the intelligentsia coffee with soy milk tasted familiar and was a great surprise I enjoyed all the way to flagstaff! I also ordered the turkey, ham, pepperoni, provolone, and lettuce sandwich (can't remember the name, something like the "Vito") and I was asked what kind of bread I wanted. Nice... Pleasantly surprised it came toasted. I think my bill was $11 or $13... Not cheap but also totally satisfying.

A7wEdnbQLSEKADtejD9SHg.text: My fiance loves the 50/50.  I don't really eat or drink anything sugary, but once in a while I get my jollies by taking a sip of his drink.  Heaven.

U38Wqjd0Gn7zsum_bSjCrA.text: When I first discovered this place, I wanted to kick myself for going to my local chain coffee shops the entire time I've lived in the area. There is a distinct difference in the food and drink quality here. You can tell the pastries are actually  homemade unlike the packaged thawed out baked goods at most chain shops. The Almond Crossaint is to die for. I am addicted to the Red Velvet blended mocha as it is not too sweet or overwhelming as I expected it might be. It definitely hits the spot. Only disappointment I have was with the sandwiches. I expected the bread to be alot fresher or at least toasted with some sort of olive oil coating or something. I opted for the Ron Jeremy the first time and an egg and cheese the second. I noticed my bread was cold and hard and did not seem to be the freshest both times. I think I might give it another try with maybe a different bread or ask for my bread warmed up. The Coconut blended Mocha is also yummy but a bit too sweet for my taste. The Peanut Butter blended mocha was interesting but again, maybe a bit too much for my taste buds. Try a Macaroon. They have a new flavor daily and are really good.

k78GnOT6_1JPYlp_ElWg7Q.text: The place is in the corner of an outdoor shopping complex. Great place to be out of the way of main stream life. They recently remodeled inside to give the place a more spacious then cluttered look and feel with city urban artwork. The outside has a patio sitting area which is somewhat cluttered. The sandwiches are good and so is the coffee. The service has its ups and downs depending on how busy the place is but usually okay.

n9pSUAM4qZs6J5Z9nUflsg.text: My brother in law and I got coffee here a couple days ago. After some messed up orders, which included overfilling iced coffee that had no almond milk and no equals  and dumping a medium cappuccino into a large cup and serving it to us. we made our complaints known to an unmpowered manager on Thursdays, in which she could not help us or issue a refund. You would expect better service from someone who charges more than Starbucks. The sad part is that we were loyal customers.

mYUwL6SWe_-aUshAELizbQ.text: Went here last week an ordered an iced nonfat/sugar free caramel macchiato but it tasted week and watery.  No coffee taste at all.  Also, what is the point of stirring a caramel macchiato...that is why they are called macchiattos.  I guess Im used to the Bux.

Ksk3uzqRfNtxWySm0VCp7Q.text: The service is great as is the food and drink. Ive been coming here since way before the name change but ever since it became Madhouse its become a little crowded? I liked it more when it felt like a hole in the wall place. Whenever I go there now its just a bunch of yuppies, faux-hipsters who think they're indie for knowing about this place, and "bros" actually using the hookah and being loud. Everything else is great. Its just not as cool to hang out there like it used to be.

s_IezIIFIg-GqZ52L3XOHA.text: First off, the place has a great vibe and the atmosphere is very relaxing. The variety of drinks and food is great, a good amount to choose from. The coffee, if I can even call it that, is way too sweet. I was taken back from my first sip and I couldn't take any more sips after the fourth one because there was just too much sugar. The macaroons were okay, again, too sweet. The service were average, but you'll always see the what seems to be French guy there at night and he is rather friendly. They gave me the wrong drink once and insisted that I ordered it wrong rather than admitting that they got the order wrong, which really bothered me. I took the drink anyways as I didn't want to cause any trouble but that is not the customer service I, or anyone, would want upon. The best thing about Madhouse is the fact that they are 24 hours, living up to the Vegas name because not a lot of place nearby is 24 hours. It is a good place to hang out when everything is closed.

z6sgqOoyZm_-COZrrAf4Nw.text: I would give this place no stars at all if it were possible. As a college student, I spend a lot of time (and money) in coffee shops, and I can honestly say that I will never be going back to this particular coffee shop ever again. I will also be informing everyone that I know about how TERRIBLE their service is, and how extremely RUDE their store owner is. My first experience with MadHouse Coffee was alright. I ordered a spiced chai tea latte (that happened to be nothing special) and stayed for about 15 minutes to study. Their decor is odd, for lack of a better word. You also have to be careful about using their bathroom since the door does not lock properly. My second experience occurred the very next day, and it was by far the WORST customer experience I've ever had in my entire 22 years of life! My best friend and I were in need of a place to study near my school and her home. Seeing as I had another class that night, and wanting a change of scenery, I suggested MadHouse Coffee...BIG MISTAKE, we should have just gone to a Starbucks instead. We were planning on studying for 3 hours there, but promptly left after their store owner was extremely rude to us. We had grabbed a couple of subs before going to this coffee shop and had brought them in with the intention of eating them and ordering coffee and possibly a pastry after wards. This is usually our routine when we go to Starbucks as well. So, when we get there, they have the door propped open, and the owner is sitting outside with whom I assume is a friend, smoking a cigar, resulting in the inside seating area smelling strongly of smoke. So we politely asked if we could close the door, and the guy behind the counter said that "it's your choice." So, instead of subjecting ourselves to second hand smoke, and 45 degree temperature, we close the door. Not long after we settle in, the store manager comes inside and informs us that they do not allow outside food in their shop. So, I respond that we will be buying drinks from them, and store that info in my memory bank for next time. I understand that some places are hurting for business, and therefore make such rules, and I completely understand. It's not like our economy is doing great lately. So, I finish my sub, thinking that's the end of that, but he comes back inside to re-inform my best friend of their no outside food policy (she was still finishing her food up). So she responds with, "Do you want me to throw it away?" And he rudely replies that it's her choice, and pretty much states that if we aren't going to purchase anything then we must leave. This being after we have already informed him that we will be making a purchase and are here to study. So, after he spends time staring her down and flat out humiliating her in front of other customers, she shoves the rest of her food in her backpack, and he walks away, but that's not the end of it. He walks away to gossip with his employees, point at us angrily, and this of course results in some very rude stares. We didn't stay much longer after that, but in the short time period that we were there, there were at least 4 people who do not work there, hanging out behind the counter with there friends, and I noticed hookah, cigarette, and cigar products. Mind you, many of his employees look much to young to be selling any such products. So, if you have small children, STAY AWAY. I am a part-time nanny and regular babysitter. The environment is terrible for kids. Unless you're a parent who is willing to explain the concept of smoking and hookah at a young age, and alright with subjecting them to an extremely rude owner's second hand cigar smoke.  In the end, we ended up at the Starbucks on Fort Apache and Sahara. The employees and manager there are extremely kind. This entire experience has taught me that I should just stick with Starbucks.  Seeing as the owner responded, I'd just like to point out that his reply is obviously RUDE and proves my point. Apparently, he does not want people who buy from Starbucks, McDonalds (which I do not, by the way), and Walmart to stop at his location. I wish he'd advertise that on his door, because I'm sure that he'd lose 80% of his business. We DID NOT bring outside drinks, just a sub, and we had specifically told him that we were planning on buying not only drinks, but most likely would be purchasing pastries as well. I would also like to point out the fact that he states that MadHouse is always busy. Both times that I have been there, there have been no more than 4 people at this location, excluding the people hanging out behind the counter. Now, I am not saying that it is never busy. I'm sure it gets busy especially since it is one of the few 24 hour coffee shops in Vegas, and any 24 hour study location is sure to get busy once the other shops are closed. Just saying.

zWBd5Lna_1-KThXydqfmqA.text: It's a Grind is a nice little coffee house off Desert Inn. It's located in a strip mall which takes away some of the appeal. But in Vegas, what isnt located in a strip mall??? LOL  Anyway, they have great free internet if you purchase from them, a wide variety of coffee and blended drinks, and a good selection of tasty pastries. Except for the extra high prices, I enjoy going there. The music is usually not the typical canned variety, the decor is urban chic, and chairs are comfy, and the staff is always nice and knowledgeable about their products.  Good outdoor seating as well.  Basically everything you hate about Starbucks has been fixed here, except the prices LOL.  Oh and to all the Starbucks employees out there: You guys are a bunch of pretentious fucking assholes who wouldnt know good coffee or service if it spilled in your lap. I pray for the day Star-chucks goes under.  Oh yeah, and unlike so many other things here, they are open 24/7!!!!

Z6ZGHWBJbNWdynv5j1z5YA.text: My favorite coffee shop. This locations opened 24 hours a day so u can go at 5am if you wanted to get that coffee fix in. The red velvet is my favorite! They also have awesome sandwiches!!! And the atmosphere is great. Bring a group of friends to play board games

LnKBIb6ovwULDpvX2lQtrg.text: Great coffee but I paid $8 for a small dirty almond chai. I expect to pay extra for modifiers but yikes!  Being lactose intolerant I found out through the owner that to change to almond or coconut milk, it's a $1 up charge.

5SMwFyhvzo-qUCvFrlSapQ.text: MadHouse coffee is a solid, un-cookie cutter coffee place in Vegas. I really appreciate places that aren't a Starbucks or a Coffee Bean or a Seattles Best. I try to avoid chains as much as possible unless it's a gas station.  MadHouse is located next to one of my favorite nail shops in town. Usually before a pedi on Sundays, I'll stop in at MadHouse which is never too busy. Service is always friendly and they offer some unique flavors: Nutella, Red Velvet, and a few other that are escaping me at the moment.Trust me, these drinks are sweet. I feel like I may get diabetuuus every time I indulge.  MadHouse offers homemade sandwiches and baked item. All of which have been decent, nothing that has me running back or craving. MadHouse has a drive-thru (which doesn't encompass their huge menu - go inside people, especially if you're ording the diabetuuuus lattes and whatnot), offers free Wifi, and has open mic nights, which are odd because the place isn't really built to hold more than I'd say 10-15 comfortably and the tables are like huge slabs of cement.   My ordered a big iced here once and when I noticed she wasn't drinking it, she said it was sour, and it was. I told her to stop by on the way back to her house, I ran in, they replaced it and apologized and offered me a free cookie (which I declined because it's FESTIVAL SEASON, baby).  MadHouse is good, not great, and certainly not the best coffee house in Vegas, but a nice change of pace from the landscape of so many Starbucks.

C4fukOdjZDaNU_btCdm_Og.text: Ashley was representing from of the house. She had great vibrant energy all of her suggestions were on point. Nutellamisu is made fresh daily. The place has a funky spunky vibe . Definitely coming back

XJE9Qt5wiNHoVKxxh6uEmw.text: This is by far my favorite coffee place in town. They have an excellent selection of coffee, tea, and milks (hemp, almond, soy, etc). They're open 24 hours which is just fantastic plus the vibe inside so so great. No judgey hipster baristas.  They make great pastries and the owner just started making chocolates which are delicious. My husband and I go here all the time for a quick coffee break or even lunch on a Saturday. Highly recommend everything about this place.

7S7aDRwKW1mSedwJ-QNcsQ.text: Great coffee, environment, and wifi.  I would recommend anyone that needs a place to study or just have a good coffee to come here!

SWfVGN_gAuk3OBL85KtNTQ.text: The cute Latino boy here is phenomenal.  I wish I knew his name.  He is adorable, and so on point.  The employees here are so kind and friendly.  If you're looking for Starbucks before it became a Monsanto corp.   This is it .     Madhouse cannot disappoint

pgN_SCdfcLnO2XfhMyaKhA.text: I love coffee shops but I can think of a few off the top of my head that I'd rather frequent.  And no I'm not including any major chains like Starbucks or Coffee Bean.  I have been here twice.    COFFEE: I'm not a fan of their drinks.  The first time I tried some mint mocha latte.  Meh.  It was mediocre.  The second time I tried the white chocolate hazelnut... gah.  Just terrible.  This leads me to my other point...they're not cheap.  Since I spent like 6 dollars on this latte I decided to finish it but it was SO SWEET that I felt like I was going to gag for the next three hours after it.  I've never experienced that with coffee. My boyfriend seemed to like his drinks both times.  He seems okay with coffee drinks being somewhat of a dessert; I, however, do not like my drinks to taste like a dessert.  AMBIANCE: I like to study in coffee shops so ambiance is important to me.  Too small inside and nothing special.  Their music is better than most though.    WIFI, GRR: The way they do their wifi is just annoying to me.  As someone else said, they're greedy.  Why come here when other coffee shops with better coffee have unlimited wifi with purchase?  I guess their only appeal is being open 24 hours.  Last time I went I was studying from my textbook but my boyfriend wanted to use their wifi.  He spent 12 dollars because he got a pastry and latte; when he asked the lady for a wifi slip she gave him the "4$-7$ One hour" slip, even though he paid more and should have received more wifi time.  Even typing that makes me so peeved because this shouldn't even be an issue.  Not only did she short him but I also spent 6 dollars on my subpar drink so we really should have gotten additional time.  Like I said though... why is this even a thing?!  The place isn't even big enough to have a ton of people slowing down the wifi.  SILVER LINING/TL;DR: They have a wide array of sandwich choices which is a nice option to have.  They also have a drive through, which is convenient.  It's not terrible but two stars means, "Meh. I've experienced better." and that is a perfect way to describe my sentiment about this place.

BUHjhkmhgErIsIWuyTkejg.text: This is a very cute coffee place in Las Vegas. Love the coffee there! It's opened 24 hours so it's great if you need a midnight coffee run or if you are staying up late to study. There are two large tables and the rest of the tables are small (2 person table). One of the cons is that the place is pretty tiny. Overall I had a great experience there!

aDOts35Ev_ycxZ4WkjMyNA.text: Love their nutellamisu --- tiramisu with nutella.  They also have several variations of tiramisu ... forgot the names. BUT TIRAMISU!!  Will have to have more of that when I return!  We also got their iced latte and it was a nice smooth blend.  There were so many choices that it was hard to pick ... maybe red velvet latte next time? :)   They also serve a lot of blended coffee drinks, pastries, and sandwiches.  Worth a trip if you're out in the Summerlin area. :)

W1A1oOT4511s5clayy59Ug.text: Amazing coffee dates begin with fantastic customer service and great tasting coffee. My second time here  Came here yesterday for a break away from my daughter with the great company of my grandmother. it was super packed, which I had never seen before. especially at 1pm. Great sign that business is booming!  Walking in, I knew I wanted something cool and refreshing since it was over 80 degrees out. So i ordered a 16 oz carmel mocha frap. On the other hand my gram is old fashion and was craving coffee so she got a plain old black coffee. I like that when you order plain coffee, you receive as much as you like. Which is a great deal you cant sway from.   Since it was lunch time we wanted something small and filling. Looking at the top, far menu behind the counter we couldnt read well. Yes, I have bad eyes :P The young lady at the counter was sweet and helpful and handed us larger, clearer menus that said the sandwiches and what was in them. We finally decided upon the Turkey, bacon, guac. I was watching my carb intake, so I couldnt decide between their two options listed. The girl was kind enough to offer a third, hidden choice.. it was their healthy spinach wrap. that was what we went with. I being the fatty asked for a side of mayo.   Sitting, the coffee was ready within five minutes or so. The sandwich took another five or so and they made it fresh in front of us. It was the most delicious wrap I had ever had no joke. The bacon was extremely crunchy. The guac wasnt overwhelming and there was a huge amount of turkey. I was impressed. They had cut it in half and it was a generous size sandwich wrap.   Love that this place is 24 hours, dogs are allowed out on the patio (they have doggie water bowls outside), free wifi (with code), has a drive through, tasty coffee and reasonably priced breakfast and lunch sandwiches. sounds like a winner to me. This is def going to be my favorite spot from now on!!

x4agueBERGcm7E0QzibgIA.text: I fell in love with this place. My cousin introduced me to this place when I stayed with her while on holiday. I ended up going everyday for the length of my time there.

WIPhNri6JAURpXlHyp21Cw.text: This place is amazing great coffee minus hard seats and small area it's still so laid back....

B5NfFWcgB13PLlnUsTpIsQ.text: I've been going to this coffee shop for a long time back when it was an 'It's a Grind'. Madhouse has always been my local cafe for hanging out late with friends or having a lunch date during the day when you want to catch up with an old friend. I usually love the environment, and the drink/food options is delectable.  BUT I was given the worst service I've ever received by and girl named Haley tonight in the drive thru.  H: "Hi, my name is Haley, Welcome to Madhouse"  Me: Hi Haley, I need just a moment to order.  H: "Ok."  Me: Ok, I'm ready to order.  Me: Okay, she wants a Italian Hot Chocolate.  H: "Okay"  Me: Can you make that with soy?  H: (raising her voice) "I thought that's what you originally ordered?"  Me: Yes but I didn't say with soy, so can you make it with soy please?  H: (impatiently) "So you want a White Nutella Hot Chocolate?"  Me: No, I just want an Italian Hot Chocolate made with soy.  H: (irritated) "Just the one drink?"  Me: No, I'll take-  H: (Rudely) What else do you want?  Me: i said I'll take a-  H: (interrupting) "Pull up to the window"  Me: (Drive passed her window angry)  I was so upset that she was rude that I just left and I've never skipped out on coffee.   Marco, if you're reading this you should really do something about this girl. She's the only reason you're gonna be losing a 10+year regular and getting a 2 star review.

xtqpzjosCuF5jn024RZydA.text: Late post but I actually went in this morning at around 12:30 am and was greeted right away. I love the atmosphere and it's such a cute little coffee spot inside!  The guy who actually helped me and took my order was friendly! Great customer service! He helped me make a decision on what I wanted to order. I ended up getting a BLT and 2 macarons. I LOVE LOVE the macarons. The flavors I got were black berry and white chocolate and pumpkin and white chocolate. Super yummy!   Earlier that day my brother also got me a hot matcha latte which I also fell in love with!   The only thing I don't really like is that mostly every drink on the menu is TOO sweet. I wish they had healthier or less sugary beverages on the menu.   Overall4/4.5

HCdEHhyStCNFMriEI_W6qA.text: An environment that stimulates conversation, work and fun. This is the quintessential coffee shop. Beautiful art, great music and an awesome staff to top it off.  Drink: hot match latte

QjUcjKX9b0nX1upLSeKJ_g.text: Great tasting coffee, awesome atmosphere and chill place to study and edit in peace.employees are friendly.

Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2Kqz62Oo42Tb8_z5Lxc0_w.text: Second time visiting and it's an OK spot. The garlic-pesto smell was intense and overwhelming! Not sure if they have hoods or why they would have such a pungent dish on the menu at a coffee house. My clothes reeked of it when I left.  It turned into a bit of a day care today with parents and their 3 year old kids in tow arriving at about 5 p.m. The kids yelled and screamed to no end. Can't kick the kids out, but makes me want to come back during a less distracting time. The drinks are hella expensive and finding a simple tea on the menu was a challenge. I did manage to have the Red Velvet Mocha drink and I'll stick to getting my red velvet fix from cake.

fStcR02zuovmBHmLPgOc1A.text: I went here today to try it out and when I walked in the door no one said anything to me for about two minutes they took my order it was really robotic they might as well have a self check out. I ordered a Nutella White chocolate mocha it was OK but it was not worth almost 6 dollars. I miss when this location was a it's a grind coffee shop. I will  be going back to coffee bean which is my normal stop and I get way more coffee for the same price.

C8nzyRDaRuF9hZ31OScfXA.text: My boyfriend & I are always here. Before we started dating, we actually hung out here during late nights & just talk. ANYWAY!, the service is always great. The sandwiches are flavorful, & I definitely recommend the Japanese Matcha green tea, blended. Bonus, it's open 24 hours :)

5IWq6N2BKw6TzWVnDWiwOA.text: Items selected:  Croissant Bread Pudding White Chocolate Raspberry Macaron Almond Croissant Nutellamisu Americano  With 9 on the Plate not yet serving up sweets and myself running low on caffeine it was to MadHouse Coffee that I walked after dinner and always hoping to find a new, local coffee shop to love and support I'll simply say that save for the kitschy decor and 24-hour service there isn't a whole lot to like about MadHouse at all.  Locally owned and operated with a menu of drinks both classic and novel plus a collection of "pastries baked fresh on the premises" it with a simple Americano that my experience began and faring well enough at a mere $2.50 it was onward to pastry that I moved, the promise of '100% Charent Butter' ostensibly promising the quality of Echire but not a single item better than average, with one in particular an early contender for worst thing I'll eat in 2014.  Starting first with a $3.24 Almond Croissant it would be hard to imagine something more doughy and less crisp coming from 7-Eleven and moving right along to a $2.50 White Chocolate Raspberry Macaron with decent crackle yielding gummy crumb and sweet 'frosting' of a non-descript flavor I sat and wondered exactly what was going on; a brief reprieve found in admirable, albeit microwave-heated bread pudding drizzled in light caramel.  At this point sitting with half a macaron and 2/3 of the croissant unfinished it was last, and certainly least that I moved to the 'nutellamisu" and while certainly not the prettiest presentation nothing could have prepared me for the taste - an acrid, sour, and questionably spoiled cream cheese 'pudding' debauchery of the Italian classic that tasted nothing of Nutella or Tiramisu, a second bite of the $3.95 cup yielding similar results and landing it plus the remaining pastries in the trash as I left the store thankful I'd not yet finished my coffee so as to cleanse my palate.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutellamisu - looks horrible, tastes worse.  Who, in 2014, uses cream cheese to make tiramisu?
