R4hCvVZhtSD-_GL3DLW3pg.text: First time at Madhouse Coffee. Kayla took my order through the drive through and gave me a few suggestions. I chose triple chocolate blended and it was delicious!!!!

pJhL55SOlpNOkbj9I6BXoQ.text: my favorite coffee haunt in vegas. this place is amazing. all of the artwork is outstanding. the blacklight in the bathroom and all the writings on the wall. the food is gourmet af. tasty coffee and tea. wonderful smoothies. they even have hookah. chill out at madhouse today!!!! :P

vygMWKlua47oyPh5esykwQ.text: Been here two times and feel a bad vibe from the redhead guy Not good customer service :(

kiGVEmouqR5gCLs7Nmi_kg.text: I LOVE IT HERE!! The employees are super chill and I loved the vibe. Definitely will be a regular from now on!

XI940ytyiPoqEW_TJPSg6g.text: Out of all the the coffee places I have been to, I love the atmosphere of Madhouse the most. They have great customer service and their employees are all very nice and lively. This place is also 24hours, so it's great for college students and night owls. At this coffee shop, the owner comes around often and he is super nice as well. With the music, it suits the coffee shop since it is upbeat and helps with productivity (to me). Overall, I enjoy the energy of Madhouse and it will possibly remain my favorite coffee shop in Vegas.

7po4yXdLlyWnjQZSqejVxA.text: I love this place! It's unique, and their coffee is always delicious hot or cold.  Staff is always friendly and ready to serve.  I will go out of my way just to grab a coffee from them.  They serve fresh in house made pastries and food, with a wide verity on the menu.  Worth the visit!

0fBjGSBiKM8L_5CseapOzw.text: I love this place and its right down the street from my house. I actually prefer them over Starbucks. My only complaint is they always forget to add cream cheese to my breakfast croissant. Other than that. I'm a happy camper

Zy9EUhcDjmX7YxrY1LOmoA.text: Love the coffee! Would be a daily drive thru stop if they didn't shove you the iPad to ONLY put your tip amount in.   Let me tip how/when I want!  Change your method and I'm in!

gTcl0qZCi8QoJ0bhxd8tJg.text: The staff and the drinks at Madhouse are great! It's always a fun environment, and I love the fact that it's so dog friendly. The only problem I have is that the music is always really loud, and the playlist is a bit repetitive. When I asked if the music could be turned down so I could hear my friends better, the employee told me they were unable to do that. Regardless, this still remains one of my favorite late night spots!   On a side note, I also think that Madhouse would benefit from showcasing local artists and photographers of different styles! I know a lot of people who would be excited to participate.

AVRFUsdk8miq_6NLm_ZW6g.text: Friendly staff, tasty banana nut muffin.  Decent coffee, not strong enough for my taste.  No mugs for coffee consumed 'for here'. Paper cups only.  Minus one star for bumping obnoxious edm at 10:30am...  pretty loudly to boot.  Had to wrap up my work and get out of there.

wi2HUTbdIQwMlMYCMMFH0w.text: I'm very surprised at the very slow service. We ordered very easy sandwiches. Yet we waited for over 30 minuets to get our food. This place wasn't busy. Their was only one couple ahead of us. My wife and I will not be returning to this place any time soon if at all.

ZCI1U4EbXcXfws9B7KRFMQ.text: Not a good day today at Madhouse coffee. Not sure if or when I will be back. I have been coming here for the last several years. The sandwiches are getting very skimpy and after asking for a bit more ice tea in a cup the was filled with ice to the top- I was told I would be charged for a refill. This after waiting almost 4 minutes for the cup to be filled. Not sure why they couldn't say that at first instead of leaving me standing there waiting?!? Not sure what is happening with the establishment.

z24cmeXV0THgXocNMWAFuQ.text: Love Love LOVE this coffee spot! I'm pretty much a coffee diva and this place went above and beyond my expectations! Any kind of culinary coffee creation one could want, tasty creative menu options and baked goods, hand-crafted chocolates made by the owner...the best part? I can go at any time of the day or night!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This Vegas newbies fave coffee joint! The coffee is brewed to perfection, the food is delicious and specialty chocolates to die for

S5MxYRxKLVO5d6MN-ilmKA.text: Lots of new things to try here. We played it safe and had the BLT. Our sandwiches were yummy! The place is small but very busy. Nice comfortable atmosphere. People sitting at the counter and on laptops. A friend recommended this place to us. We really enjoyed it. Next time we will try the coffee too.

ohWakX1Bsl01LM4JV9OnPQ.text: Amazing place! Mark was a great barista, he was very knowledgeable when it came to gluten free options for my wife. Will be back again!

PiHU_WExsJUySsJCJo-fWw.text: For a city that never sleeps, there really aren't that many coffee shops open 24/7 in Las Vegas. At least there is Madhouse. At this point, the Monkey Mocha iced coffee I ordered is already halfway gone. 10/10 would recommend if you're into peanut butter coffee drinks that taste like dessert. I usually get a Mad Cow latte which is hazelnut based (can you say nutella in and around your mouth?) The atmosphere is great and I usually come here to study. One time, my friend came in with a starbucks cup, and one of the employees told her to throw it away. Down with coffee chains!

NhglBakxgll2uoh0506PjA.text: Had the Mad Max and the Threesome. They were both OK quality, not bad, not great, just... fine. They were definitely overpriced though. The menu in their drive thru doesn't any prices on it (neither does the menu on their website), so I was shocked when the server told me the total. Overall, I felt like I would have been better off just going to Starbucks.

DgJU2iZbYr6doKAivGNb8A.text: Super chill and eclectic hangout.  Great iced toddy coffee. If you dont know what that is, google it. Its a cold brew system...so good. Next time I will definitely try some food. Vegan options, baked treats and some interesting sandwiches. They are open 24 hours and pet friendly too. I will for sure be back!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very cool coffee spot!

wJWvk2IBRZ532GksONpmiA.text: This place is a chill spot to hang. A bit on the pricey side. I ordered an iced red velvet mocha thing and was over $6. Watching some of the food getting prepared, not impressed with their techniques. I did work at Starbucks for years, so I have high standards for how things should be done in a coffee shop. It's a very cool, edgy environment to get some work done in or hang with friends, but I won't come here much because of how pricey their drinks are, and because I can only handle so much anti Trump/anti establishment decorations.

3Ji8Ww99rJAw1Ux21qXA_Q.text: First off, I couldn't have been more excited to find the much-raved about (vegan) "Impossible Burger", since when Impossible Foods first rolled it out, it was only available at very high-end restaurants in SF, LA, NYC... Madhouse owner Marco's take on it is absolutely exquisite--the burger buns tasted lightly pan-grilled to perfection creating a slight crunch on the inner side yet smooth, soft and warm on the outer sandwiching the mouth-watering vegan patty (the flavor and texture of which is impossible to discern from the finest beef burger) superbly cooked and topped with arugula (et al) and uniquely served with delicious yucca fries. All for the unbeatable price of $13.99. It is definitely worth every morsel, but add to that, Madhouse serves Intelligentsia coffee! Who knew!? What a pairing. Anyone with a discriminating taste for coffee/espresso knows that nearly all others don't come close. It's like I was back at Venice Beach on Abbott Kinney ordering my favorite cappuccino from the (always crowded) Intelligentsia cafe. I must say that Marco and his wife Kimberly (both vegans so they know...) were incredibly hospitable, went out of their way to be engaging with customers as well as with their employees as they helped right along side them behind the counter. I loved the creative, thought-provoking liberal art and energy that is Madhouse Coffee. It brought me back to the places I used to frequent in Greenwich Village, SoHo, Venice Beach, Silverlake, Hollywood, etc. Overall, I highly recommend this place; hands down, there's no place quite like it in all of Las Vegas.

r8oPH5xu02IVtKF_hdGhbA.text: Honestly, I didn't see the appeal for this one. Sure it's open late, but it's Vegas... Strip mall location not convenient to most of town. The coffee was just okay but carried a hefty price tag. Baked goods, similar story. And despite spending almost $14 for a simple snack, they limit your internet usage. I'll pass

3QT350FNJtnP2_gHTu5jcA.text: Their hot cocoa is good. Their green tea latte is even better and they have a nutella smoothie it is delicious! The artwork on the walls is local and it's always very interesting. I had a cookie there, it was kind of dry and stale or else I would have given it a 5 star. The prices aren't bad and they are always open. Great for the late work shifts and late night conversations.

i156K0SkZYdJKxiaT15pmA.text: I went here a lot when i was in college but I am busy to work so i rarely visit this place  I love heres atmosphere and i found out they changes insides interior slightly to get more people in. everything i like  However i went thete use wifi because i could not use wifi at home 3am in the morning. Usually when i go there i could use 3 hour wifi pass for complementary but tonight i have to ask wifi password to get it and once a hour i have to buy something to get the password... So since i have to buy $4 for each hour to use internet..   I dont think i will go this place again for the wifi. .. it us better to go starbucks..

FRhQyoiuBLGw03mvs8-a5w.text: I went there on a Thursday and got a 24oz ice chai tea with soy. There was only one person in front of me in the drive thru and it was fast. It cost $6.76! I can see an additional charge for the soy, but soy prices are comparable to dairy prices. It's 2016 people. The barista was pleasant though.  In addition, I used to come here to study randomly since it is open 24/7. It was busy and hard to find a spot at night but I was still able to focus.

5I-uJzlweVKJmn6_DKJCQg.text: I've been on a coffee "kick" lately and decided to try this place out based on the positive reviews. I had the Nutella white chocolate mocha, and it was incredible! Not too sweet and not too strong, but definitely strong enough to give you a boost of energy. There is a nice outdoor patio too, so I can see myself coming back when the weather is nice to just enjoy a drink and chill. Will be back for sure ..

kTjgErjOO9SYE_3eY0Lh5w.text: I'm so happy they are 24 hours since I just recently started working overnight. Thanks to postmates I don't even have to leave the office but I wish I could just to go meet the great people of Madhouse! So far I have tried the Looney Tuna sandwich and the Grilled Cheesus...both are super delicious! And the wild berry smoothie is everything.

wK11TXPrVJDiW5QOoSZ4Vg.text: Call me a coffee and macaron snob, but both were just awful. I couldn't bring myself to finish my purchases.

DVCTWDGZaeVrlUOVJFAtTw.text: Mad House is one of my favorite coffee shops, especially since I'm a night owl and they're open 24 hours.  It's a definite plus that they have a drive thru.  They also have a really fantastic crew, they are super friendly, and Andrew sure knows how to make you feel at home.  The coffee here is very tasty, and potent. It will give you a dose of energy for sure. I recommend the white chocolate nutella latte, and if you're into green tea, the maccha grean tea latte is to die for.   Of their sandwiches, I really enjoy the pasquale, on focaccia with extra pesto. It comes with three different meats, and they fuse together perfectly.  The vibe is also  pretty neat, they have contemporary artwork all over their walls, a killer mural, and they also have hookah available if you're into that sort of thing.

S81K87xosbbKaN_W4IF0pw.text: I love this place! It's within walking distance from my house so I come here whenever I'm off on weekends. The service is always great with a very friendly staff. I always get the tiramisu to go with my coffee. It's made in house and is sooo good. I always recommend this place to everyone that lives near me.

Qql_JFdk0OI6d-8fhPa_dg.text: Awesome! Awesome! Awesome! Great service, cool chill place, delicious food and coffee! Place was recently remodeled and looks amazing! All the staff is so caring and so friendly, I even know some of them pretty well now, like Andrew, Naweed, and Marina, since they have taken the extra time to get to know me!! I can't wait to go back! :)

My only concern is when I went to the restroom, I was reminded of the red velvet I had consumed earlier. I was a bit concerned. It was the only thing I had all day at the point. I couldn't believe how good it was. I also ordered a Gobbler sandwhich (turkey, cranberry sauce, and all the fixings) and it was like having Thanksgiving all over again in one compact sandwhich. The guy seemed very interested in helping us out with our order and even gave us a menu to look at as the menu you view when you drive through the "drive thru" is VERY tall and you CANNOT see it unless you stick your head out the window. Definately a design flaw!!!!

Z-FmwPPUzIdM1VVduy4Cuw.text: Madhouse coffee is the local coffee shop I've been looking for all my life! My fave is the blended caramel mocha, way better than any other coffee places! Prices are reasonable and employees are great! I love the wannabe sandwich on focaccia. I never liked pesto but this one is the only pesto I would ever eat! The owner, Marco, is a great guy, he cares about his customers and he takes care of any concerns one might have. Andrea is my fave barista- thanks to her natural sincerity and jolliness! Every morning before work, this is where I'd be found. And on my days off, my system still asks for some madhouse! I'm so madly in love with this place. No one will understand my obsession...

The atmosphere is cool; young crowd, friendly employees, multiple offerings from beverages, snacks, bakery, to hookah, and on top of this it's open 24 hours! What more to ask for?! However, I have had a consistent issue with their mocha coffee; it is lukewarm, which is a criminal offense in the coffee world that should be prosecutable! I started ordering my coffee very hot, than extra hot, same problem!! Can I get a hot coffee? I will change my rating to a 5 star if you impress me with a hot coffee... if you cared.

nA5HZ3vSiuzeiC1At7nbpw.text: 24/7 coffee shop, doesn't get any better than that if you're a college student or just want coffee whenever. This place can get packed the later it gets so good luck finding a spot! Their menu has everything from food, drinks & hookah :)  There are outlets throughout the store and different seatings from the bar, tables and outdoor tables. Make sure to sign up for their rewards program if you plan on visiting often or making this place the go-to study spot.  Love all the stickers they have throughout the store and their bathrooms are black lights lit.  Came in with a friend and didn't even have to order anything since they gave me their previous mistake order. It ended up being the red velvet mocha blended. She ended up ordering the same thing but iced (the iced version looked questionable since it was really red, but so much better)  If you plan on renting hookah, they pack everything and give you disposable tips. (They'll mix AS many flavors as you want, so go ahead treat yo self! I tried the lemon, mint & guava....so good )

vCmmWtgL--y0Ifi0Fy3Olw.text: I have been coming to the MadHouse for late night coffee and to hang out with friends since 2013. The cafe has its own unique environment, that has grown and changed in the last few years, but definitely for the better. The staff is friendly and fun, and seem legitimately happy to be doing what they're doing. The food is like no other! Their breads are out of this world great, and the pastries are to die for as well.  They also have hookah services so that has always been a fun little twist. Amazing coffeehouse. Definitely my go-to.

rJzFXGaqSRcaiGWMCcfveA.text: I have been here before and we used to come here often to have coffee, a sandwich and play dominoes. HWR4L1Q-20JKu_obZPjQ0Q.text: I went here to read my book and quickly realized this wouldn't be the right place to do so. I ordered my croissant and drink and sat and waited ten minutes with the music pounding until I finally received my order. I asked if the music was always so loud and the girl just said "yeah our owner has control on his phone and sometimes he puts it really loud then lowers it when he feels like it". Huh?? Wtf kind of response is that. I'm chugging my coffee in hopes to get out of here quickly.

YTU9M7rst6XdQ4ZsZGturQ.text: They got my Uber eats order mixed up and sent me someone else's order.  I called and said I'd drive to their shop so that I could get and eat our food (were already an hour from original request).  I get there and they say that one of the sandwiches I ordered they ran out of.  I say fine we'll have an additional breakfast sandwich.  She asks "you had the sausage right" I say no we ordered the bacon sandwich.  She says ok.  I wait 10 minutes and when she has my bag of food and coffee out she says "sorry for the delay but we gave you an extra sausage breakfast sandwich".  No, you mean you couldn't read a ticket and made a sausage breakfast sandwich and passed on the sandwich to me under the guise of doing a good deed rather than just screwed up.    We like trying new places to eat and the food delivery model isn't anything new so I figure this experience is due to sloppiness on the coffeehouses part.  They did have good coffee though.

4DeLwwr5Zd7ve1M1j4dPVg.text: This place had chocolates in the shape of a penis and wifi said "fuck trump"  Completely inappropriate and grossly unprofessional.  Avoid this coffee shop.

9a4h_WLbH4E3Tz9Lcr2YOQ.text: I've been going to Madhouse on the regular for a couple years, and it's the kind of place where you run into friends you haven't seen for a while or make new ones. I've had several things on the menu, and my faves are Monkey Mocha, the new Avocado toast, chia seed pudding (try it- so good!), vegan bowl (the chick peas are my fav), and I've tried most of the sandwiches and honestly I have a hard time choosing every time. Full disclosure: I'm now friends with the owner, Marco, and he develops his own recipes and seeks out special ingredients like the Calabrian pepper stuff on the avocado toast-- it has a unique flavor you won't find everywhere. He caters to his clientele (who usually want sweet drinks), but he knows his coffee, so ask some questions and you'll get what you're looking for. The quality of the coffee is very important to him, and I'm a person who usually uses sweetener in the crappy coffee I have at home, but prefer to go without when I get it at Madhouse, because it's less bitter than mine and doesn't really need it. Italian hot chocolate = amazing. I lived in Italy and used to bring back packets of it from the grocery store in my luggage. No joke. What you get at Madhouse is a higher quality version of that, and my ITALIAN friends order it on the regular. Best part: it's open late! So when everything else on the west side is closed, Madhouse is open for meeting with friends or the "after party". Plus it will totally impress that first date (as long as they're not your grandma. But maybe even your grandma, if she's cool. LOL).

r5nJYsb1dy0nYwB4-RUTwg.text: Best thing about this place is being open 24 hours! When it's late and I'm craving a breakfast croissant sandwich, I can always order from Madhouse through Postmates. They make their croissants from scratch (the only way it should be done) and they are crispy, flaky, buttery, and delicious.   The breakfast croissant comes with egg and cheddar cheese and while it's delicious, the cheese and butter combined makes it pretty heavy. Would prefer an egg croissant with vegetables instead. But I guess if it's late (and maybe I'm a lil tipsy), an egg and cheddar croissant will suffice!

bZvksUN-GC6ff7hXGbDgjQ.text: Great low key spot to have a coffee and get work done. I sat outside because it wad nice out and the barista brought my coffee out to me when it was ready. A nice touch, and the coffee tasted great. Music in the background added to a nice ambiance and free WiFi with my purchase was the reason I came in the first place.

qUI_p3kFr91gRK24MYyDIg.text: Omg. I'm-- ok so Madhouse Coffee is my go to coffee shop!!! I have been looking for a regular coffee shop that I always visit and I have finally found it! I always always always get the iced Mad Cow w/ almond milk and it is SO GOOD ! The decor is so hipster (and wait until you check out the bathroom ;)). I have ordered many sandwiches, and my only complaint is that the baguette is very tough, so I recommend getting the focaccia. I have come here many times to do homework and I am able to get a lot done.   My only downside here is that the space is small compared to others, so it fills up quick. I sometimes find it hard to find a seat but it is all worth it in the end. It can also get a bit hot from time to time, so don't dress too heavy because you will sweat lol.  PS: GET A CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIE WHEN YOU COME OMG THEYRE SO GOOD

esJSGnTePTwa_EitSEqJUg.text: They have Oat Milk! Its my favorite non-dairy creamer. So creamy. This coffee shop is open 24/7. So definitely a place to go for some late night studying. 3LtgVAPRpRfBsxUXvT5Bhg.text: The service here is really good they pay attention to details. There are several people working here. Lot's of Instagram worthy phot-ops if that's your sort of thing. There is a lot of shock value within the confines of this space so be prepared. The food and drinks are both high quality. This coffee shop is 24 hours and has a drive through. My only qualm is that the wifi is only accessible with a code for 2 hours and they keep printing out new codes. To me this doesn't seem cost effective nor healthy for the environment. Also if the shop is open 24 hours people will be inclined to stay longer and would need to use the internet for longer than 2 hours. Maybe they have this system in effect to reduce the amount of people in the shop? I am not sure. The bathroom is one for the books!

ubH29mxSOqRqKOIhaxYb2g.text: Disappointed. Everyone that worked here had an attitude. I got the matcha latte and it was super sweet even tho I specifically asked what was in it. The vegan sandwich was dry and bland.

Not so crowded inside, occasional smokers outside injecting unpleasant smell to inside through the open door. The place where your creativity doubles.

5Z6FulhFDA-9L54WVpS3tw.text: Fun place I love it. Great coffee, I prefer hot tea. Open 24 hours and close to home make it perfect

dgGbiGG0RISja2eE8oM5Pw.text: One of my favorite coffee shops in Vegas. My top 3 drinks are: Coconut iced latte, The Mad Cow Latte (hot) add shot and soy milk & the Matcha green tea latte (hot or iced). You'll thank me later!

yEMiQdLC8MLzjiM1M_w-tg.text: My favorite go to place to chill and study. I love the vibe of the place especially after they did the renovations.   Better coffee than Starbucks. A little pricey but it's worth the little extra money you pay for. Foodwise, I absolutely love their pesto salad. The switch to gnocchi was okay but I miss the potatoes. Bring back the potatoes!   Great customer service as well. I always come graveyards so I don't know how it works on other shifts but Andrew is the absolute best! He makes you feel at home and he's very approachable.

sZDIjJc-VuOx76lVecWdXA.text: The highlight of this joint is the atmosphere, too bad the rest of our experience didn't live up to the aesthetic.  We ordered two servings of the gnocchi pesto, one with pine nuts and one without due to an allergy. The dishes arrived seemingly as ordered, we both dig in only to find pine nuts hidden in the dish. Luckily, I didn't need my epi-pen (those things are expensive). I return the dish explaining that I need it without nuts and the manager/owner/guy in charge informs me that the pesto also has walnuts.  It would have been nice to know upon my initial order that the dish had nuts regardless of the pine nut situation.  So, instead I order the prosciutto salad. I wait, drinking my coffee before the waitress brings me my meal. She plops down a caprese salad instead of prosciutto. I was pretty hungry by this point so I just shut up and ate it. You know what? It wasn't bad - just not what I ordered... for the second time.  The coffee was okay. Ordered a pour over that was a bit thin. My dining partner ordered a coffee drink that the staff forgot about and didn't arrive until midway through her meal after I received my make-up dish.   Let this be a lesson to those who would toss a few bucks into the tip jar BEFORE service. Now that I think about it, the caprese salad probably cost less than my initial order. Damn, more money down the drain.

LBQE7sqY0rgzA50JPkdLxw.text: My go-to place for my morning breakfast. Never disappointed!!! I recommend their egg and cheddar croissant sandwich. It's fresh, made to order and it can be piping hot. Also, all of their flavored ice coffees are amazing!!! I always fall back to the Irish cream latte :)

wGLLsLHQLQLRuYOyvRmGaw.text: My absolute favorite coffee house in Vegas!!! They have hemp milk!!!! Try the iced lavender hemp latte!!! To die for

i-IXrR8edFUcA18lTL4IsA.text: I was going to be in the area and scoped out places for coffee. Through Yelp, I found this place. The photos looked cool, the menu items were intriguing and they also served food. Great! It's a nice place inside and they were friendly.  They said "Sit anywhere and we'll bring you your food." I chose to sit outside. Bad move apparently. When the girl brought my breakfast croissant, half of it slipped off the plate onto the metal table. All she did was say "Sorry about that." and walked inside. There was no offer to make another or even a "Would you like another half made?" Nothing.  The sandwich itself was not the best either. It was bacon, egg and cheese. The egg was still a little drippy and not cooked fully. The bacon was limp. While I personally don't like crispy bacon, I know I'm still cooking it properly. I have no idea whether all of this was undercooked or not, but my stomach became upset after eating most of it. The green matcha iced latte was tasty, but incredibly heavy on the dairy. Did they use milk or full cream? It took a few hours for my stomach to settle down.  The ambiance and location is nice but I won't be coming back.

lIxRQ-qvXs1uCMmOppmWNg.text: This place features Izaac Zevalking's (aka Recycled Propaganda) work everywhere... which alone, is enough for me to give an establishment 5 stars. It's like a baller art gallery... WITH COFFEE!! Respect. In addition, the cafe also serves **real** food, and it's all made in-house from scratch - also the conception of the owner. Respect again.  The coffee itself isn't organic... and there isn't really a coffee selection per se... (ask the guys behind the counter where the beans are from and you get blank stares)... but pretentiousness nor high-class isn't what this place is about. It's about creating a safe haven for the eclectic, the quirky, and the unique: GLBT? We love you. Hillary? Trump? Fuck 'em all? Discuss freely. Mohawk and rainbow-colored hair? Enjoy respite here.  Me? Madhouse had me at Recycled Propaganda... it's just that because I personally am a pretentious fucker when it comes to my tea and coffee that I'm taking one star off.

6EVxMaTU1u0RE_KEPpV_6g.text: The worst coffee ever. The young lady who works there  cannot make coffee. I swear she did not put a drop of coffee into my caramel latte. I order this drink all the time. She's the 1 person there who cannot make coffee. Will never go there again. She should be fired.

8-3AuIFbd6szlk1XxNZbWQ.text: Update: 4/23/2013 Stopped by here again in an attempt to try out a different espresso drink. This time I asked for the cafe latte and the Innocent Bystander sandwich turned into a salad. The coffee is still too bitter for my taste but the salad was good!   ----------------------------------------------------------------- Someone was talking about this place so I decided to stop by here on the way home today for a hot caramel macchiato. I'm sad to say I'm a little disappointed at this drink. It was dull, bitter and reminded me a lot of Starbuck's caramel macchiato. I've gotten used to the real caramel flavor that Sunrise and even Sambalatte uses and that's what I like to taste in a caramel macchiato. You know when you heat up sugar and water on the stove and it boils down into this golden color with a slightly smokey caramel flavor? That's the real caramel flavor one should taste in a caramel macchiato, in which this drink lacks.   I'm moving to this side of town in a few weeks and Sunrise will be too far for me to frequent. It's unfortunate that I don't like Madhouse's Coffee shop for the only coffee drink that I really like.

D94l2RpbF3G2Dc7SyDMFtg.text: well it states 24 coffee house, there were really no pastries. Very disappointed in my first visit. i reviewed their menu before going, but they only had 1 type of muffin, literally 1 cookie left & tiramisu. So then my husband orders a sandwich, we were told they don't have the meat for it. then the worker started to explain there is a couple things on menu they no longer due or that are going to change. I just ended up getting my coffee & leaving. The place is very trendy but not at all what is displayed on website when it comes to food/pastries. i understand if i came midday, it was barely 9:30a. Even their tv with images of their menu was wrong, they don't have turn around to be considered 24hr service unless all you want is a coffee. this is a saturday morning, should have stock.

dC70XZVBJAlWk7kgsV8Ygg.text: My favourite coffee house. :)  I do like they are open 24/7 and I prefer their coffee over Starbucks,  which is much over rated.

47rayLIHqSbh8X0evqrodQ.text: There's something off about a place if they try to charge you twice the price for a drink if you want it iced instead of hot - especially if it's a simple chai latte. In the end, I settled for a regular iced latte and it tasted like 95% milk and 5% coffee. Not so good.  I bought a two drinks, which amounted to 1 hour of wifi (why isn't wifi free in the first place?) and the cashier insisted that I could only get the 30 minute wifi code. What even.  I only tried this place out because so many people told me it was amazing. I really don't see it. The only thing I like is that it's open 24/7 and has a nice vibe to it. However, the whole drink ordeal and the customer service put me off - the employees only really talked to the people they already knew and the cashier was the opposite of friendly. I really wanted to like this place but I just can't. Maybe if I were a smoker I would appreciate the expansive outdoor patio more, but I couldn't even take advantage of that feature.  Bumping this up to two stars because my friend got tea that tasted decent. If I ever go back, I'd probably stick to the tea.

r3Yo_UV3Sjf2CKYH9kQI0Q.text: After a long few weeks of not having any form of liquids except water - I finally got elsewise!  Ordered the Matcha Green Tea drink, it was about 6$ for a small - which was the size of a regular Starbucks cup size.  Whipped cream was optional, which I added - and made the whole drink so much more delicious!  The matcha green tea tasted EXACTLY what a liquified form of green tea kit kats would. I was taken aback at first, but got used to it.  Not too sweet, not too bitter - but excellent.  Although waiting to place an order and for the drink to be made took quite awhile!  But then again, there was a lone one-man-worker.

t4aQ1TRYkXtYfsqVCPfkzw.text: Still my favorite place to hold weekly meet ups with the besties! The monkey mocha is best, with the mad cow as a great runner up.

Cjj1dredkvK3IjgGH2UKFg.text: I love madhouse! It's my go-to place and I go here basically everyday! Andrew is my favorite worker here I love him to death! He's super friendly and makes me feel comfortable (and also makes my orders perfectly) highly recommend going here!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you ever wanna know what Andrew looks like and when he works

GwMY_4S0dEck95H4Bb5Q-Q.text: This place is AMAZING! I come here on a regular bases at least once or more a week. Their Drinks are amazing and the food is just as good. My friend and I come in with are laptops to write we will stay for hours. The owner is a nice guys hes always friendly and says hello to almost everyone and he knows his coffee. This place is great i will continue to come here and I will continue to bring an one who wants to try a real coffee.

IexGvUqyJGSRf9T4aSZw5g.text: Probably the best and coolest coffee place in town. Great coffee, sandwiches and desserts. The sandwiches especially Are a really good deal as the buns are real not fake ciabatta. All the desserts are made in house..  The croissants are also good  It's a good hangout for anybody on the west side  any afternoon or night.

MUdqTNtttGqlK6wYlcRaAQ.text: Andrew is so awesome! Great customer service! I love how he actually tries to get to know his customers! Definitely part of the reason why I keep coming back!

qxCCPlvNiAy7p-A5GXo6mQ.text: Love this place, its too bad I don't live in Vegas anymore. When I am in town, I'll have to make a stop here. I ordered the Matcha Green Tea smoothie, it is definitely pricey, at $6.95 for the medium size I believe...? But I expected as much since it is Matcha powder which is expensive in any grocery store. I would have to say this drink rivals Urth Cafe's Green Tea Boba blended drink, and may even surpass it.

viVZMCZmJC3awlRcbc1bjg.text: This place is awesome. Yet, I do have 2 complaints. 1. The owner is kind of rude. 2. I know theu are not a hookah lounge, which is why this fomplaint was not calculated into my rating, but their hookahs are not very good. Other than that, the coffee and the food are amazing. If the owner could be nice, they would get a 5.

Nr9ssIbm8z8CYakkTzI40Q.text: Great coffee, great food. Been here about five times now, service is always great. Very consistent. Good local vibe, no chain cafe horsepuckery here. And they are vape-friendly.

Uuud5NoVTimQYk_od2RPTg.text: Great place for hanging out and recollecting with friends. Friendly staff. And the coffee itself, not bad at all. They definitely have variety and different selections than you'd find at Starbucks or Coffee bean. I LOVE that it's open 24 hours as well. My respects to the staff for maintaining an awesome attitude even at those hours. Definitely add this to your list of places to check out!!

F63nDBXms4JEKHw5zEoK-g.text: Went to Madhouse to grab some coffee and make use of their wifi. Wifi was super slow and barely functioning! I had one of those peanut butter shake things and it was delicious but I drank a whole small one and it gave me a tummy ache. It was worth it though. My husband had a white mocha which he enjoyed. Cute hipster atmosphere, just wish the wifi was better! 24 hrs is a plus.

lQVOWgxNfPOC38h0D3SbKQ.text: Horrible Customer Service. Ordered at the drive thru a 32oz blended non coffee frap and asked them to put it into  to 2 16oz cups for me and my daughter. The guy who took the order had no problem with that. After waiting for at least 5 min someone came to the window and asked me what I wanted to order. What? I asked them joking you forgot my order? Guess the guy didn't find funny and just looked annoyed. I then told him my order and asked if he can put it into 2 cups. He then said he would have to charge me for 2 16oz drinks? I then asked if i get the 32oz and an extra cup. He said he would have to charge me for the extra drink since  I'm using a cup... Lol you got to be kidding me. I then said I'll pass,  he just closed his window. I just went to coffee bean down the street which I always go to and they have are always great. Would not go here which I'm sure won't hurt there bottom line but just felt I should share.

k41BgAaUcDQc54SaZKHgng.text: It's A Grind is a chain of very cool coffee shops in the western US. However, this location is my absolute favorite one. The owner (never got his name) is a really nice guy. The service is always amazing. You'll never walk into a Starbucks and they'll ask if you want your pastry warmed or they'll never off to bring you drink out to where you're sitting when it's ready.   The art is funky, there is free Wi-Fi, and if you sit on their tiny patio there is even a bit of a Strip view.  Their mango ice tea is my favorite. There are little things that make this place different such as using crushed ice instead of cubed ice, and the fact you can get your ice drink (whatever it is) in a 32 OUNCE size! It's overload but who cares?  Also, this is an extremely dog-friendly coffee shop. Not sure if you can bring them inside, but you can definately have them on the patio. Whether at the counter or the drive-thru, the staff will provide a doggie treat. They can even provide a water bowl. Not to mention it's across the street from the biggest and probably most popular dog park in all of Vegas.  DId I mention they have a drive-thru?

KaERZN49Od2-GQ6cYgciMQ.text: Gave this place another try after having a bad first experience. Went there again because of a Groupon. Went around 7:00 PM instead of in the middle of the night. The food is good. My wife and daughter shared a "looney tuna" on ciabatta bread and I had a "cowbell" on a wrap. We also had a ying yang looking cookie that was really tasty. Nice cafe type of place with a homey feeling. I would go here again.

n1X5cIOmYqLB9Pbv-w-Zcw.text: LOVE that it's open 24/7 AND there's a drive thru. The sandwiches are really good, better than going to a fast food joint. I just wish there was more seating inside, because it's often full in there, & seating is limited.

hSqhGXRRboIXHOVGo6pBRg.text: Great hot chocolate, too & no complaint if you hang out for 2 hours like we did one late nite as did some other group....  The iced huge 32oz drinks are fab when it's hot.

GbItXAnkFC241lxsFUkj8w.text: I have never been to the location on D.I. but there is one right down Eastern from our house & we LOVE it! The staff are very friendly & accommodating. Their large is the same size as the "other coffee shop's" medium and for the same price! Located right on the corner of Pebble & Eastern with the most delicious, melt in your mouth croissants I have ever had! I never even liked croissants before Madhouse. The coffee is way good too & their muffins are HUGE!

Q_HdezyAcA_zzNgZ5Ka6Vg.text: They are always updating their menu with new, fun stuff and are accommodating to people with dietary restrictions. The menu is delicious. Wonderful place to come with friends and just chill, especially late afternoon and early evening before it gets too busy. It's sometimes packed at 2am! Atmosphere is really relaxing. You sometimes wait a long time for orders, and orders are not correct, but this does not happen frequently, so it's definitely worth over-looking and coming anyway!

3MCtNneycjmjVUGUc6Wmng.text: A friend introduced me to Madhouse Coffee in February and I love it. Great vibe, comfortable seating and very good coffee. I'm all about coffee in a ceramic mug and while I'm usually a purist sometimes I like to mix it up and add a bit of flavored coffee in with my bold black coffee.  While I admit I also frequent chains that are walking or running distance from my home, the independent Madhouse - located on Desert Inn and Durango in  Vons shopping center - certainly wins rave reviews from me as a spot to meet up with a friend, colleague or client.  I believe this was formerly an It's  A Grind? While I didn't indulge - the pastries looked fabulous.

FymmRob8a6SYRXZ3RXu0uQ.text: i love it's a grind's white mocha and chai tea latte's. sweet and strong the way i like it. very gourmetesque. the 24 hour joint is so convenient. the trade-off though, is it's one of the only coffee houses in the area running 24, so everyone and their great grandmas are here. it's so hard to get a seat. even patio seating is large enough to get packed- but for the smokers.   this one time, a group of us, about 8 of us wanted to come here for the reason it's open late,  there was no available seating. so we definately bought our drinks but ended up just parking our friend's tacoma near as possible and had our meeting in his truck bed. awkward huh. it's cool though that they offer free wifi.

o2nHvcIlfLtZobAuZ4fd4Q.text: I love how down to earth they are!! The monkey mocha is to die for! Perfect combination of chocolate, peanut butter, bananas and coffee!!

PKCAUZFRQx9dm8Lyg_dv_Q.text: Great coffee. Great food. Great prices. Cozy hang out. Lots of vegetarian options too!

iwbgpBoTwZH9YDnDCpCT0Q.text: Okay, so the menu is still exactly the same as It's A Grind. There's still free Wi-Fi. It's still open 24 hours.  The interior decor is different, but it's actually better than the original incarnation. I loved the cartoon designs on the tables and the Pulp Fiction mural in the bathroom.  Whew! What a relief.

uBOHpttPqs1-5rJsnX31fg.text: I love this place, from food to coffee and to everything else's! Its very chill, laid back and most of all they are DOG FRIENDLY, its close to the park that after we did our walks and jogs, my dog and i have a spot to hang out and rest. They gave him delightful treats and water while am enjoying my green iced tea and pesto salad or my guilty pleasure the hot red velvet mocha and french macarons. The staffs were very friendly and courteous. They are open 24 hours, free WIFI and you can even order online... What else can you ask for, this is like as good as it gets, better check them out and you wont be dissapointed... :)

8BKCJaAvFFwIGUMGjax2Qw.text: favorite coffee shop in Vegas came with my cousin for some hot chocolate and by far that was the best I have ever tried.   perfect place to hang out  during AM hours since its a 24 hour place :D that was my favorite part of it

1N0f1a3Pf1cOmJUuYvUEtQ.text: 24/7 coffee + WiFi omg! I sometimes frequent other coffee houses like 24/7 Starbucks. I like that this Madhouse is small. I'm sort of an Agoraphobe so this location is becoming my favorite. The taste of Madhouse Coffee is quite good IMHO. I'll be studying for finals here for the next week or so.

JJksjLzNpxZozk4bqnJUkg.text: My drink was fine. My complaint is that before I went there I looked up the menu at their website, decided what I would have, then went there and ordered it. It turned out to be more expensive than the online pricing. I still have not received an answer of why this is so, but it makes them even more expensive than Sambalatte. Overpriced coffee drinks are no bargain, regardless of the atmosphere or neighborhood.

FBCNkF2mgVY5vXnr1xyDYQ.text: The staff here is very nice. I'm very peculiar about my strawberry drinks, and they were really patient with me when I asked them a bunch of questions about it. (The strawberry smoothie is pretty good. ) I've only come here a handful of times, but I have always received great service. The music is a bit on the loud side, I haven't found a go-to drink, but I would heartily recommend this place for a place to relax with friends or work on a few things.

s-7bw-3X55MMJ49nr4V45Q.text: Usually the coffee is great! Pink macaroons are huge and are the best!! Weird and scary looking to take my toddler. Very artistic inside and unique.

N8lYsnD_czJ6sngbIaAMLg.text: The coffee is pretty good depending on who is working. Not a place I'd recommend to hang out if you're looking to relax with friends.

Tdur6KkMRGEhRWYabL5GNg.text: So, a big 5 stars to the manager/owner!! I wrote2 star review where it turned out to be a misunderstanding on MY part.  Manager came over within 2 minutes of my posting (I was still in coffee shop) and he went well above necessary to address my concerns.  After our conversation, it was evident I misunderstood the situation, but Marco still remade my drink at no charge and even offered a great macaroon to go with it.  I can't complain in any way and for Marco's care, attention and patience - 10 stars!!!

NKs9RXiPtCyd-gs4y1UWkg.text: Drive thru guy with glasses and nose ring was friendly and smiley, I ordered and iced coffee with a shot and it was BOMB! First sip I said out loud "gaht damn" ! Not watered , day old hot coffee that they put in a fridge and sell as iced coffee...

qOh_CrSLRF5u34-kWJED7A.text: Cool little coffeeshop nestled in a typical "empty" mall layout in LV..reminds me of a place in Silver Lake..and they have Intelligentsia on drip. Stopped by to get a couple sandwiches..they got a bunch.  Kids are in town for WAG at Desert Aquatic..Go Cerritos Marlins!

qxeUXEBi1f33uZ_CKn-n-g.text: Space Invader, Banksey, scrumptious coffee and baked goods.  Relaxing and hip, Mad House (It's a Grind) Coffee is the perfect place to come relax and get some work done.  The Free Wifi is awesome (take note starbucks, you cheap monsters) and the coffee is brewed nice and strong.  Fear not lovers of frappe's and sweet drinks, they do those very well too.  Looking around the shop, its clear that the owner put his heart into this place.  I love when the personality of the owners shine through in a business, and the artwork on the wall demonstrates this well.  Work by the street artists Space Invader and Bansky adorn the walls, along with some Keith Herring designs.  Not to rain on the Las Vegas establishments sense of art, but it was really refreshing to be in a place where Georgia O'Keefe prints or neon beer signs were no where to be seen.  The pastries here are very tasty.  I sat down to a pumpkin tirmasu and an espresso recently.  The espresso was wonderfully bold and satisfying.  The pumpkin tiramisu was creamy, rich, and fun.  I wished I wasn't by myself, as the slice was huge and I couldn't finish it.    There is also a drive-thru and this place is 24 hours!  I forget the owner's name, but he was very nice.  He told me a lot of the artwork had special importance to him and his wife.  Things like this make a simple cup of espresso taste refreshingly fantastic.    They say the pasta in Italy is so much better because you're in Italy.  I found the coffee to follow suit here, since the atmosphere is so warm, welcoming, and wonderful.

HwD1QMCJBExZAEOTzKYF6g.text: Madhouse is a rare find in Vegas. They serve delicious coffee and espresso drinks and tasty, quality food. The staff is friendly, and the atmosphere is always lively yet relaxed inside. The place has individual flair, with local art and a genuine anti-establishment ethos. You can sit at the bar or on comfy cushions. Did I mention they're open 24/7?

xKHRhy9xjkbNAw9bsi_Wsg.text: 3 stars because the blended drinks here are SO freakin sweet prepare for a sugar headache and major crash after! WAY to sweet BUT the plain iced coffee is AMAZING! So good! So I stick with that. This place is pricier than Starbucks which is also a bummer, but if you are in the area give it a try!

ZXq86KtiDzvaEdtmQaUiXg.text: When I heard MadHouse Coffee was going to replace "It's a Grind" I didn't have any melancholy feelings, but some people I knew definitely did. Quoting a friend "OMGGGGG why did they change it! I want It's a Grind back, MadHouse is so stupid!". Alright... crazy girl. Aside from some minor aesthetics such as a new sign, a new paint job, some contemporary art, some new tables, a few more sandwiches, I wouldn't say much has changed. It's still the same owner (they wrote in big letters on the window), mostly the same menu, same store layout, still 24 hours, free wi-fi, and all the other IAG amenities.   I wouldn't consider their baked goods as gourmet as it says in the title, but.. some of them are tasty. Their coffee is not the greatest coffee ever, but it will get your coffee fixed satisfied.   I must admit though ever since they changed their name I do enjoy coming here more often because its less jam packed and I actually have a chance to sit down inside 2am in the morning.   Oh yeah drive thru service is relatively quick, out of the 6 or so times I've used it I haven't had to wait more than 3 minutes to get my order.

OdE1FkUC1LxxYO6KAHw9Gw.text: So excited to find a non-chain coffeehouse!  Very chill.  Relaxing atmosphere.  Cool art.  Good drink menu with room to experiment (hubby tried banana mocha and I tried peppermint white mocha)...yum!  We didn't get anything to eat, but the house tiramisu and muffins looked yummy and the sandwich list looked good, too.  Lots of vegetarian options for me! :)  Will definitely try to frequent now that I know it exists...and it's 24 hours...for my nights of insomnia!

TvpjVOpW-AB4p2zWUYZ9bQ.text: I've been coming here for a few months now and overall I like it. Pros: 1 - The drinks and the sandwiches are good! That's pretty darned important for a cafe and sadly many other cafes can't say that. 2 - There is usually seating 3 - OPEN 24 HOURS! Seriously, with Vegas's reputation as the all day, all night city I thought everything would be open 24 hours. Not even close! Thankful for this place at odd hours 4 - Staff is mostly friendly and usually get the order correct 5 - Outside seating is available. Nice when it's not a hundred and hell degrees. 6 - There's a park right across the street so with that and the mountains, they have a nice view  Cons: 1 - Despite what everyone says, Wi-fi in NOT free. You have to buy a minimum amount and then get a code for a set amount of hours. Come on guys! I get it, you want people to buy and not stay if they aren't spending, but it's not costing you anything to let people use the internet. This isn't 1998.  2 - It's expensive. A large iced white mocha is about $7. That's kind of ridiculous, and yet, I pay... 3 - The owner is always around. That's not bad, per se, but he has loud conversations, plays on his laptop with the sound up, that kind of stuff.  4 - Pastries aren't too yummy. They're okay, but that's as excited as I'm going to get about it.  So, if you have the money come on over! You can not go wrong with any of the "all time favorite" drinks...unless you're diabetic, then just say no.  *Friend recommends the Red Velvet Mocha *I recommend the entire Cold Drink menu, but specifically the Nutella White Mocha

gKEkxZIao57uGELgLJD76g.text: Cool art, and even better espresso drinks! The Mad Cow (Hazelnut latte) and Matcha green tea latte are delicious. Plenty of space to work, tons of natural light, free wifi, and a great upbeat soundtrack!

QgFjFkVk9FvAJRAclONHTg.text: I'm definitely not a connoisseur of coffee, but I love Madhouse! It's located conveniently on the way back and forth from work. It's 24 hour operations is really mad, even for this city. I love taking dates here to unwind right after a nice dinner. Marco the owner is super cordial to all his guests. It really feels like a family spot. Great job and keep up the good work MC!

5Wc0N7doc9j-nVEz_y7eUQ.text: I had the white chocolate peppermint mocha and a French macaron.  The coffee drink was perfectly executed and a tasty way to get my caffeine fix.  The macaron is made in house and is melt in your mouth perfection.  The owner is very friendly and the rest of the staff seemed competent.  My only complaint is that it is on the other side of town from where I live, thus it will be an once in awhile treat for me.

MQyu7H1KDGSQsWhfjo-vEQ.text: Before I begin, let me give y'all a quick breakdown of how I like to rate things - I don't throw out 4 and 5 stars for the sheer heck of it.  I mean c'mon now- 5 stars belong to well, FIVE star businesses who represent FIVE star standards.  I'm not going to rate establishments on Forbes or AAA ratings by any means (unless it's a fine dining restaurant or a Resort), but I'm not going to just hit the five or four star button for giggles.    With that being said, I think I'm actually quite generous with MadHouse Coffee.  I'll give them the extra star based on the fact that the cafe latte that I ordered was actually pretty good.  Not EXCELLENT but good.    I would give them two stars based on the fact that the "barista" didn't really know what when into what.  You should really know if a certain beverage has sugar in it or not or the type of milk that goes in it.    Also when we walked in they were mopping the floors and didn't even bother to remove the bucket that was right in the middle of the place.  In such a small area - anything on the floor takes up way too much room and extremely dangerous.  Cleanliness is top notch in my book, and I appreciate the efforts to provide a clean store, however- please remove the bucket when you're done!  I didn't realize that it was still behind me when I took a step back and almost fell over it.    Aside from that, the place is pretty hip, and I'd choose their latte over Starbucks any day, but I was far from overly impressed.

dIyuIcBhqRrAUo68c7_w6Q.text: Thee best customer service.  They provided multiple recommendations for my food and drink order.  I was missing a brownie but went home already, and with a quick email - they credit back to my card without my receipt.  I recommend the Impossible Burger with yucca fries.  Food & Beverage was fresh, high quality and just delish.  My iced green tea was soooo good.   I'll be back to try everything.

3idztf9o4zJQ2LXEbFQujQ.text: The owner Marco is amazing!  Really great guy.  Wishing the Madhouse Coffee Shop great success in the New Year.

6XKS7Bky2ZTKxwQXrzssBA.text: Herbivore Review We were here about two days ago and ordered delicious (giant blended drinks), Herby asked which blended drinks were vegan and the dude behind the counter said they had a vegan powder so pretty much everything was available except a few syrups. Herby ordered a Vegan Michael Jackson, which was delicious!!  We came back to work here for the day and drink lots of coffee. Herby asked the girl behind the counter which of the flavors were vegan again and she said 'NO BLENDED DRINKS CAN BE MADE VEGAN'. Herby mentioned that we were here the other day and served vegan blended drinks, to which she just repeated that wasn't possible. So we left and drank delicious blended drinks at The Cuppa in Downtown Summerlin.  So, either MadHouse does not have vegan blended drink options and lied about it or their employees aren't properly trained about the dietary options of what they are serving. Either way, we're taking our coffee needs elsewhere.  Overall This used to be our go-to spot in Vegas for working late. We won't be back again.

bqXL-kVIJ3CQoz0Pkxcw1w.text: It's been awhile since my last visit and as I stated previously their service was lackluster. I stopped here last night because coffee bean was closed and I was getting my sick friend a chai latte. When I was ordering at the drive thru I asked if they could give me a chai latte hot and a caffe mocha also hot. The girl decided to reply pretty abruptly by informing me " yea, both things you ordered come hot already." I'm not sure where this girl got her experience but people order ice mochas and chai lattes cold ALL the time which is why I specified what I wanted. Yeah thanks for the tip attitude & burnt coffee. I wont be helping pay your rude ass anymore though. Desert Wind it will stay lol

XEm8Yik2heqWDCJ0Mcb-Kw.text: Great coffee, down to earth Barista's, very friendly owners (I personally met both, I was a frequent flyer though #GraduateSchoolStruggle), great food selection with *delicious* vegetarian options, down-to-earth customers, and awesome thought-provoking artwork.   When I decided to leave Las Vegas, I knew that I was also leaving a second "home," I was a regular, and I always felt comfortable getting work done. There were a few times when I would get into really great conversations with Las Vegas locals, and I actually bought a good deal of artwork from Recycled Propaganda whose work you'll see around the cafe. Now that I'm settled back on the East coast, I miss my West coast staple. However, I know that it's a place that I can go to where I can feel at peace and be around good people. I even ran into friends here (and I hadn't told them about Madhouse), though people love it and they have the business to prove it.  I say all this to say that I miss Mad House, I miss the Barista's, I miss Marco and his wife, and they made it that much more difficult to move when I left. However, they will always be a shining star during my 2 years in Las Vegas. With that said, when I'm back in town vacationing, I will definitely go out of my way to drop by and say hello, and absorb the good vibes of Mad House.

A7C2hahDOFr8jiXrbnjn3g.text: Love this place! It has such a good vibe and the people are very friendly, food is great.

ypr2ojdxA_jX7BENbu8NZw.text: Came here with my girlfriend one late night for some studying.    The staff did an excellent job at suggesting some of their most popular coffees abs and at explaining some of the details between drinks.  I ended up getting a white chocolate Nutella latte that was super tasty.  The guy who made it seemed to really enjoy trying to make it well too.  When he swerved it to me, he asked for me to let him know how I liked it. It's that extra care and attention and consideration that goes a long way and he seemed to sincerely want to make me a good cup of Joe. And I gotta say, he didn't disappoint. Coffee was terrific.    Next time I'm gonna try the red velvet cake latte.

qr3LHLMq-vrJxzsbORyNvQ.text: This is a simple review for me. The following is what I need from a coffee shop.  1. Good coffee. 2. Stevia. 3. Unsweetened almond or soy milk.  This place has all three plus their staff is friendly and they are open 24 hours. I will definitely be back for the coffee and also to try some of their menu items. I noticed they also have hookah there.

PqEwCEvGeZ-6i-O6yN6KmQ.text: Food and coffee is great and tasty! Baristas are super nice and give great recommendations. The vibe and atmosphere is awesome and chill. Would recommend

VvuFwcfyd07vQSw0gPBLwQ.text: After not being here for so long, I got invited by a friend to have a study date. This place is pretty chill & I like their set up. It wasn't busy when we came in so it was easier to study cause there weren't a lot of noises. So I ordered the Jasmine Tea Latte. Yes, they have tea lattes. It won't be on their menu but just ask the front for it. The latte is okay, priced pretty good. For a large (32 oz) - $4.50. The drink lacked sweetness and it was mostly milk so I was pretty disappointed about that. The staff are nice though. I forgot to tell the cashier to make it iced so he delivered a hot drink. But he was glad to replace it for the right one with a smile on his face. Overall, a great environment. They're open early. I'd come back and maybe try their fraps, especially the Nutella frap

smzXga2a3XnhqEaVaB--CA.text: I love you guys. You're all perfect, and I would marry each and every one of you. The matcha frap thing is so good. They don't mock me one bit when I ask for decaf with almond milk. Their Gorgonzola gnocchi is good, but not as good as the Wannabe (+tomato). I also sometimes opt for the sugar-filled Nutella drinks. Their one fault is their "Italian hot chocolate" which I love,,, but also, it's literally just warm pudding with some extra milk. I personally love warm pudding, but I can buy a pack and some milk for $3. Just buy the Nutella stuff instead.

Ka5eTamL9rZ1gUirSrU8Jw.text: Madhouse Coffee is a fun little coffee shop! I got the Looney Tuna on Soft Focaccia bread and it was SO GOOD. Also had the Monkey Mocha. Everyone there is super nice and my order came out really quickly. Fun place to work (free WiFi) or just hang out. Plus they are open 24 hours and have a drive thru. Yummy food and coffee, would definitely recommend!

ehPU07bRSPXEFgESgxux6w.text: I've been going to this place for years. Not because I want to, but because I feel like it's a more authentic taste than Starbucks. However, their terrible customer service never surprises me. I should not go to your establishment and be surprised if I have a good customer service experience (don't worry, this hasn't happened yet). Being terrible with your customers shouldn't the god damn norm. It's not even worth it now when I get my drink it's half full on the inside. I just don't understand how you stay open. I'm excited for a Dutch broths opening on my side of town so that I can go somewhere that appreciates the money keeping them open and the people who are giving it to them.

mS97HTT9JfEBzrm9fxo9FA.text: I walked in no one was at front I put my keys and wallet on counter and some lady came from back and looked at me and then looked at me again while I was standing there and said can I help you I said not with that fn attitude.  I walked right out learn manners like hi welcome to mad house or good afternoon what can I get started for you. Lto4FcJ7aTaoLlJ-N1_fCQ.text: Due to jet lag, we were up WAY too early, but just our luck Madhouse was 24 hours! The staff could not have been more helpful and personable (above and beyond at that early).   Excellent selection of sugar free syrups and a great sense of humor on their food offerings (check out the chocolate molds). Lively decor (monkey fiction? pulp banana?) reminiscent of coffee houses in the 90's.   3 days in a row, this easily became our coffee shop of choice!  I'd give it six stars if I could!

7c8KZ1LSIg5BO9of3eh_vg.text: I really like this place. They offer a little bit of everything and are open 24/7. With my work schedule, it's nice to know I always have a place to go to study. I have never been to this place when its slow but they have added more seating which has been helpful. If you're on the go, they have a drive thru.  The service is always welcoming and friendly. They always get my drink correct and the espresso isn't overly bitter. They offer a variety of different milks, my favorites are almond and hemp. they have plenty of sugar free flavors as well as regular. My favorite drink is a triple shot extra hot almond milk sugar free white chocolate (syrup) latte. Their regular chocolate is currently not vegan. The music isn't bad and I've actually shazamed some really good songs there.  They offer vegan food choices!! Currently on the menu is a vegan stuffed sweet potato and a vegan sandwich. They also offer a raw vegan brownie!! I plan on trying everything and when I do, I will update accordingly! If you haven't tried this place, I highly recommend that you do!

1yXDtII8so3YUBWgz8Qk7w.text: The impossible burger!!  The bread they use too is killer!  The yucca fries and the salad are both good sides - the salad needs a bit of salt.  Seriously the impossible burger is impossibly good and tastes like a burger.  My cousins were brought up without eating meat and I kinda wondered what they thought of this burger, because it is clearly for meat eaters.

N8EZDv3-3ShIxfvvj497yg.text: This little shop looks like Barney's art box exploded onto the walls, in the best way possible, like those kids really brought their A game. In all seriousness, I love the eclectic art walls of color and style. The menu unique with names fit for a madhouse! Basic coffee/espresso is delicious and if you are craving something sweet- try any of the specialties blended. Yum! This place was packed when I passed through, so not ideal for studying but great for a trendy meet-up!

XOidLRB8WpvKOpYHRTgvog.text: I heard about madhouse probably 6 or so months ago & decided this would be a good spot in vegas to stop & get some caffeine on our drive to LA. we drove here from SLC on friday 9/13 & i was super impressed with the place! i ordered a large iced vanilla latte with oat milk, back home a large almost everywhere is a 24 oz. but this thing was a god damm 32 oz., which was actually perfect cuz more caffeine for the drive. my husband got a 24 oz. frappe with lavender, however they added whipped cream even though he had asked them not to.   my drink was stupendous, i'm obsessed with oat milk & like NO WHERE in utah has it i swear, so this was a real treat. my husband would've liked his more had it not had whipped cream. the food was just okay, i had the vegan bowl & he had the vegan pesto gnocchi. it was pretty overpriced so i don't think i'd get an entree from them again, but will definitely be back next time we're in vegas for coffee. the staff was great & i enjoyed all the decor & overall vibe. they have a lot of anti-trump, anti-cop & what some would consider "vulgar" decor/themes (like their wifi is "trump is a c*nt") so if trump is your guy this place is probably not for you- i've seen a lot of reviews where people complain about it, but honestly- it's their store & they have a right to put up/say whatever they want. if you can look past it & enjoy their coffee, great. if not, also great- more oat milk for mami!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. WFPB Vegan Bowl
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 32 oz. iced vanilla latte w/ oat milk
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. vegan potato gnocchi

A4XXpILCUKpP2DEoerwaog.text: One of my favorite coffee houses in Vegas. It's a modern hipster vibe. Plenty of vegan and vegetarian options to choose from. Located on the corner of Durango and Deseret Inn.   They have a comical menu names that make it fun   I always get the Monkey Mocha and try a new menu item each time. I like how simple the menu is but yet as a lot of flavor. Sometimes cafes get to fancy and you have no idea what you are ordering   There is art all around the cafe that you can buy. Usually they are political but tasteful.  If you aren't "hipster" don't worry. Everyone is really nice and welcoming. All types of people come here. You people reading books, to having keyboards hooked up to a Mac making music, people doing homework or just a quick in an out. It's a fun hang out area and Has a small patio outside as well.   Wish they would open more locations up around the valley but I always stop by when I am in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half of the Innocent Bystander

CtRvFK87uBU9Osyw_h2ezg.text: Madhouse Coffe is not your cookie-cutter coffee house.  The coffee is hot, and the staff are as chill as the iced coffee they provide :) Everything is AMAZING!!  From the pastries to the delicious vegan delights and also the mouthwatering burgers. All of which will give you enough energy to accomplish that 12-page paper due at midnight!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender Latte

WYZcyh5nsHRQ0ZPGTypIVw.text: Right on Desert Inn, I made a visit at Madhouse Coffee just to cool down for awhile and order a drink. This is a casual and hip environment. I can't help but noticed the monkeys in suits and a dolly of a naked trump, haha. It made me feel like I'm in someone's dormitory. The atmosphere does feel laid back and this place gets a little more lively closer to 6. I love the music variety. They were playing hit songs like Billie Jean, Get Down On It, and there's a bit of jazz.   It's a small coffeehouse and finding a place to sit can be tricky. If it's available, they have a couple of small tables, there's also a window seating, and a counter seating. If you're getting something for to-go, they have a bench seating for you while you wait for your order. They also have one large table with cool swiveled chairs that can seat up to 8 people. This table is wide enough to have space for your laptop and do some work.  From hot and cold drinks, they also have a menu for snacks and hot food. I was in the mood for something light. I placed my order to dine in, but they had mistakenly delivered the food to my table in a to-go box. The person had offered to plate it and was very accommodating and polite. I had the Avocado Toast ($10.95), it's two sourdough bread topped with fresh sliced avocados, a calabrian red hot chili paste, and black pepper. Avocado is perfectly ripe and has no blemishes, it taste great with the mild chili paste, but it would be nice to have the bread toasted.   For drink, I tried the Japanese Matcha Blended Green Tea with no foam ($7.00), it is nicely sweetened but nothing really special. I've actually had better matcha elsewhere. And they have a dessert case with an assortment of pastry and sweet treats. I got the Croissant Bread Pudding ($4.50) which is drizzled generously with chocolate syrup and sprinkled with powdered sugar. It was like a sponge bread cake, it taste soft and not overly sweet.   Overall, this is a good place to have a small group meeting, they offer free wifi, it's a cool hangout to pass time with friends and just relax. I would come here again simply because the service is friendly. My only concern is the price. On the takeout menu, it showed $7.99 for an Avocado Toast and I was charged $10.95. Not sure why the food cost is so steep for an avocado on bread.

Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado Toast With Mild Chili Paste

tpZkiATiciCBXta-bIB29g.text: decided to give them a try before heading to go grocery shopping.  Cute lil coffee shop, with a drive thru woohoo but since I didnt know what to order, we opted to go in. I ordered the Caramel Latte and Ed a cold brew w vanilla syrup. We waited a few moments and out comes the order.  I take a sip of E's cold brew....ICK.  Is there vanilla in here?  No sweetness at all and it wasnt strong.  I take a sip of my caramel latte and WTH, did they stick the entire bottle of caramel in here? I asked for 5 more pumps of vanilla for E.  Still weak but we left. Tried to mix our two together to balance it out and we just ended up pitching it.  I wanted to love this place, esp the cold brew bc that is my jam and we kinda go past it every two weeks to go to Sams Club on DI. Nope...guess I'll have to find somewhere else.

ETVBpKj1mrw_oMtrO2uOGQ.text: Took a break from running errands all morning, and I have to say that it was a nice breath of fresh air. Friendly staff and the vibe was super chill and relaxing. Love the coffee, music and the vibe.   As I'm reading some of the reviews I'm noticing people give low ratings for the differences in this joint. It's DEFINITELY NOT Starbucks....in a good way. To each their own. :-)   Thanks for being my time out spot today guys!

RspPAM2h5y8S9L_TH3v19w.text: Open 24/7 and not on the strip... Full of amazing art by Recycled Propaganda... Delicious beverages... Options for vegan patrons and those who avoid  dairy and gluten... I'd seriously spend all of my tip money here if I lived in the vicinity...  I had a latte made with hemp milk and it hit the spot. It was a double espresso kind of morning for Gary T...  The decor is made of reclaimed lumber and metal pipe. There is original artwork covering the walls, windows, tables, candleholder, counters, display cases, doors... It's food for thought, not just for your belly here, with a bit of dark humor thrown in. The staff are super friendly as well -- it's always good when you offer something cool in your business, but you don't try to make your patrons feel too uncool to actually be there experiencing it - haha!
