eton_TrfZ7lz7V0NpMhk5g.text: Madhouse has a great atmosphere - good lighting and open 24/7. The coffee shop is on the small side but there is also seating outside. Cool thing - they have hookah and food too! Younger crowd, recommend for a good place to study or work

nNkz3mVJrB7U683XGXNEKg.text: Every time I come here I'm never disappointed. Madhouse is one of my favorite places to swing by and get some good coffee. The drive thru and it being open 24/7 is very convenient. A bit pricey but worth the money. Love the atmosphere and great people.

2vlzEEHw9aAo4SA-_RAzDA.text: My boyfriend and I decided to give this place a try one night because it was about the only thing open that had decent food and coffee. Ever since that night, we've gone there at least once a week. The place is usually packed during the day, but we love to go late-night, around 2:00 am, that's when it's nice and quiet.   The food is always good, the baked goods are baked fresh and always delicious as well. And for the coffee, well, I haven't been disappointed yet. Their chocolate croissants and the Nutella White Chocolate Mocha are my favorite. We love the guy Andrew that is always working there late night! He's always friendly and more than happy to answer any questions you have. Definitely going to continue coming back!!!

wA8JbEt8s3ETSun4uQl0pw.text: 24 hour coffee shop?  Yes!  One of my favorite in town.  I am not much into latte but they have a lot of unique latte flavors to choose from.  I usually order an Americano or Chemex.

2L7lFr7CGZBmCcfBRi2y0A.text: Delicious coffee that will defiantly wake you up and really happy baristas overall this place rocks and it's open 24 hours, like everything in vegas should be!!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet latte and a cappuccino yum.

8PYvC5qQ40zPc4jfZCJrAA.text: Best coffee near my house and definitely one of the better shops in Vegas. Legit espresso drinks which is rare for this area. Also 24hrs is always a plus. I've never been over in the late hour but it turns into a hookah spot with lots of heads. Pretty funny vibe but Madhouse is a great fixture of the neighborhood.

V_yM9pxyn-CuohrhAINcpw.text: So I've been ordering a lot lately from madhouse via post mates. One great thing is they are on post mates plus which knocks the delivery fee down dramatically if your an avid post mates user like myself. There open 24 hours and the quality of there food through the am hours of ordering never changes. It's a lot better in my opinion if your a late night eater to stop by here then frequent a  24 hour McDonald's. The looney tuna sandwich on a soft croissant is lovely comfort food. There ravioli is great too. I really like island of Capri on focaccia as well. They also have fruit smoothies if your not looking for coffee and an ever changing bakery selection. I just love that there open 24 hours, have awesome food, prices, and on post mates plus. The red velvet frap is Delish and gets you moving.

yaMy9MaCobkTSDRNVFZWkg.text: The good: super friendly staff, decent iced latte, open 24 hrs  The not-so-good: outrageous prices (this coming from someone who normally has no qualms with coffee-shop prices; you're not getting anything extra-special for the extra dollar you're going to pay for coffee, and I am comparing prices to other local coffee shops, not just Starbucks), "kitschy" stuff all over the place I guess to support this whole "mad-house" idea that to me just seems sort of contrived.  But my iced latte did the job and it is open 24 hrs and close to me... so I'm sure I'll be back. I would not drive out of the way for this ever.

LbDEV7BXF42qZbe_zagDHA.text: Good stuff, but a little overpriced. It's more like a fancy coffee shop when you really wanna indulge.

-ewiZyJRkRYiQ6LZQKLmEA.text: First time here. This place had a very cool atmosphere and the coffee was on point. I like that people were there socializing, not just on their phones or laptops. I will have to come back again.

wzXK-GdyDUu8E0tTQOz-bg.text: Love that this place is always open!! The coffees and teas are always the best quality never a complaint, love the vibe for an after work unwind spot or the best for a grab a friend coffee hang out! Love the looney tuna or the green card sandwich always a good on the run spot to grab a good lunch!

E3ZvNXwwTBGHJRqs4Hhopg.text: Like a lot of places these days, the menu caters to a millennial crowd looking to try that "something different" food item.  The interior decor is nice and is a refreshing change from the other major coffee shops.  Free wifi.  And there are a lot of unique, interesting sounding items on the menu.   But "sounding" interesting is about as interesting as it gets.  I'm going to call them out on one of their signature items -- the Red Velvet Frappe.  So many Yelpers praised this unique item so highly that it naturally had to be the first thing I try -- overlooking the very high price.  YOLO, right?  What did I get -- let's call it what it is -- it is a Vanilla frappe with red dye in it.  Nothing more.  So I pay over $5 for a Vanilla frappe with red dye -- suddenly the outrageous prices by the other well known coffee chain don't look so outrageous.  As for the taste of the Frappe, it was good -- for a vanilla frappe with red dye in it.  So given that I was expecting something so much more unique and unusual, I was somewhat disappointed -- and add on that the outrageous price for the very bland, common frappe, I was left with the impression that I would not order that item again.  At first I was interested in trying all of their unusual frappe flavors -- but after experience the red velvet, I was suddenly less interested.   I also tried a couple of their macaroons and a tiramisu. Both were also good, but not so great that I would go out of my way to this place just to eat again.  Not sure I will go back.  Still think its a cool place to meet over coffee and someplace different.  But they need to maybe rethink either the pricing of their not-so-special items or make them indeed special and worth the price.  Just a friendly suggestion.

XIHmlal42vkQO4iu7CHjeg.text: LOVE THIS PLACE...The coffee is good, the tea is good the staff are amazing and they have organic which is hard to find.

VEw-kxby8ZDRlPyMNcySRA.text: After working to a fast pace customer service career I'd probably been too conscious on how establishments handle their customers. I have been often used this cafe for deliveries, so one day my husband and I tried to visit for the first time. Maybe it's just that day for others but first impression lasts, I was disappointed and quite embarrassed for being a loyal customer, my expectations wasn't right. Attendant: The guy with the curly hair was impatient, he may had a moody day but that doesn't applied to your job! I ordered my favorite Cappuccino and then after being confused with the overwhelming menu I chose Looney Tuna. My cappuccino has no sugar, and was looking around to find but saw it inside their counter, I ended up eating first and when I got an opportunity I ask the girl to hand me sugar, it's a feeling of Finally. They look busy into something simple and they panic, I caught the two guys gossip while staring at me, how's that? At the end of the day, it's a fail, unfortunately. Not a Cool business.

dqqEZuTfxe6zMEl74Dc7gQ.text: Great breakfast sandwich and even better latte. Very pleased to have stopped in here on my way to a day of conferences. Happy to get a better product than I may have found at the conference facility....certainly for less price.  Really liked their built in banquette seating, and paying with Square cash register system.  Highly recommend!

5Nl2w5L1SjdJxFDiJDaxOQ.text: One of my favorite coffee spot on the west side!!! Cold brew open til 4pm at the gramercy ! Manger and staff are absolutely awesome.

1oHKVV5wkJpR9TTqzQkGTw.text: I've been here a few times and the coffee is very good. I change it up every time I go, but haven't had anything bad. It's 24 hours, which is great for students that need to do some late night studying or anyone that wants something to do at 2 AM. I've only been after midnight and it's usually pretty crowded, but you can find a seat. When you walk in, the first thing you'll notice is the artwork on the walls. Very interesting and gives the atmosphere a quirky and relaxed vibe. There are board games and the staff is pretty knowledgable. Everyone seems to have a good time and enjoys what they're doing. It's a little cramp, would love to see a location on the north side of town.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The artwork is my favorite.

EExZ_rPy-cjsO4T88HjhxQ.text: Big fan of this place. I'm over how Starbucks has taken over.. so to find a good coffee joint that's independently owned I'm an instant fan. The Matcha Green Tea, thumbs up! The only draw back, I wish I lived a tad bit closer.

b9h7mbqeBhDB2Xi5t8NzWQ.text: DELICIOUS coffee. Wow. Mad Cow latte was delish, and the blended Japanese matcha was OUT OF CONTROL amazing. Tried a sandwich and it was good BUT, I think their sandwiches should be eaten in instead of taken home via drive thru. Had the usual suspect sandwich and the bacon was pretty undercooked. My friend had BLT and again, undercooked bacon. But honestly everything else about each sandwich was really good, and the drinks really cannot be praised enough. Bye Starbucks!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blended Japanese matcha! OMG. SO GOOD.

jVuEgaf_Akse8UVbzKmaxw.text: Only came for coffee but I was so surprised to find a cool place like that in Vegas, defiantly coming back to try the food.  Service was great, my cashier was nice and friendly. Atmosphere was great, full of people.  Coffee was good, I also tried a chocolate spoon which was a nice addition.   It's a good place to come with a friend to talk or even alone to work or relax.

ctH4H-_oEcJlWLjnxAVjXQ.text: I always come here to get away. I've never had bad service. I've been coming here for almost three years now and cannot say I've ever had a bad experience. Great place to relax and have good conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So chill!

US7Bb_4x1Z1DLoGUxeJNWg.text: This is my favorite cafe in Vegas! They have a great atmosphere and I love that it's 24hrs!

fNqgcxRPTNXYY0iTGhk1QQ.text: My personal favorite. Great ambiance (LOVE their playlist), awesome artwork all over the place (some of them priced for selling, too), and the baristas are always friendly. The coffee is great (espresso macchiato and their cold brew!), and the sandwiches are bomb af (The Prosciutto!!!). Not much for hookah, but they offer that service as well (just fyi). They have an outdoor patio with a nice number of tables and seats that can accommodate big groups of people. To top it off, they're open 24/7. It can get pretty packed at night towards around 3AM, though.  Bottomline, I love MadHouse. I go here a lot and it has yet to fail me (I pray never). Five stars.

Ndyq5x_8kuGLOkqqn6aCUw.text: Recently at madhouse coffee... Even though I've been here close to 200 times or more, I still get treated with the kindness and customer service that one would expect from being a first-time customer The coffee and lattes are always as great as the staffs enthusiasm to create a wonderful experience The owner is more than happy to share the background of his coffee products The environment promotes a laid-back comfortable feeling I always bring a friend here because it's so different than any other coffee lounge I've been coming here since it opened and this is the first time I am yelping about madhouse coffee because they definitely deserve it

NwRPHSJJgJPGJl8vzCI6Xw.text: Went there about a while back for their Italian Hot Chocolate on the way to the dog park. It was amazing - super thick and tasty. Had to go back a second time a few weeks later and enjoyed it a second time. Stop in and enjoy!

67qB_-VNEU6frnIpqWntxw.text: Pretty expensive for a cup of coffee, about $6 for a small. However, they are gourmet coffee for a reason. I always get the iced crushed coconut mocha. They actually take the coconut and crush it in store, mixed with the mocha, it's the perfect mix every single time. The blended red velvet mocha is amazing, not to sweet and the Michael Jackson is better iced rather than hot. We also tried the bread pudding and idk if it's because we went at 10pm and it was old, but it was dry and hard. Wasn't worth the $5. Most likely will just stick to the coffee!

yFPOHZ3OzweRZ3l405_agQ.text: I love this coffee house. I wish I had one just like this where I live. I enjoyed their coffee drinks especially the caffe latte and the hot chocolate. They actually have several options so you can get the hot chocolate with coconut milk or almond milk

E0D6DxYOs1oGgBm81ZNJLw.text: I come here all the time for late night homework sessions and I absolutely love t because I can focus and drink the best lattes in town. I'm a huge Starbucks junkie, but this place has a great ambiance and its perfect for late night studies. Love love it. Oh and staff is awesome too!!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nthxFQble42uKzrj3Yh43g.text: Honestly I come here a bit, because it's open 24 hours and it's about a mile from my place. I feel like they should know how to properly make a London fog. As a barista myself I appreciate the quality over quantity. Cool art though recycled prop rules.

K27HUgfUOvB67MnfMQjaFA.text: Love this place! I'm a college student and I came here to work on an assignment and do some studying with my group. I loved everything about this place! I do have a thing for coffee shops but this one is awesome. The ambiance is really nice and cozy. The workers were nice. The food was great and so are the drinks! It's the perfect place to relax, maybe do some work or chat. It's also great that it's 24 hours. Perfect for a college student like me hahah. Definitely coming back!

AJXOpC_2iQAWJlc4codHUQ.text: I am here probably every night because the coffee rocks and the service is good too. Pretty much everyone there is cool and hard working, but Jessie and Mike definitely make me come back. Both make great coffee and offer amazing service. I know when they work my coffee is going to taste amazing.

159b4vBjzbY88vLGg6BxvQ.text: Pleased for sure with the staff and drinks! Quick pleasant and gooooood drinks! You need more locations give them a raise!!!

yM-Qa4Z6XQ6dWRJWoCAl4A.text: I went here this morning for the first time.  I was excited to have found a new coffeeshop.  I came in at 7am on my way to work.  There was one couple ahead of me.  There were 2 male employees working.  One was helping the couple, and was working so slow that it took almost 10 min of waiting before I was able to order.  The 2nd male employee saw me waiting & never offered to help me.  No one said hi to me when i got to the counter, not a good morning or anything.  Their customer service skills were nonexistent.  After I got my drink & was leaving they still never said bye, have a good day, come back again or anything.  But the worst part is that the latte I ordered was lukewarm, it was not hot!!! Who makes a lukewarm latte?!  I will never go back!!  Terribly rude employees!

2TqjN0gOabbVRxlfSgj-Uw.text: I'm from Portland Oregon and this place reminds me of it a lot the staff are friendly and the coffee is pretty good, I've been stopping in every day now sense it's on my way to work, they have so many options that I choose something different every day

D_6fdOgCm2kxTKZo-DAfhg.text: Favorite coffee shop in Vegas, how have I just found this place??  Their espresso... I can't describe it but it's almost sweet and creamy.  Never had beans like this before.  But it's great, and a great addition to Las Vegas.

9ZCoiCYCAR-LCXhlQ0oU-g.text: It was 10:30 at night and I wanted some decent coffee so I searched on yelp and found this place.  It was packed on a Monday night.   The cashier/ owner Marco was super helpful. We got the mad cow( hazelnut) and a white mocha. Each was very good.  This place seemed like a hangout area for people in their mid 20's to do homework and hangout. They had a nice patio to sit out and enjoy the night.  I can't wait to come back and try the red velvet mocha.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YSAFOfxsVIxXhDz6Que8sQ.text: I honestly do not understand why this place has such a high rating. I came here after work to relax with my siblings. After the service, I wanted to leave ASAP. The person in front of the register stuck out her middle finger right before we started our order.  Uhh, that's not something you do in front of customers! My brother almost thought that was towards him, but we realized she was actually talking to another employee beside us. Yup. Talking to her coworker that's off the clock while we were waiting to state our order.   Finally getting what we wanted, I was not satisfied at all.  My vanilla latte had no taste. Well, hot milk with a shot of coffee is how I'd describe it.  Tiramisu was almost okay.   It's a very small venue so there's not a lot of seating. Most of the tables and chairs are outside the coffee house. The decorations are okay and it suits the "mad house" concept. I guess it got the high rating cuz of the hipster feel of it which attracts people.  And everyone wants to be a damn hipster these days..

krWxCrgf403bCbwPuOFFMw.text: Went. There a few times was always ok. This last time new people working, the girl who helped me was very abrupt made me feel lime I was bothering her. The coffee was terrible , threw it out! Will never go back there.

FKye4jnAaBBKzSNAoPD8Nw.text: OK It's been a long time since my last review! I've had to up the ante here, since I think I've got nearly 25 checkins :/ My favorite thing is 24 HOURS.  I crave coffee at all hours and it is amazing here. Prices are fair compared to Starbucks and the flavors are different. I love a place with Monkey Mocha and Red Velvet. Oh BTW, hot red velvet mocha just stole first place as my favorite of all time hot coffees. It used to belong to Starbuck's marble mocha macchiato. The drive thru is rarely busy, which is how I order most of the time, but they do have some stellar food here. I've had a couple things and they are all made in house. Try it out, I love it.

EwL4oZ9QXt7KARa-8eez2A.text: I like the cool decor of this one. Barista made a fun comment that I can't repeat. :-)

30j9TQXj1RiN5fMqkZ6GDQ.text: Fabulous coffee!!! Had the iced mocha with coconut milk!!! Like an almond joy. It was smooth, not bitter. Large size is generous. A little higher priced than I am used to. They have some interesting selections on the menu such as maple bacon latte and Nutella mocha.

Vdyzg--NiK_DgQtFjRMoaw.text: Best local coffee shop in Vegas!!  More alternative milk options than anywhere else, delicious coffee.  The food and desserts are great too.  Love the outdoor patio area with a view of the park, super nice.

6JhbXF8jzoHQKfzRnHmz_g.text: This place is cool. Nice atmosphere, good menu for food and stuff. But the coffee is wayyyy too strong for me. I'm used to the overly sugar-y coffee at Starbucks. I ordered a caramel macchiato and added a pack of sweet n low. Still too strong.. but bearable. I will come back, but ill for sure get a frappucino next time.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel macchiato and cappuccino.

-iEDJmmenbgHB3nUcSujpw.text: Coffee is fantastic. But customer service from one of the employees was terrible and ruined the experience.

n7WAIVv9h9spiBeNXNxM0w.text: This is a great place to come and work on my novel. The staff is very friendly and provide good service. But my favorite thing here is the customers, Friendly, down to earth people seeking caffeine with many seeking to improving their lives with their laptops and textbooks. I have made one friend already on just my second visit. 24 hours is great since I'm a casino worker.

K0y35eRZ4g6jW8DR04ziyA.text: Pros:  Late hours.... A range of people "types," which I find nice.  Mostly people in their early 20s, but definitely not all..... Excellent wifi connectivity..... I like it when their music is chill or jazz, anything without lyrics so you can hear each other talking better and be able to read/work better too. :) ......The drinks are delicious, from light and refreshing Italian sodas to succulent hot coffee drinks (served in glass mugs if you wish) to decadent blended coffee(or not) drinks  I don't find it a small thing that they use the tiny, almost crushed, ice cubes (No pun intended.)  It makes iced drinks so much more delicious to me. Lots of sweets/pastries, including chocolates made in house.(but the treats are priced quite high.).   The Green Card sandwich (turkey, cheddar, bacon and guacamole) was delish....  Various healthy and vegan choices, even almond , coconut, and hemp milk for your drinks.   The coffee beans' flavor is so rich and not bitter.....Lots of outdoor seating (but see "cons")...... They allow dogs (not just service dogs), even inside.  And will provide water for them if asked.    Cons:  a ridiculously hard to read menu because of how it's organized.  You are charged for water, even if you order plenty of other things too.... And the prices are a little high, especially for the quality/quantity of the food.  The pics on the monitor that show the food have a lot more meat on the sandwiches, etc.  The tuna sandwich is tasteless and dripping in mayo-type spread.  The herbal tea choices are sparse....Although the outdoor seating is plentiful, there is almost no shade, so if it's hot out, it's pretty miserable.  You are also quite squeezed in next to other tables.....The hookah service/coal changes is very slow or nonexistant.  And even for everything else, you usually have to go to the counter to get any new items, etc.  It's not that the servers don't want to help you; they are just understaffed, so the staff is either very friendly or slightly annoyed.  Wish they had board games like the Eastern location.  If they do, I've never seen them.... If you are expecting to always get out of the drive-thru quick, you shouldn't.  These people make delicious drinks and have attention to detail.   This isn't McDonald's or that other place with the burnt beans.  ;)

w5zQmz2f1c5ErXjgKNMRuA.text: I went here for the first time today. The place was small and there were a lot of people there. I ordered a large latte, but they said thy only had it in a 12 oz size, so I said that was fine.  The girl was nice and professional. I got my coffee to go and started drinking as I was driving and I could not believe how good it was! It had to be the best latte I've ever had, hands down!! I wish it was close to my work, because I would go there every day!! I will definitely be back. I would have given it 5 stars if it were just a little bigger and could have sat down to relax.

davA44nNCGnenENg-35jHQ.text: The best part about this coffee shop is that it's open 24/7 which makes it a perfect place to cram for exams or to get work done. However, the place gets packed and finding a seat can be difficult especially if you need to charge your laptop. As for food, the gay garden boy sandwich with barbecue sauce is delicious.

4DtjFXEdtygQ_5BywQEaqQ.text: This joint packs tons of character in such a small space. With art covering the walls and a quirky type of jazz coming out of the speakers, the atmosphere is simultaneously fun and mellow with friendly baristas to match. Small groups will find it more spacious outside on the patio, but there are a few tables inside. Solo sippers have more freedom with all the counters and barstools along the walls. If you don't intend to get cozy, MadHouse also has a drive-thru; if you do, it's open all day and all night.  Their sizes have normal names! A medium blended drink comes in a 24-ounce cup, the equivalent of a Starbucks venti in size, but its contents are full of creativity and taste. Their grasshopper is a subtly minty mocha combination. I like their crushed coconut mocha, but have much more of their menu to try. I've only indulged in their blended drinks, but their brewed coffees and sandwiches tempt me every time!   If you want to use their internet, let them know when you order and you'll receive a one-time use code. The time limit is based on how much you spend (e.g. $4-7 = one hour of WiFi, $10+ = four hours), so the more you pay, the longer your WiFi privileges stay.   I haven't settled on a favorite drink yet, but I've discovered my new perch.

PVBKd85jINc3_F2jKZk9KA.text: I love this place nicely decorated and good tasting desserts and drinks. I even like how after drinking the red velvet mocha drink my entire mouth, lips, teeth was all red and didn't notice until I looked into a mirror hours later. I'll be pulling a prank soon.  I don't remember if they're cheaper then star bucks or DD but I love the taste

Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet mocha yum

S_OlVzwl5aKPXn4p5MZiKw.text: 24 hours of great coffee + a great place to study!  Their teas are always amazing. My favorite is their green tea with almond milk, it gives me that perfect boost to keep on reading. The music and the artwork around the property gives it the perfect twist. Great ambience and really good service!

MocIODPhn1lsnkCRB0N2Mg.text: I am a repeatedly consistent customer here. The food and drinks are always made quickly and deliciously every time. I strongly recommend the hot Nutella white mocha! The very charming pig sandwich is amazing too. I've never had a bad experience here. The atmosphere is perfect for relaxing, doing homework, hanging out with friends, having a meeting, etc. I love this place.

bHmzLStrOjCoB0Zfi7UFnw.text: There is a very relaxed vibe in here, which is nice. I haven't tried any coffee here yet (only teas so far) but they have a fascinating slow-drip cold brew system set up which I will definitely try one day. Good for a late night study session, since they're open 24 hours. It's also cool that they have milk alternatives for those who are allergic or just looking for something different (almond, hemp, coconut).  UPDATE. I decided to try a medium iced vanilla coconut latte, and it was WAY too sweet for me. The barista with the beard (sorry dude, didn't get your name) switched it out for a plain iced passion tea and was really nice about it.

Ttwbh3aPxcVtvNdpA9Z5Yw.text: Cozy place with nice atmosphere. I come here with my friend to have a nice chat.  Their sandwiches really good and they have nice hookah

_6xkc4iX8T6NaN2PZKEUMg.text: I've had a love/hate relationship with this little coffee shop. I've been coming here for years, back when it was called Coffee Grind.  Walked in here after a several year break and loved it, absolutely the coolest decor and mood. Besides the obvious coffee and tea, they offer hookah and sandwiches.  They have a patio seating and the not-21-yet crowd hangs around here at nights, playing card games and awaiting to reach the age of 21 so they can start spending their time somewhere cooler.  I'd definitely recommend the patio and some hookah.

aipet8VzbAlZUzKlMxI_KQ.text: Nutella white chocolate mocha iced latte was pretty good, but way too sweet! Like WAY too sweet. Cashier was super friendly. I'll come back and try something better, looks like a decent place to grab coffee if youre around this area.

SZZ_nvRQLWQSC31x2SFnEw.text: I really like that it is 24 hours. I am a night owl so it cool to go somewhere and chill and not have to be around booze and smoke. I just had the Michael Jackson hot beverage. It was very good. Going to have another, because you get 50% off when you write a review! Which is the only reason, I am writing this review! Best to you!

BBT-ksmhDqO4mlQfOMJykg.text: The prices seemed a bit high for the average food & drinks they serve. And the girl working the drive-thru, I think her name is Haylee, was extremely rude! I'll NEVER come back as long as she works there. Her irritable, condescending tone and bad attitude was horrendous!

GkHtVij6Pw8KrQaIltc6cA.text: When I first started coming here it was to stick it to Starbucks and try a new coffee shop out. It was close and convenient to go there as well as being at a very suitable price range,  their coffee was very good. This past week I have been there almost every day and it has gotten consistently worse.the last time I went there, I ordered a CRUSHED coconut mocha hot. They left all the coconut in the cup. The whole cup was filled with flakes, I thought I could skim them off the top, no such luck. I tip because I know it's American standard, but this cup was not worth the 6 minutes of wait and the 8 dollars I paid for it. If it was a few flakes, I could understand. But when she served me the cup she was laughing,  I thought nothing of it until I started to drink it. Clearly intentional, since I been to the only one in Vegas,  at around the same time and the cups just got worse and worse until this, Just pathetic. Never going back.

p0wvpH_jxslKaeSpmccVwQ.text: I love Madhouse but I wish the patio was a little cleaner. Food and drinks are delicious and I love the drive thru. I have to remember that the larges iced size is HUGE and I need to get a medium.

2h4HskjPeOLE0w_qJxtM1g.text: It's so nice to have local places in Vegas, Mad House Coffee is definitely one to make a regular stop! They have a great menu, breakfast croissants, awesome sandwiches and the drinks are to die for. They even have Nutella which makes me very happy!

7o2n6WOn6mVzevZEnU01lg.text: The one thing that I like the most about this location is that they are open 24 hours. That is  really helpful for when I feel like having a late night coffee. The coffee, macchiato, cappuccino  and mocha are very delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It is theme to update the menu.

2OlbAfjv2iSRTZHEFDGpxA.text: Eh, I'll probably give them another try at least, but I am not super impressed.  Did the drive through yesterday, ordered the Nutella White Chocolate blended mocha. Came to $5.98 for the smallest size which I thought was way high even for coffee house prices. Worst part, is I don't actually think I got the right drink. It tasted nothing like Nutella or White Chocolate. It tasted like a regular mocha and had chucks of milk chocolate throughout the whole drink. It wasn't bad, but just seemed nothing like what I was supposed to get??  The reason I think I will probably come back is I didn't actually realize you could get different milks. I missed that on the menu, and I am lactose intolerant (took a pill to have the drink I got) and it would have been great to not have to worry about that. Not sure if there is an upcharge for that through. If so, I am not really sure these drinks would be worth an even higher price.

VpUZV0T46UJHJT25x8aRuQ.text: Place was cool. Coffee was good. But service was slow.

There is also a drive through and the place is open 24/7! What else could you ask for! I got the chai latte i would definitely recommend it!
