Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chai latte

1o14Z4a8d9TFfSEre_K5AQ.text: I've had prior opinions about this place, but after coming here more often, I can honestly can I love it. Great baristas, great atmosphere, GrubHub, Postmates, UberEATS, what more could you ask for?

mmfGOFRsb3XDPUngU6txmw.text: Showed up at 8 am and told they weren't open until 9:30... Soooo, a coffee house that advertises they're open 24/7, but they don't open until 9:30a?  This isn't the first time this has happened here.

FUxMY-lP0n4Mu1nVsIqKIw.text: So, we're leaving lunch when the coffee craving hits me and I pull up Yelp to find MadHouse Coffee. The whole way there, I'm thinking I have been here before, and not until we pulled up did I realize we came here a few years back when it was It's A Grind. From what I remember, it's definitely changed. It's a fairly small spot and even though it's a little hipsterish, I dig the art on the walls and some of the quirky little knick-knacks lining the counter.  The menu here is pretty big and naturally, the first thing that caught my eye was the mention of Nutella in multiple items. They've got quite a few unique items too like mocha frappes in Cake Batter, Red Velvet and my pick, the Monkey Mocha, which is peanut butter and banana. While both the peanut butter and banana flavor were really good in the drink, it was a way too watered down for me. The wifey had the Cake Batter Mocha and it was so insanely sweet, I don't even know how she drank it. I also got what they call the Nutellamisu and wasn't a huge fan. It didn't taste anything like Nutella and I think it may have been old. It was ok, but the taste just wasn't right and the ladyfinger portion of it was super soggy.  My biggest reasoning for the two stars is the employees. Whenever I go somewhere that has an open kitchen or whatever you call it in a coffee shop, I tend to watch what everyone's doing. Not because I want to nitpick, but because I'm legitimately interested and intrigued by what goes on back there. So, as I'm sitting there watching the two people back there work, I notice the girl keeps eating food behind the counter. And she kept doing that thing where when you eat something crumbly, you're almost putting your fingers in your mouth to catch it. Well, after she does that...she goes right to making something else and touching other food that was for a customer in the drive thru. Coupled with their not so friendly attitudes, it seemed weird and gross to me that she's back there eating, but not washing her hands. It was enough for me not to want to try anything else on the menu, including the sandwiches, which looked pretty good too by the way.  Prices aren't terrible, but they aren't great either. A medium blended drink will set you back about $6, which made our total bill just under $18 with two mochas and the Nutellamisu. For me, there was very little to like here and unless I was in the area at some weird hour craving coffee, I probably won't be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey Mocha (Peanut Butter &amp; Banana)
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutellamisu

zJOtpOtIpoj2iDz7riyLtg.text: Cool place to get coffee!  Fun vibe!  I had the Michael Jackson - super yummy mix of white & dark chocolate.  Really rich & creamy!  Service was good too!

iSxGPMTG6M1ROSA_oryE2w.text: Nice place to study comfortable and fun. Its an easy place to study in and i had alot of focus while staying in here. I come here often, it gets a little crowded during finals but its a nice place to kick it with friends or just study.

pwqNViwPGjjGVE09ljxYCQ.text: Italian hot chocolate is a drink you can eat!   Cross between pudding and hot chocolate.  I think I taste coconut in the whipped cream.    Divine!

8mYtyisxraZA0n6A-T0GLQ.text: My new favorite spot. Plenty of seating, access to power and open 24hrs. Coffee is great, though I've only had a latte... looking forward to trying more.

6c3wcGP7BwMf-PQRVpzj8A.text: I don't really know what the buzz is about. Got a vanilla iced latte and I wanted some macarons... there was only one flavor in the case and the cashier told me to look in the case next to it, which only had croissants...shouldn't you know what you have on display? I asked him if they had any more flavors and he had to yell it to another employee...um okay. I ended getting the only macaron therr was, I think it was orange. It wasn't amazing or anything. I don't think I'd come back.

F0uQTHfUoQfM3Qy_ecNtQQ.text: I ordered a sandwich called the prosciutto. It's gotten great reviews so I was excited. Prosciutto, fresh mozzarella, tomato, basil, balsamic on a fresh baguette. Perfect. Unfortunately mine came with no meat. On a sandwich literally called THE PROSCIUTTO, I got none. A little strange. The employee who made the mistake quickly realized what had happened and fixed it. 4 stars for service. I'll be back for my iced green tea from heaven and hopefully get the cured meat I was craving.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Where&#39;s the meat?

5a3x4ubeJaJYYNQdJuu37w.text: Really great coffee, somewhat over priced. Liked the look a bit better before the most recent remodel. But this is a really cool spot to chill and have a pretty good coffee with your friends, or while doing work of any kind. Kind of cramped inside, but there is a really nice spot for patio season if you want to sit outside. I do enjoy getting coffee from here.

3Y2lNWSBHYJzX-ihSQmG1Q.text: Of all the coffee shops I have been to, this is by far my favorite! The coffee is amazing! The Michael Jackson is to die for! And I love the customer service!

2kTYSYQvshc2KpvuPi_RKg.text: The nutella-misu is amazing! Definitely worth trying for nonnutella and nutella lovers!

BSc9oQubBWQR6-eIp0njzQ.text: The system here is ridiculous. It is customary to notify the customer if they will be charged again for a drink that needs to be remade. Instead of letting me know, they remade my drink and then proceeded to charge me stating that they need to charge me regardless because they made the drink. Had I been told I would have had the option to go through with it or not but they didn't and I was forced to pay the price regardless. They defended themselves that it's how they work as a business but that's not fair to me as a customer. They just took my money and that's just fucked up.

1_hZ8Qef08U2ylLdLtZrbg.text: My friend said this place was pretty good so we stopped by. We pull into the drive thru and as she's placing our order she's interrupted by the guy taking our order, so she had to repeat what we wanted. We pull forward and she asks if military discounts are given and he flat out said no...he wasn't very nice. They also got her drink wrong. Wasn't a great first experience for me. I won't be back.

AO8kj9GaRgVK1Dk66u1i-g.text: Walking up you are literally falling down the rabbit hole with this coffee's lovers hidey hole. You come in of course to the over whelimg stimuli of college students hard at work for tomorrow morning's exam while others have come for the caffine fix and good conversation. But the one thing you cant miss is the ecletic music style and quirky unique art displayed up on the walls. Everything about this place is everything starbucks isn't and I'm an avid goer of the green logo cupped queen. You are instantly welcomed and greeted with a smile and the staff is absolutely refreshing. This very laid back scene makes grabbing a cup of raspberry white mocha so worth the drive in the morning.

fpdZe3ozCF2zvzLrrcdQqg.text: Great coffee and they're open 24 hours. Interior is funky. Glow in the dark restroom (not in the photo). Free Wi-Fi. Nice place to chill, relax and study. Excellent service, Baristas were so nice and accommodating. We're all satisfied of what we ordered. (Michael Jackson, Mustachio, Mad Cow (covered with coffee beans) and Nutella White Chocolate Mocha). We'll definitely be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yVl8DTNT8RoDNI0WUO_3aQ.text: I really do hate to make this review because I have loved the atmosphere and the coffee at this place.  But, time and time again (and I am talking like more than 10 times) when I order a medium drink, they have made and charged me for a large and passed it off as an accident.  That wasn't really a big enough problem to steer me away until an incident today..  I found some old Free Drink vouchers that was given to me by the owner when the coffee shop was just opening. It specifically said "No Strings Attached", and there was also no expiration date on it.   I gave it to the cashier girl who said she would be back with my percentage total. I was confused as there was no "percentage off" on it. It was point blank FREE DRINK NO STRINGS ATTACHED.    So an older man appeared and asked where I got them, I said the owner gave them to us. He said he is the owner. I told him it was a female. He said that the vouchers were a few years old. I said there is no expiration on it. He left and then the female owner came to window.  She was nice. She asked where/when those were given to us. I definitely didn't expect her to remember us, she gave them to us in passing at Paymons Hookah Lounge, years ago. We reminded her, and she remembered and apologized.   Another cashier girl came to the window and said that our total was $8.45. And I said again the vouchers were for free drinks, and she said that those were made for drinks under $4. (Again reminder, NO STRINGS ATTACHED, and no fine print at all). We canceled the order, and she was annoyed and about to tell me they couldn't do that, but then the female owner appeared again and apologized.. But super quietly and said she gets I'm trouble for those all the time.  Man I felt bad for having put her through that, and I feel awful she has to deal with whomever the male owner is to her..   But I let them keep the vouchers because I truly have no more intentions of ever returning. There are too many other cool coffee shops in this town with nice owners. Makers & Finders for instance. And they just opened up their second shop over at the Summerlin mall.

lOnbAobV6VJZMZOPI1y1Rw.text: This place has the coolest vibes with the friendliest staff. Drinks and pastries make keep coming back as well

Be-V3xM5Hws77pPmLosszQ.text: Came here a couple years ago and fell in love with their White Chocolate Nutella Mocha. Such good coffee!

yW0m5cCboD5flm3EE2cFqw.text: This COULD BE a great establishment if they didn't let immature children run it. They take so long to take your order (especially in the drive-thru). They can't keep it together long enough to even ask your order. They're more concerned about messing around with coworkers than actually serving their customers. The food and coffee is great. But y'all should hire employees who are mature enough to handle a remedial job. They always mess up  orders too.

mSsS4LScIZMS3nQOj0Cosg.text: So I don't drink coffee so I'm not sure about the coffee but they have a mean peppermint hot chocolate! It's was really good and the environment is also great! It might be intimidating but don't let it you can make friends if your into that. The service is awesome. There were a lot of people doing homework. The seating is communal and he vibe was just really fun! It's was 11 pm when I went and it was busy. They have fun art and good music.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So yummy
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastries
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So hip in here

l7976klwXtIeh1sFT0JUKQ.text: I'm a regular at madhouse, Nutella white mocha all day!! They have an outside patio great for summer nights.

XTHAXy1tQvI6cWGtAJtvBA.text: Great job at creating something with character. Been going there forever.  Beens they use are very nice. They usually have two kinds of beens, ask the barista. Food I was not a fan of but gotta give credit to the management it has improved in the past years. The new toasts with avocado, if served freshly, are quite yummy and healthy. Management is very lively experimenting with candies and pastries coming up with some eclectic fusion forms that are surprising in its appearance but not much in the taste. It's on the level though. Don't get me wrong. You can feel a creative drive there. Local artist's Recycled Propaganda little exhibition is there permanently with sporadic painting rotations. Unique Vegas vibe with nice view of the Valley and extravagant European influence. Excuse typos. Written using voice to text.

9cfAYOU_ohoq3dKtxhY1iQ.text: I've gone here for a while now, but recently I've seen a dip in the quality of the drinks. They're not cheap and they don't have a lot of flavor. They taste mostly watered down. Probably the best thing about MadHouse is the atmosphere and the fact that they are open late. If you're not going here for one of those two things then I'm not sure I see the point. You might be better off just going to the Starbucks across the street. Hope this place goes back to the way I remember it being soon!

KQhACEStvG2Rlb2fTaQbUg.text: First time here and I love this place. The vibe is so welcoming, staff is very nice, excellent choice in music. I normally don't like blue berry muffins, but they had the best that I have ever tasted in my life. Definitely recommend this place!

VTQjE-ArLbermksf9z62bA.text: Open 24 hours, Madhouse coffee just gives me the hipster vibes. Love coming here during the late night hours and be able to just chill with friends. A big fan of their passion fruit tea.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Passion Fruit Tea.

C6FCu1pb8Ihq0HSoT5iepQ.text: I'm here almost daily! I love the vibes and the staff is always friendly. I ordered the impossible burger with yucca fries and let me tell y'all it was AMAZING Very vegan friendly, loves it

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Impossible burger w/ yucca fries YUM

8nIuVVvTevoAoQAs0VBlJQ.text: i love it here, but it's so wack without andy.:(  he made it so welcoming here and now it feels as if the baristas here aren't so outgoing and vibrant as andy was.

mLF0vy2xUt49gBx_33BMGQ.text: This is easily the coffee shop with the best service in town. Everyone is so nice and helpful. In a city where coffee tastes the same from venue to venue, it's nice to visit a spot where you receive amazing service as a trademark... and the potato gnocchi al pesto is pretty awesome too. Madhouse is awesome.

bqZ1etUKjZFChOU3K8pfrw.text: I've been coming here for the past 2 years and I'm shocked that I've never done a review...Sorry Madhouse, this is extremely overdue like most things in my life. (Clark county library system, I'll return those books soon.)   Ok, so Madhouse has a great vibe from the art work on the wall to the friendly and colorful people who work there. When I first started going, I'd go through their drive thru and R2D2 would great me! Being a STAR WARS geek, that was THE BEST THING EVER!!! I'm not gonna lie, that may have been the main reason I kept returning. But seriously, their coffee is scrumptious. I've tried their red velvet, their mad max, their white mocha, mad cow and cake batter. All good, but I am a repeat offender of their mad max. It has blended coffee beans in it so its got more texture than your usual blended drinks. Like I said, all drinks are good.   So if you're ever in the vicinity of this place, definitely stop by and try their drinks!

C4Gygh4B7M7KE9krCI2DGg.text: Terrible service, may be the workers need to drink some coffees to stay awake.  We bought the last two blue berry muffins from the display box but because our server didn't put them aside while making our pour overs, and so some other lucky customer bought them.  The explanation, not an apology, was that they sold out and asked if banana nut would do. Oh well, we reluctantly agreed since the pour over is still waiting to be made.  Finally we got our pour over coffee and it wasn't anything to write home about, and our banana nut muffin was no where in sight.  We inquired at the counter and the cashier was clueless.  Then we heard someone yelled it is in the oven.  They were brought out to our table immediately.  The bottom of the muffin are burnt and the parchment paper wrapper was so crispy dry that it breaks in your hands.  It is a mad house alright and enter at your own risk....

sVs6SDlp2D_nb_jDvOf09Q.text: My go to spot with a drive thru. The hemp milk chai tea latte is so delish! Iced or cold, just my fav. Their sandwiches are also so good. The breakfast croissant sandwich is just a classic, something yummy to soak up a a crazy night out.

FCCxZmwHXarA5W7DXJeaVg.text: The Italian hot cocoa is delicious! So thick and rich! The perfect drink to warm you up on a chilly evening.

dIrwVjbwid11sqyie70XEw.text: I really wish I got to this place more often than I do! First of all I love the name and how they have awesome & unique artwork inside. They also have a drive thru which I utilize all the time.  Drink wise I love their ice blended drinks. My favorites are the red velvet and mocha. Very tasty & the perfect consistency! I've also had a few of their sandwiches here which are very simple but delicious. The place really is great & I also saw a sign that they deliver with post mates. A must try for next time.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet mocha

gKYmpezDZRd4Kal7XqmoYw.text: First off, I wanna start with how impressed I am with the staff. My daughter hurt herself and they were nice enough to give us a bandaid and a free treat (macaroons), which were amazing btw. I got the Nutella white choc mocha (pictured) based on the reviews and the crushed coconut mocha the next day because anything coconut is delicious. Both didn't disappoint. I went in the first day and was so intrigued with the witty art. Didn't get to take photos or explore much due to my daughter being hurt, we rushed out of there. Went to the drive thru the next day and they were super friendly and quick. Will come back again to try their other coffees. Also, curious if their food is good. Will update. So far, 5 stars for me!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella white choc mocha + bonus sunset

wxo0scZVjbT-Vj6r7KkSjQ.text: MadHouse Coffee - where It's A Grind used to be. I'm not sure if it's still the same owners just with a different name, or a whole new establishment - either way, I don't really care.   I've been going to this location for years. It's the closest 24 hour coffee shop to my house. I used to frequent this establishment about three or four times a week.   It doesn't have the best coffee drinks I've ever tasted in my life, but he atmosphere is worth it. It's just very... chill. The baristas are always friendly and so are the patrons. You can almost always find someone interesting to talk to when you're bored. Has very limited seating on the inside, but also offers an outdoor patio - with plenty more space to sit.   Obviously being one of the only 24 hour coffee shops in the area, it gets pretty busy at night.

UKSbfYkjAGYw2P5jNd6lJg.text: Best Coffee, Breakfast Sandwiches, &&- Lunch Sandwiches. Also Has Great Art Framed Pictures For Sale If Interested In Art. Overall Great Place To Eat 24/7

rNIy-H_3p4Ju8Fr7hBLcag.text: This place is awesome. Never had an item I didn't like--it's all expertly crafted. Better and more distinct than Starbucks.  And the menu is full of lots of interesting options.  If the prices were lower, I'd be here every day!

0046x6CYW5M7NuA6rkjpiQ.text: After swearing off caffeine last summer, the stuff was calling me this morning.  I stopped by and had the delicious Red Velvet mocha non-fat and decaf to boot.  I never before would buy decaf, but now understand why the need for reformed coffeholics such as myself.  Very deliteful and desserty (is that a word!).

u4sJx12BZYyqijU0KrTsbw.text: I've been in here quite a few times usually only to pick up a cup of joe, but the food options have always been good. I love the fact that you can turn any sandwich into a salad, but the portions seem to vary depending who makes your order. A 24hr joint is always cool in my book though I never really find myself anywhere in the wee hours these days. But no matter the hour, there's always some people in here of any age group.. especially college kids gettin' their study on. They used to have those Man Beefcake protein snacks. Kiiiiiiinda wish they'd have them again, but at the same time I don't come here often enough to take advantage of it either--nor does the rest of their food really go with the fitness/protein bit anyway. Four stars because I don't really believe a 20oz iced Nutella almond milk latte should really cost almost $8 but then again.. I have paid for it a couple times over to know I do enjoy it regardless of the price.

0rFxYemWjzFM6SKvvR3HLQ.text: It was about midnight on an awesome Las Vegas summer night and I was looking for somewhere with an outdoor seating area that doesn't cost an outrageous price for drinks or requires you to be wearing heels. Just somewhere to hang out and have a conversation.   I had never been to MadHouse but having it be 24 hours and relatively close to our location, it sounded like a good choice. As we parked in front of the shop, the first thing we saw was a crowd of about ten high schoolers who looked like they just turned eighteen and were celebrating the fact they could now buy cigarettes. After walking through their cloud of smoke and having to reach around someone to try to reach the door handle to open the door because they were blocking the entrance, we were greeted with bright, artistically modern colors and designs that reminded me of the old nineties stick figure character with his "box" like dog.   The staff was very friendly towards everyone, including the drunk teen who had come stumbling in and just wanted to use the restroom. We were told suggestions of what was popular and I ordered the coconut mocha which was excellent. We decided to sit inside due to the cloud of smoke and teenagers outside. Overall, a nice place to hang out and order a different kind of coffee. Expect a younger crowd with a few older peeps thrown in. I would definitely go again.

DJgnH22MXlEcc4AFyNNWFA.text: Nice place to hang out with friends. Its comfortable, always excellent service. I like the sandwiches, but what about french macaroons, I tried once and didn't like them. Coffee is good, not bad. :)

ju-Opt8WeEnExcaekk-O2g.text: I really appreciate a place that is open 24-hours a day!! The service was friendly, and fast! They had a plethora of blended drinks, which i loved! They also offer hookah so.....if you wanted, that was definitely an option.

3CKO5Towggox71OAzcFKiw.text: Great 3am chill spot. I like the funky "artsy" decor. Has some character. Mango and green tea smoothies. mmmmmmm. They have a nice variety of menu items if your not a coffee drinker. Great names for their sandwhiches like "the threesome", or "the looney tuna". Serving some drinks in mugs which is nice and environmentally friendly.   What would make this place perfect: Two seperate bathrooms. I'm a guy and don't mind, but ladies don't appreciate men that can not aim with the toilet seat down. A wall or forest (whatevers easier) to seperate the patio from the traffic going by. I wonder if zoning would approve the forest. Some recycling sorting would be nice too.

og37_hGhjmDjkI1NukbEsQ.text: I like MadHouse, but this actually isn't a review at all--I just wanted to say that when I try to access MadHouse's website, I ALWAYS get a trojan warning from my browser. I think the site is infected. I hope the owners see this!

edAiS3_nFIBjn6ghAkOD-w.text: Friendly crew. Pet friendly. Best blended drinks ever. Food food. Yummy desserts! It's about the same price as Starbucks, but it most definitely worth it. They also offer to smoke hookah for very cheap. The vibe is great. Love going here. Always leave happy and satisfied! Mmm love coffee :)

hrzqvH3Sd3OFIGMTcJDT0Q.text: The best cappucino in the city is here! If you are looking for beautiful, arromatic, and fulfilling espresso, go to MadHouse Coffee. My favorite pastry is the Almond Crossaint. Service is second to none, and the atmosphere is relaxing. By far the best Coffehouse in Las Vegas!

u-LUuNPXkWC56VjpXJpvYw.text: I love the Madhouse. If I know I need to chill out for a bit and get some work done or meet with some friends, I always go here. Not only is the staff friendly, but the owner is extremely friendly as well. You feel like you are wanted there and not just money in the bank. I will be back again and again.

A-oYo0m5oI1dFureHu_JSw.text: First of all, wow. That is the first word that popped into my head when I saw there was a 24-hour coffee shop a mile from my house. That small "wow" soon turned into a caps-locked, bolded, underscored "WOW!!!" after I actually got there. When I got there the first thing that caught my affection was the atmosphere. They had some light alternative rock playing (Goo Goo Dolls to be specific..) which I really enjoy. Even at this very moment that have some light vocal jazz playing, both are great choices to just come in, chill, and sip on a delicious drink. There is ample seating to accommodate everyone for the most part, even when it was really busy I had a seat at the window.  I didn't even make it to the menu before noticing the desert counter. Homemade French macaroons, muffins, tiramisu, croissants, plenty of delicious choices to satisfy anyones' tastes. Also any bakery that can appreciate the value of Nutella in deserts is boss, so kudos for the Nutellamisu! Very creative! They also have a few bagels too, and some branded products available for purchase.  Where do I even begin with the drinks? Well for starters they have a larger, more inventive selection than ANY other coffee shop I have seen, especially dumpy corporate chain stores like Starbucks and Coffee Bean. Iced coffee is my usual poison, and they do it deliciously. They have some iced teas, blended drinks, everything you can imagine! The Japanese Matcha Green Tea is a tad pricey, but done beautifully. Definitely worth it in my book.  I have only tried one sandwich, and I am unable to tear myself away from it to try anything else, the Chicken Parmigiana is too good to be True! I can only imagine the other sandwiches are just as good, this one just hits all of the right spots! Fresh ingredients and a real homemade feel make the food what it is.  There are a few downfalls, but they are just personal preferences so I cant take off any points, but I feel they are worth a mention:  1) No iced coffee/tea refills on same day, same stay visits. Iced coffee and tea are pretty cheap, and I enjoy sitting here all day sipping on some, and it is kind of a drag to have to pay full price each time I want to get some more. Maybe a half off discount for same day visits? I would be more tempted to spend the extra cash on a treat for myself anyways, so it isn't like the profit wouldn't be there.  2) All-day internet restrictions. I understand the space crunch during peak hours, but the time I tend to come there isn't anyone ever here. Most of the time I am not sitting on the internet anyways, I am working on something on my laptop. My one hour card I get usually merits me about 5 minutes of use total during this time. Again, not a big deal.   3) Music volume, as some other people have said. I like a little ambiance, turn it down maybe just a little? It just seems a tad too loud during the day, but again, this is just me. I don't mind just throwing in my own headphones and continuing to work away!  Other than those three things, the staff is amazing, atmosphere is top-notch, and product is absolutely delicious. I will be moving in a week or so, and I couldn't be more sad to not be living a mile from this place. I will be sure to come back and visit and bring friends as much as I can! Keep up the good work guys! :)  To anyone who reviewed this place at 3 stars or less, pull the stick out of your ass, you'll never find another place this amazing in Las Vegas, or all of Nevada for that matter.

Kv5qnpOQggwIaVWElEw5Ow.text: This is my go to spot.  Great coffee and good food. I love to go here to catch up on work at night.  It's the only 24 hour/late night coffee house near Summerlin.  Only gripe is it's small, usually busy and can be hard to find a table to get some work done.  I guess that is a good problem to have!

nEGwjV3p8lPQ8WLgkYHvvw.text: I absolutely love this coffeehouse. I'm lucky to live so close! They are open 24 hours which is awesome. I loooove the egg, bacon & cheddar on a croissant, are you kidding me? NOM! To die for. Tip the ladies well, they are adorable & hard working!

9k5eMnTvMdIHlxwjfcWbpA.text: This is my first review so please bare with my inexperience.   My 5 star rating comes from multiple factors: service, taste, environment, hours, and convenience.  Service is talkative, quick, and precise. All the staff are willing to make weird concoctions I dream up of. For example, hot chocolate over ice with a caramel topping bottomed cup (greatest invention since I'm extremely sensitive to caffeine and usually show up here at 3am). Marco the manager always talks to customers, asking for opinions, and looking for ways to make the place a little more comfortable.  The taste of the coffee here is a well balance of savory, bitter, and sweet. Desserts here are made in-house and very fresh. The sandwiches are always great. But what brings me here is the Tiramisu and Nutellamisu, both made in house. Perfect accompaniment to a hot drink in the twilight hours.   I really love the environment here: lounge-ish, calm, hip hop, dance, trance music always playing in the background provides a mildly serene vibe for me. I'm usually here in the wee-hours of the night to study, normal hours are usually crowded so you might have to find your niche in time slots. 24/7 cafe and free wifi with purchase really make this place the perfect package. I'd recommend In The Grind on W. Desert Inn to EVERYONE.

XoTMGZFaQzFuuifuZq6VnA.text: Great service, great location, great atmosphere. I love their salads and green tea. Best of all, they've just began offering organic wheat grass shots. Saves me a trip to Whole Foods and standing in line for the same thing. Excellent all the way around.

8uJlwZin3Fno3_MCEMuBUQ.text: This place is phenomenal for breakfast, however the prices are a little outrageous (even compared to Starbucks). I come here everyday and spend upwards of 300 a month here. Roughly 2 a day more than Starbucks.  Recently I have noticed that the service is starting to fade, but still it is a nice quiet place to get some work done.

iJfKnOqTxLryDWuUWuXY8A.text: Had a groupon for $20 worth of goods at Madhouse.  So 4 of us gals swung by to fuel up for morning shopping.    I got a blended minty mocha creation 1/2 sugar free since they didn't have sugar free mint.  It was quite good.  We also ordered 2 other flavored latte concoctions and 2 pastries.  Grand total $17! Oh man! we couldn't even spend our $20.  I was surprised.    It's very cute inside, but always has been from the previous coffee shop.  We were in and out but happened to bump into a friend while we were there.    It's a hot spot!  I'll definitely go back.  It seems like a nice place to kick back with your reader and some joe.

OtsnQxG4n6iv52lHkN8c5w.text: Been going to It's A Grind for a long time. It's the classic "talk late into the night" spot for me and the homies. Now it's Madhouse, but it's still It's A Grind, minus the taggable bathroom walls and old color scheme. I don't really care for all the street/urban art (fake Banksy in a bathroom?) but it's whatever. Same atmosphere/people, average but enjoyable coffee drink, and place in my heart.

PY4oMvUoik02bqWUjrwV9Q.text: came in on an unusually cold day after work. people were studying, playing chess, enjoying wifi, etc. It was my first time, and I asked what was a popular drink, the barista suggested white mocha. It was delicious :) I'm the kind that avoids starbucks but makes her own coffee at home, but this place is nice! The tiramisu was amazing :) I'm definitely coming back to try the rest of the menu!

2pHt-yYyKKQnh1ymAgxkEw.text: Absolutely, hands down, the best coffee. In addition, the staff is always fabulous.

ndZWtsKVRd6QXBKK442rOw.text: Madhouse is as good as it gets! The delicious drinks, sandwiches, and nutella are well worth the price. The atmosphere is great, staff is awesome--this is the place I go to when I need to be productive. Free wifi with purchase! No coffee shop can compare to Madhouse. LOVE LOVE LOVE.   Also, they are on Groupon Now a lot so you are always guaranteed an amazing drink at a "try me" price.

NB9EhJdGOKhxEmWYYqbaqA.text: I only ever get the red velvet mocha from Madhouse, and I love it. :) I first tried it using a groupon for a free 16 oz. Red velvet mocha. They asked me if I wanted coffee with it, and I said yes. Each time after that I wasn't given the option, which would be nice if I was. But overall, they're very nice.

9rJEV9CuHXAeqViTX6R4ig.text: Earlier this week I went to this coffee shop and I loved it because of the atmosphere the people that go there are very interesting and of many different cultures there is definitely quality behind the products, I got a glance of the ghiradelli box of chocolate and I must say that the sandwiches at least the island of capri is nothing short of legitimate italian taste. The only thing I disliked was the fact that the wifi is limited to 4 hours max with purchase but I asked for more and the barista kindly gave me another access code overall a good business.

3X2J6Hfd7NIWyp9vFFZnYw.text: The only reason i keep coming here is to study and to get the Madhouse Sandwich it is so crisp and fresh I cant get enough.

qDuyTFXgieeQ2Czv2ufa7g.text: I found out about this place because of groupon, but can't stop going back. Great coffee, good prices, and just an over all fun atmosphere. Plus the internet is really quick here.

i1q23kvH2GZpydUzUsBdNw.text: Love their drinks and food. Haven't ordered anything that did not satisfy me. For those coffee lovers, try their Red Velvet or Nutella White Chocolate, either hot or cold blended is great. For US tea drinkers, I love their iced mango green tea. Not as sweet as the ones you get at Spring Mountain. I also love their Mango and Green Tea smoothie. They have great desserts. I remembered ordering a blueberry muffin and after tasting it, ordered a second one for my boyfriend because I didn't wanna share mine. Their french macaroons were great too - bigger than the ones you get in other coffee houses. All their desserts are made-in-house. Their sandwiches are filling, reasonably priced at $5.75, and made in-house too. Not some reheated pre-made sandwich. They have indoor, outdoor, and drive-thru. Open 24 hours and has free wi-fi. They also have hookah - outdoors only and they have doggie treats and bowl for your four-legged best friend - outdoors only too. What else can you ask for?

FopR_MaekYJCGDbbJDrZMg.text: Mon amour Madhouse Coffee!!!  I never thought I would experience the taste of an authentic French Croissant again after eating one every day when living in Paris.  And then one day I stumbled into this coffee shop and was transported back in time.  Since that first magical encounter they impressed me with their Italian panini and lately with their figure friendly panna cotta.  The atmosphere is nice, the staff is friendly and the coffee is great.  I love to bring my golden retriever and relax 24/7.  Keep up the good job!!!!!

TCORns0udAmMVxPOnq10Tw.text: This place is just too cool for where it's located!!!!!   I love it here!  The baristas are friendly and outgoing.  Always asking for details about how you like  your coffee!  The Mad Max here is a fantastic blended Coffee!

6-_R0QBDxvT_bVCJuF9ZUg.text: tthis is an edit to my original review..........usually first impressions set the mood and likely hood of a client or customer returning,  second chances are rarely given in life, but i gave madhouse coffe house a second chance, and this time was great. the customer service was great, the coffee tasted great!!!! i had the white mocha hot. and a chocolate crossant the coffee was Not bitter and not too sweet just the way i like it. the music was good, over all i am very happy and will continue to visit them. just realized today that they were open 24 hours, will have to check it out some time in the evening. :)

zU6ShrY8kHwCYD1okxYEvA.text: This is one of the greatest place to wind down after a long night because it's the only coffee shop I know off from the strip that's open 24hrs.  I've held many great conversations here with a good friend, good ambience, good crowd, and friendly bartista. Great place to study as well if you can find room to sit inside.

mgv5GTn4usJTownRAjAVzA.text: I go to this location a lot, I recently made my boyfriend a fan of this coffee place after his diet. I love the fact it's open 24 hrs. Anytime that I do go, their service is always great, the barista's are always friendly, they advertise their new drinks, but there's never any pressure. The weekends are the busiest, and a hangout spot for the younger crowds. Sometimes you can see kids rock out their acoustic guitars. I must say I love any of their blended drinks, they blend it very well. They also offer great pastries :)

FXNxoEiQiaLShDz0MeWE4Q.text: I went to the drive up and ordered a dirty frozen frap, Iced Chai and their very own Apricot Croissant. Everything really tasty!!.......They have a wide selection of lunch and breakfast options too. My next to try will be The Gobbler which is something similar to a Bobbi. Anyway if you're in the area and in need of great Coffee and something delicious and quick to eat this is the place to come. This place is a bakery too can't ask for anything more from a coffee to go place.  My first choice over Einstein and Starbucks.

sT81XP78Mk6xNoN8yiTDvg.text: This is a cute little coffee shop thats open 24 hours which is really nice. My favorite is their nutella white mocha, HOWEVER, several times Ive ordered through their drive through in a hurry, and when I got the nutella white mocha there was double the amount of syrup. I dont know if someone started making it and put syrup in, and then another person finished it and put syrup again? But I thought it was a 1 time fluke and its happened 3 times now. If I wasnt in a hurry I would have gone inside to tell them. Other than that its a great place!

UeWwIFPtyzB7JwxRKaYyCQ.text: I have been to this coffee shop several times.  It is one of the few alternatives to the behemoth on every corner with a line of SUV's stretching to the moon.  The staff is friendly, and accommodating.  I love to patronize local coffee shops, but often without the corporate training program what you get are a couple of teenage employees more interested in talking about the latest MTV reality show than making your coffee.  That is not the case here.  They are quick and professional.  This morning the cashier was straightening some product, and apologized for making me wait.  They always make my drink correctly, and bring it to me rather than calling my name to pick it up at the counter.  I don't come here often enough to be a regular so I assume they do this for everybody.  The radio is at a normal level, and typically tuned to a non-offensive jazz station.  Again I have been to independents where the employees are apt to have something on the radio that makes me want to leave ASAP.  Obviously management at this place has a clue.  They also carry cigarettes.  While I don't smoke, and find it disgusting I think it is awesome that they carry something that includes everybody.  Where I grew up all independent coffee house carried cigarettes.  This is a great bonus, and adds to the authenticity of the place.  I don't live close by, but I do go out of my way to be her.  I almost forgot to mention the product.  It is far superior to what you would get at the corporate concept places.  They have numerous dairy substitutes as well rather than just nasty soy milk.  This is a huge bonus.  I recommend this place all the time.

xrDswR85NxwFpCEZ8JfsOg.text: I went here yesterday morning! I got the groupon a couple of months ago and was dying to try it! One word...AMAZING! Great coffee....great homemade muffin! This could be my new spot!! Can't wait to go back and get some studying done! :)

9J6Cq2HGWTnyywSHEMTQBg.text: Good coffee and friendly atmosphere. Place is way too small, thou. I really prefer the one at fort apache. Ordered a "road warrior" iced blended coffee and a banana nut muffin. Coffee was very good, pastry was OK. All fine for a Sunday afternoon and a good magazine. One thing I hated from this place was the amount freakin flies. Really annoying. Overall, its a fine place.

194eL6X2bYpRsJ0-WDkBPA.text: I have been going to Mad House since it opened. I usually hit it 4 nights a week before work. The coffee far surpasses anything I have ever tasted. The variety is second to none. The food is always good. I have truly NEVER sampled anything I have not enjoyed. The staff is diverse. Always a pleasure to deal with and very personable. The owner always has time for a little conversation between making sure everything is up to par. Great place , great staff. You will see some reviews by people who are just negative people and do not get the concept of business. It is a great place to relax and enjoy eats and drinks with friends. Some ignorant people however believe it is acceptable to spend 3 dollars on a drink and take up space for multiple hours, limiting space for other patrons to purchase, causing some to go elsewhere. How can a great place stay opened with those types frequenting an establishment? Then again no one ever said the world was filled with intelligent people. My overall review is this is a must stop by for those looking for something that separates itself from the corporate norm of coffee houses. A True 5 star! Thank you Marco for bring a truly unique place to Vegas!

iKhPX43ZEtcrq99JlXzWSw.text: This is a great local coffeeshop that provides a great atmosphere to hang out at any time of the day. They are one of the few in Vegas that are open 24 hours and are always busy no matter the time. The staff is always friendly and when i don't know what to order, I'll usually just ask the barista to recommend something and I i haven't been disappointed yet. I love introducing people to this place!

YM_NF2eHHHwouc56RkRsOA.text: This place had always been a coffee shop, but has a new name, been changed now for a while, but just came in to check it out.  One of the few "treats" my husband enjoys during our low carb dieting days, (which is often), he'll get a coffee.  I, myself have never cared for coffee, but I do love tea, so he got his coffee and I got a tea.  It was just a bit of chill in the air, especially since the sun had set, but none the less we brought our drinks out to sit in the patio area.  It was a very nice experience, very relaxing for the both of us.  There is free Wi-fi and plenty of business, this particular location is open 24hours and has a drive through.

4Xf6Wr9bPcb515Rcw2wQdw.text: I will drive past several coffee stores and shops to get their iced chai. I order it with coconut milk at least once weekly. I love their large sizes and good prices. It's a convenient location too.

db1xREhpvpXGpOYTyWS48Q.text: First and last time stepping foot inside Madhouse tonight. After meeting friends and sitting for about 10 minutes, a man with glasses who described himself as the owner asks my friends if they are ready to order. No menu was given, no greeting or any form of hospitality. They decided they fight wan to order right then, and although I happened to be waiting for a menu or options, he decided to ask us all to leave. Stating he has "a business to run"while having plenty of open seating around us was one of the worst experiences I have ever had. Extremely unprofessional, rude, and downright nasty business etiquette.

fUfX1YIFNVIr8naQqMboRQ.text: This place is pretty great. The atmosphere is that of something one would see at Life is Beautiful, with pieces of Recycled Propaganda art hanging everywhere (most available for purchase), and a very crowded but cozy nature. I purchased an Earl Grey tea with honey, nothing very special, and it was good, as Earl Grey would be. This place looks and feels much better than a Starbucks, and for both the experience of the place and the options of food (they have coffee, tea, and food like sandwiches and salads!) that they provide, I would pick this over Starbucks any day. Definitely will be coming back.

14u-SLH9uClwRPTPdgqNig.text: Not sure what to make of this place. I decided to head to MadHouse last night after getting crappy information from Sambalatte that they were open until 10pm (Yelp had the right info, stating they close at 8pm on Sun/Mon/Tue).  For some strange reason, I ordered a medium Monkey Mocha. It's basically mocha with banana and peanut butter. Extremely sweet, but that was to be expected. The peanut butter dominated the drink's flavor. Their medium size is 24oz - the same as the oddly named "venti" at Star$. Their large is 32oz; that's one whole ounce more than the also oddly named "trenta" at Star$!  Anyway, the place has a cool vibe. For 9pm on a Monday night, it was full of people, both inside and outside. Many of the patrons were on their laptops taking advantage of the free wi-fi. I'd probably return simply for the fact that they are open 24 hours and it's a good place to have a nice conversation. It's also closer to my place than Sambalatte.  I do like me some tiramisu and they have an interesting variation on it - Nutellamisu. Hmm. Maybe I should try making that.

gBZVxnCpBfNyRND1q0FWdw.text: The best place to get your caffeine is right here.  They have a great menu but the food looks so good that I don't know if I should eat it or ask it out, and they get your order to you pretty fast too!

AQc98Ffrdrpb6gFDu-eulA.text: I love this coffee shop so much!!! They're open 24 hours, super reliable and they let you rent hookahs so you can just chill outside drinking your coffee and smoking hookah with friends! It's only like $17.95 for the hookah. And they have quite a variety of coffee and drinks. My FAV here is the mad cow (hazelnut latte) or the blended monkey drink I don't really remember the name but it was SO GOOD OMG like I wanted to buy another after I finished it LOL but they do offer almond milk alternatives or soy or just regular . They also have a bunch Of sandwiches you can order to eat if you're Hungry or even macaroons or Nutella tiramisu as desserts but this place has a variety of stuff and there's tons of places to sit so you don't have to worry about standing to drink your coffee and that's what I love about this place the most besides how friendly all the staff always are so I'd definitely recommend. This is always my go to place if i ever crave sweets in the middle of the night

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate croissant and almond croissant
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SO FREAKING GOOD MONKEY MOCHA
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mad cow coffee Nutella misu and macaroons

4kVs9AE2um6rX6qeL0CLoQ.text: Discovered this place off yelp and I'm glad I had the chance to try it out today! I've read so many reviews about the red velvet mocha so I decided to give it a try. It did not disappoint me :)!  I love the atmosphere here. It's chill and inviting. It's definitely going to be my new study place.   The staff were friendly too! I felt very welcomed by the cashier and didn't feel hurried to order since I was a newbie.  I'm definitely going to come back here to try out their sandwiches which smelled amazing btw!

rWDL9TFRej0JXKTztY0ftA.text: I've been coming here since before the name change and have always liked the atmosphere, coffee, and staff but have stopped coming here frequently because they have taken away what makes all independent coffee shops great, free wifi.   Wifi is made available only to paying customers (understandable), but on an incremental system. Spend $4-$7 and get 1 hour.   Value has been shifted from the customer to the customer's wallet and has made madhouse more of a "get in and get out" coffee shop than a "come enjoy a drink and get some work done" shop.  Madhouse has lost much of its appeal and I have switched to nearby competitors, independent and corporate, who offer a relaxed atmosphere, fair coffee, and unlimited wifi.

e6N-FbFi2QD0uN1qD9Y83Q.text: The Madhouse Coffee place has certainly keep things original, when it comes to the names of their speciality drinks. The mad cow latte and the red velvet mocha are the ones to definitely try; if you don't want something out of the ordinary. When it comes to their sandwiches I would recommend the innocent bystander (turkey, chipotle mayo, lettuce, melted mozzarella) and the madhouse which is similar but, instead of turkey it has chicken breast and mushrooms in it. The drive thru service is so-so but, they do seem to get very busy even at nights. It's a pretty cool place to get a quick grab to eat or to just chill and hang out with friends.

ggYXJGX_UgPL61qvmQwpYg.text: Most annoying that you can't have wi-fi access like every other coffee shop ...$8.31 for a drink and you have to jump through hoops to connect ....as I'm heading to Starbucks to use their's

wMAateMkG-e7QxHN3qSYTQ.text: My husband and I were invited by friends back in November 2012. At first we really enjoyed it, then started noticing unprofessional attitude by the owner, such as alcohol on the breath, and shouting at the staff in front of patrons.   The owner's claims that former patrons just "hung out" without purchasing anything is erroneous and inflammatory; furthermore, these patrons are personally responsible for bringing in many new customers.  I fully expect to have the owner remove this negative review; that is his prerogative. However, just know this...word gets around Marco.

1dHdXslp79jfCdy3-ZwdpQ.text: Great drink selection!! Nice company and feel to the coffee shop! Highly recommend! Always packed when I visit!

dTz6_a9nqio2km-eXuKpcw.text: For the most part no matter what you order, be it food or their various coffee items, it is going to be tasty and satisfying. However, be prepared for pretty high prices.  For example, today I ordered the Ron Jeremy Sandwich, and a medium Michael Jackson. Based off those names you get the vibe for this joint. It was great, sandwich was delicious and filling, coffee was rich and delicious. What was not so great was those two items together cost 13$ and some change. A little on the expensive side if you ask me.   However, if you are looking for a great cup of coffee or a delicious sandwich, and do not mind the prices, I highly recommend this groovy joint.   Have not had an baked goods yet, but these also look delicious!

yae4KZ2D1eKewpX2w1VmGw.text: Pretty good cup o' joe and scrumptious looking pastries (sadly, I didn't partake).  The vibe is funky and artsy and cool; I felt like a hipster upon entering!  Nice folks and a comfy atmosphere are highly appreciated by this gal.  Free wifi is also a plus but like others have noted, the wifi is limited to a few hours' worth of surfing the internetz.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front counter

6Tz-2fpLdHuCInxLGvGBMQ.text: Love this place, good food, coffee and a great atmosphere! Eclectic art and very interesting cross-section of clientele. Definitely one of the top coffee houses in Vegas.

MpAk0qL4QnCxNt8W99wIWw.text: I stopped in today to use my Groupon and got a Red Velvet  Mocha.  There is no coffee flavor in the drink, but it is quite tasty.  The staff was very friendly and brought my drink to the table where I was trying to plan my next move in a game of Words With Friends.  I took a quick look at the pastries.  WOW!  I'm certain the Nuttelamisu hypnotized me into coming back in the near future to give it a try.    I will be back although this is a bit out of my neighborhood.  It is, however, on the way to Las Vegas Little Theatre, so maybe I have a new place to pick up a drink to take to the show!

Fb85RD6h59n_92tBz-PL1w.text: From the pictures online I thought this place would be a bit bigger inside. I was kind of disappointed by the lack of seating. I ordered a red velvet drink and was disappointed at how basic it tasted. Starbucks provides better tasting drinks for actually a cheaper price. The reason I came here was to study and do HW and to switch it up since I usually go to Starbucks or Coffee Bean to do my studies. SO, I go to do my hw on my laptop and the wifi password they told me wasn't working. I tried about 20 times doing capital letters lowercase etc., but it just wasn't connecting. I asked the guy up front if the wifi was working and he kind of gave me attitude and was like "uhh it should be working?!!" I told him the password wasn't working both on my laptop and on my phone and so he went to the back to check if the wifi was on and it was. He basically told me "sucks to suck" and there was nothing he could do for me to get the wifi working for my devices. He didn't even try to make sure everything was connected right on his end. So I drove all the way across town bought a 7 dollar drink, tipped them, and couldn't even do any of my homework and ended up going to Starbucks and spending more money buying drinks so that I could use their wifi.

opq7x6GKTKAAf5YcD_PWgw.text: The staff was nice but the chai latte I ordered was very bland. It was definitely the worst I've ever had. I should've just ordered a glass of milk.

xYkHBu0UHsjAyNuuNg9Xpg.text: This place 10/10. Good covfefe. Good atmosphere. Great workers. Good Devin. Great hookah because of Devin. Devin's going to Hawaii today so it's kinda sad but this was my first visit here and my friends and I had the best hookah experience ever. It was really harsh at first and then Devin took care of it and it was probably the best try my friends ever had. Good luck in Hawaii, my dude.

tC1OsK2pgs1L53dbprFAUg.text: Great vibe, friendly staff, overall good experience. There are seats inside and outside. There is also WiFi! I had the green tea latte with a sandwich. The time in which my food and drink came was reasonable. The price for the food I bought made it a good value. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Tea Latte

p9qaWxxOAyP9hyh4FEmkuA.text: Drinks are great and while the prices are a little on the high side they're not unreasonable.   Would give this place 4 1/2 stars rounded up to 5 but the wifi has been down the last two times I've been here. Guys, half the time people go to coffee shops to work/do homework and if the wifis down that makes the whole trip a waste.  Its crazy to have a coffee shop nowadays w spotty wifi. Please get this sorted out!

IyoTYif7TVnJL-gChJNU2Q.text: I can't believe I've been living in the neighborhood for the past 2 years and I've never been to this place till today. What a shame! Got myself The Rabbit Habbit and passion fruit tea to go. So delicious, much flavor, such treat, wow! Will definitely be back (if not even later in the day). Keep up the good work

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Passion fruit tea
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not very presentable photo from my side, but trust me when I say I&#39;ll knock your socks off!

MqfgbyJ5UyjaYE4fRxlBaA.text: The atmosphere of the place allows for the high prices.  Drinks- 5 stars. They have fantastic frozen drinks and great speciality drinks. I enjoy them. The monkey mocha is my favorite.  Prices- about 50% more than Starbucks or another chain.  Food- 4 stars. Sandwiches and other cafe food. Real quick but very good. Portions are relatively small but then again it's a cafe.  Atmosphere- 5 stars plus. It's great with local art work and other stuff. One of a kind and open 24/7.  Staff- average. They are quick and work hard but do not go out of their way to speak with guests.   I've been coming here for about 4 years now. The place is a great place to do homework or meet up with friends.

CoiRYHbkoS_sg6PGiznqDg.text: ATTENTION ALL!!! DO NOT GO TO THE MADHOUSE COFFEE HOUSE ON DESSERT INN AND DURANGO. THE OWNER IS A GREEDY PIG! I went there today to order some food and an ice tea and I clearly said NO CHEESE OR MAYO on my sandwich! So i get to the drive through pay $14 for the order and of course when I got the sandwich there is loads of Cheese and mayo on it! I asked the owner who was in the drive through to replace my order for an equal item and he prepared what I asked for then he comes to the window and asks me to pay more money after he got my first order wrong! I said NOT for what you just put me through! Further the disgusting owner did not tell me it was more money before he prepared it to give to me! Then I asked for my money back and he refused to refund me or to replace the food item which I already gave back to him. I basically had nothing and he stole the amount of money that I paid him for my order! This man is a PIG! He was also harassing me in the drive through verbally when I told him I was calling the police! I am also going to press charges against this sick man for harassment with the intent to defraud a customer and steel money and not deliver a product in exchange! After I called the police and left the drive through, I hit a curb and ruined my wheel on my car because I was so angry and distraught! Not only will I go after him for the intent to defraud, verbal harassment but also for duress! This Owner will be penalized and I will make sure of it!

paQzRu-1_MrioLS9-qYH5Q.text: We ordered two drinks and two sandwiches. I really like that they offer Almond Milk, but dislike that it is an additional $1 extra. (That is outrageous!)  I ordered the Green Card (Turkey, guacamole & minus the bacon for me), and the bf ordered The Very Charming Pig (Ham, Swiss, Cream Cheese and Bacon) I ordered mine with no bread and he ordered his on Focaccia. His Focaccia had an upcharge vs the ciabatta, which would have probably been fine, if it wasn't for mine being the same price as normal without either bread. I get a little frustrated at these restaurants up charging for every thing, just because they know people prefer it.   I'm sure we'll be back to try it again, but probably just the coffee side. Neither of us was overly enthusiastic about the food.   Although I do like that they are open 24/7. I even noticed they were open on Christmas. Although I felt bad for the girl holding a sign out to inform everyone they were open Christmas morning.

wSvRMgYwQvCNCeIPrQ-5_A.text: Tried this coffee place and lady cashier who helped us wasn't very friendly. No smile and she had a very annoyed demeanor. Anyways, I tried the grass hopper mocha. It was really good. Looks like they have a good selection of sweets. I'll try their pastries next time. Hopefully the cashier will be much friendlier. Seems like it's also a very nice place to just hang out or do your school stuff. Looks like there are outlets everywhere for laptops and phones.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grass Hopper

pQ--1VzpLFQ6A7VUQoH7tg.text: I love Madhouse for its amazing Matcha green tea lattes (and frequently drive out of my way to buy one)! After nearly 7 years in Vegas, this remains my favorite coffee spot.

d62IpNjRJhVWR-x80nuUsw.text: Love the Cake Batter and Nutella blended varieties!! So yummy. And the chocolate chip cookies, warmed. They're the best in town. My partner always loves when I pick him up one on the way home.

_y4_cCveloSW3Hm95_hbbQ.text: this spot is usually one of my bf and i's favorites. Last night they were fairly busy which i totally understand and i didn't mind the 20-25 minute wait either. We even pulled around for a cop who only ordered one drink lol. We ordered 2 sandwiches which were great and also a vegan sweet potato. It comes with a sauce that's usually the best part, but i was really disappointed when i opened it to see there was no sauce, just a dry sweet potato that they threw tomatoes on lol. I never like pointing stuff like this out and i know they work really hard, I just wish they would've at least said something like they were out of the sauce instead of having us wait 20 minutes in the drive thru for a dry, not even seasoned with salt or pepper potato :/

X3ydhZuzzeiy-psMrTaoNQ.text: We deeply love this place! Best Coffee, amazing service, delicious desserts and feels like ITALY!

PoECv8d-hEj2hfBVIdAlcg.text: Hot chocolate is made with real milk so no packaged powder con agua aqui.   This was my first time here since the new ownership and they're a lot better compared to the previous occupants... Even the interior seems a lot more welcoming.   This is the kind of coffee shop that you'd find me in if I was still in San Diego. Couches, coffee tables, outdoor seating and a restroom you're actually allowed to use lol.   The staff is friendly and helpful. Only thing we weren't big fans of was the macron we ordered... It was salty. Though for its size and price point it was awesome, unfortunately we didn't say the same thing when it entered our mouths.

q5gljOP_dbVH8SYqAWRlTQ.text: Went thru their drive through late night, it takes time to go thru. Don't be in a hurry it's a bit of what here over 6 min wait I ordered the cold coffee with hazelnut - It was awful  Very sweet n just not right  I probably not be back unless it's a die hard coffee rush needed

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drive thru window

ANzWdn-1NQ0T0HdpJu0Alw.text: It was my first time here and I loved it! The people are so nice and the atmosphere is so cozy. I had the caramel macchiato and it was delicious, definitely better than Starbucks. I will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m2FyE0XxMkzt70L2ykx49A.text: Enjoyed the music not too loud easy listening, great study atmosphere, and wonderful interior designs to admire. I enjoyed being able to hangout and play catch up with some old friends.

Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh coconut with soy and a house blend of hookah

eKGbG9KfeXTGPnB6V0N6Pg.text: UPD. Internet goes down every half an hour for 5 minutes. So don't expect to come and study/work here.  Love this place - probably the best in the area. It has a friendly staff, warm atmosphere (physically warm), incredible coffee, fun music and a very eclectic crowd! On top of that 24/7 makes it my ever favourite place

2nLea0Gv7Bpo7gIkjcJTnw.text: I was very disappointed with their service. The only reason I gave 3 stars is because their coffee is not bad and their pastries are amazing.  I went in a couple of months ago and they weren't very friendly but the other day I had a bad experience. The guy taking our order(red head) didn't offer a smile or anything and was rushing us to finish. We ordered our things and most of it came out within ten minutes. Five minutes after they arrived I went up to ask for our croissant and bread pudding and one of the workers apologetically said he'd get it. As he walked behind the counter, the guy who'd taken our order says, "it's already being warmed up!!!!" 1. He saw me waiting there to ask and avoided me so 2. Why didn't he help me? 5 minutes later(it's already been 20 minutes since we've ordered and half my coffee is gone) I go up and ask if we can have our stuff. He says, "it's already warmed up we've just been busy!!!" He proceeds to roll his eyes, slam things around while looking for the croissant then hands it to me with a, "here you go!"   I was appalled at his actions and upset that we spent our money there for such horrible service and even more upset we'd tipped them $4.   I will never go to Mad House again.   PS: this is the first bad review I've ever written

CzwjiDx7s6uasBR9xjh9IA.text: Don't let the 15 minutes from the Strip stop you from experiencing this awesome local coffee shop!..From the time we walked in to the time we walked out I was very impressed..Greeted immediately and when ordering the staff was very knowledgeable about coffee and all their drinks..The decor was very cool plastered with a local art from recycle propaganda!..Great stop while in Vegas!!

WJ6ATedDEnYhB9ru84u5Ww.text: Great drinks, well organized shop, with speedy sevice. Ordered the green tea iced tasted great.  What else could you want.

Qbcz56YCQBVR92UHPx5X6w.text: This place is great! great coffee just a good place to be in general big benefit is 24hours so that helps a lot being a college student. Great vibe

QRNfaYjyEM0G7YhM6pLFYg.text: Great place to have coffee and conversation with friend , food looks good  too.  Good place to study

YzKQ2Ge_GRwcvy600EY10w.text: It's a nice place but my iced coffee tasted a little weak.  I'd go back when I'm in a rush.

kLwKtDudDNPdJNYOYlBMlA.text: Very nice place for late coffee. Good music, nice service and most important 24 hour busyness . Good spot to hangout with friends

KTYdaunx4YaRhjsmS5OCzg.text: Coffee is very overpriced for what you get. I've worked in coffee shops before, and while the ambiance is great and it's 24 hrs, you're not getting anything that tastes -great-. Everything was par.

yy02MltsJqJlGygic01HmQ.text: This place is always great. I normally hit the drive through, but decided to come in and get some things done today. The coffee is great, the breakfast sammiches are delicious and the wifi is fast.  Keep in mind, they only have 2 drink sizes. Huge and Freaking Huge! So come thirsty.

hRhdTE5CYU1LJUcGGX32_w.text: One of the coolest 24 hour cafes. Enjoy a monkey mocha while appreciating the funky art and chatting with the most interesting people. Cool, chill, and delicious.

V9UviUVjqLgNkJVY2MTFsg.text: Favorite place to do homework!  The whole crew is super nice. Andrew is amazing! I pulled an all nighter and he was just so kind, and caring.  He provides great costumer service and he is fun to talk to. Also, he knows what's good at madhouse,  he makes the best vanilla latte!  :)

tuEKWigxAR4kW24UBFQtHg.text: Will be always visiting. Nice place great stuff and friendly employees(especially the new girl they have at the cash register).The owner Marco very profesional and doing a great job on servising customers.

0sk8zHdMBajI9ARLeBajSw.text: Had one of the worst Cannoli's I've had to date. The chocolate chip cookie was alright though

tk3DDyTSTWJd9DJFMA48yQ.text: I like this place more than Starbucks or Sambalatte. There's good eats, drinks, & even hookah. Tuna sandwich is a go, as well as their green tea drinks. Hookah is just okay, but don't let it prevent you from trying a fresh menu item from them! They're always really friendly.

MFvp2pvrgDerPK7Uvv94Tw.text: I ordered the caffe mocha. It was so yummy and chocolate-y. Last time I ordered the Napoleon and it was the best I had so far! So order it if you get the chance! :)

Qc71Y0s3VbiNxHuJyULmbw.text: Ring ring, ring ring...  me - "Hello, I was wondering if you have a menu online?"  employee - "Let me find out... Yes we do.  It's -------.com" me - "thanks. " Click. Ring ring, ring ring... me - "the website given to me says the store is in Brisbane, California and I wanted to know what you have to eat and drink." employee - "Well, you can always come here as we have menus." me - "Okay, I'll just figure this out."  At this point, I was thinking about one of my biggest pet peeves, to be given the run around and not given the correct information to get what I want about their business.  So, I thought dammit!  One Star already.  I sucked everything up and just drove to their cafe.  I picked up the menu and looked around.  The employee asked if I called earlier and I said yes.  He apologized that he gave me the wrong website.  I could've been a douche and kept digging in to him but decided not to.  Luckily, I didn't because he and all his colleagues were all very kind and easy going, not just with me but with other patrons.  I ordered a white chocolate mocha frappaccino and boy was it what I needed on a hot day like Friday.  My boss ordered the Madhouse sandwich but turned it in to a wrap.  That's another awesome thing is that they will make what you want and how you want it.  That, I thought, was reason enough to come back again.  My boss really liked the wrap and asked how much it all cost.  She said it all tasted expensive, which is a good thing.  Majority of the time expensive means yumm-o!

0vmnGhGXhAj_sMPY1aR_PA.text: I enjoyed it the first time I went because it was late and it's open 24 hours, but after a couple of more visits I've decided it's not the spot for me. The drinks and food are so-so and overpriced. But I'm really disappointed with their wi-fi policy. They're not only forcing people to buy something in order to get the password, but you have to buy every hour and a half to keep using it. That's ridiculous and inconvenient. Plus the furniture could use some upkeep, especially the leather couches/benches.

gGqwP3EHNNzCGoj0sdlsSA.text: Madhouse reminds me of home ! Sacramento, Ca, although it's located in the desert of Las Vegas You will forget that it's not in a small town filled with relaxed laid back people. The coffee,tea, food and service is incredibly good!

I appreciate the milk alternatives: Almond, soy, hemp, and coconut - thank you! yr_IY4uQ6F0Hqdr3If-drA.text: Not much room but it is a cute little coffee shop. Menu doesn't have much variety. But i do love the Madhouse sandwich on focaccia along with their blended drinks & tropical tea. Best part is, it's open 24hrs!

tfH5Mh6OnX4avz8lhnhQiQ.text: This place is a dream come True! A seriously cute neighborhood coffee shop that is open 24 hours and offers unique and incredible coffee, drinks, food and bakery goods - enough said!   I ordered the iced coconut latte (which is not even on the menu), but the cashier and the barista were very friendly and more than happy to oblige.  Love at first sip! It was super icy, cold, and deep in flavor! Delicious hint of decadent coconut, just the right amount of creamy milk, and the perfect amount of expresso. It wasn't too sweet - it was refreshing and perfect. The caffeine packed a punch and I was jumping off the walls in a good way!  I was extremely happy with my drink. I had to get up and compliment and thank my barista multiple times before we left. She mentioned that she added a few dashes of mocha in it as well, so that I can tell the barista how to make it the next time I come in. I'm so in love with this drink!   The Japanese matcha green tea smoothie is also too legit to quit. I can agree with the other yelpers when they say it's pricey ($6 small/ $9 large) but man, is it sweet, icy cold and addicting. The matcha flavor is bold and it's right up there with Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf's (CBTL) green tea ice blended drink. They both taste like rich, creamy and dreamy matcha ice cream. It's about $3 cheaper at CBTL, but still, whichever is closer is the winner in my opinion. Though, Madhouse is open 24/7 so it's great for after hour cravings.   We also ordered a matcha white chocolate macaroon. It was huge, sweet and yummy. I didn't really taste the matcha, but the white chocolate flavor came through strong.  Thank you Madhouse for being wonderful and a diamond in the rough.  Super PRO TIP: They have Affogato! Made with supremely rich and luscious Intelligentsia Expresso - we had it with  Sugar Glider Intelligentsia Expresso which is a once a year kind of deal and it is exquisite. Try it!

My favorite is the one with peanut butter, banana, and chocolate. Their drinks can be on the pricey side, however. Also, the service can be spotty, depending on the day. I'm hoping to try the Impossible Burger soon. I've tried the sandwhiches and like the BLT best. Overall, I do recommend this place to friends and tourists. It's awesome that it's open 24 hours.

h9QB-pX51ZcF8HO3Ov2oUg.text: Came here to study with my friends. The music is super loud which was something we didn't really enjoy. It's a very small place so if you plan to study with more than 3 people you should either be there early or sit outside.   They do have a drive thru so be aware of your order. We ordered a green tea and it took almost one hour to even get it. We had to ask a couple of the workers about it since we had already been seated for quite sometime.   To get the wifi you need to make a purchase. Which we all did, but the downside to this is it only lasts two hours. With so many rules plus the forgetting of the green tea and the kid music, I don't recommend this coffee shop to come and study to if you're studying for an important exam or with a big group of people.

5DOc6PMLvn4MZgZG5SGJ9Q.text: First impression of this place was NOT my style. This is a place for hipsters in my opinion.  However, the staff was friendly and the place was clean-ish. I took my grandma there for lunch.  She ordered a Mango Smoothie and a vegetarian burger. I ordered the BLT and a vanilla blended drink.  When I got to the table I was taken back that it was almost $50!!!!! For a coffee shop?!?!?! I thought that was insane. They didn't give me a receipt so i went back up to ask for a receipt. They dont print them, so i opted for a texted receipt. I was charged for an extra drink. What seemed to be the owner (who took our order) apologized and had someone else fix the mistake. He blamed it on the staff saying that they did it. You could tell the rest of the staff was annoyed with him. I'm sure if I worked there I would be annoyed with him as well (you'll understand why further on in the review) Just apologize and fix the problem, dont blame your staff or point fingers. That's just bad for business.  My grandma got her burger first and then about five minutes later I got my BLT. I had to ask about the drinks because we still had not received them. This place was not busy enough to be forgetting to make drinks. A few minutes later the drinks were there. We took a couple bites of each and a few sips... Man, everything was DELICIOUS! I was not expecting that. (The major reason for so many stars) The owner (I think, because of his attitude) came over to apologize for charging me for an extra drink. He said that they took off the more expensive one and charged me for the cheaper one which wasn't the drink I  ordered. Implying that i got a discount. I was looking straight at the receipt in black and white and they were the same price. He then corrected me and said he gave me a deal. Ummm... NO, i am literally looking at the receipt. But, I didn't feel like arguing so i just said thanks. Grandma's smoothie didn't have whipped cream on it. He had asked her if she wanted it when we ordered, and she said yesssssss please. (That too was on the receipt) So they fixed that and came back with a tiramisu for us to take home. Grandma LOVES her sweets, so she was excited. But when we got home, she tried it and said it was stale and no good.  Our lunch was delicious, overpriced but delicious. Unfortunately, we probably will not be returning. Too many negatives. But I did give 3 stars for the great sandwiches.

3ebWYN8Ny8DKUBXYiOqJGw.text: Madhouse Coffee, a 24/7 open cafe.  The reason it is called Madhouse Coffee, in my opinion, because of all the artwork.  I would say the artworks were Satirical street art about Political and Social commentary.  It was an interesting place look at all the artwork.  They have sandwiches, pastries, and some specialty drinks.  I ordered the Italian Hot Chocolate. It was thicker than regular hot chocolate.  It taste a little bit like Fudge, but not as sweet.  A story when I first went to Madhouse Coffee. A man walk into the cafe late at night.  He probably wanted to escape the cold that night.  He had a sandwich with him so he ate that and sat around.  From his appearance, he didn't seem like he had a lot to his name.  I saw two of the Cafe's Workers come over and give him a sandwich, a hot beverage, and pastries.  The man look a little taken aback and wasn't sure what to do.  It was so nice of the Workers to do that act of kindness for him~^_^
