UD55xDT6XmeO0U_DgarZcA.text: I wanted to like this place. I really really wanted to like it.  A drive-thru? So convenient when you're on the go. The interior? Super cool. I mean, they have a naked Donald Trump bobblehead under glass. Yaaaaas. The food menu is intriguing which makes me want to come back. The impossible burger sounds bananas. I mean, a vegetarian burger that bleeds? I must experience this.  The service was pretty subpar. No smile. I can't settle for no smile. I ordered an almond milk latte to enjoy in the space. When it was brought out the latte art was disappointing. Maybe they aren't known for that, but with so many cafes throughout town that do, I was expecting it. The espresso blend was a bit bitter and overall. It was also really pricey. With tip, I paid over $6 for my latte.   They do offer free wi-fi for a few hours, so that's a plus. MadHouse isn't on my must go back list, but it's not out of the running.

CWdJqncs495iVEB8m73dYQ.text: Love this place! My favorite coffee shop to just chill after a long days work.  They also have really cool art work that they sell.

G2qKpMOSVlgo7Qsx0k55aA.text: So bomb! So trendy & a great atmosphere good Music good people. Come here and work on my projects all the time.

Y9Ob-xXPjKZJmCbc4sMJJQ.text: It was a love at first sight. Coffees are always good. But the customer service are no par. 2x i gave chance. 1st, i was in drive thru for 18 minutes and they forgot my order. and tonight - they did it again. i had enough. It took 23 mins for a simple hot chocolate and croissant (which they have it in stock) and there was no even a line. Too bad i left mad at "madhouse".

il8RrKmaCiVPlOo1lc77YA.text: Nutella Tiramisu is MAGIC!!! I also had their nutella white chocolate mocha which was delicious :)  I'll be back

Gt10RSqnImNPy9YABs8qLQ.text: I like this place. I used to be a huge fan, but now more a subdued one. It's fun. It's ok. It has some good coffees, like Nutella, which is a favorite. The chocolate "gluten-free" muffins are worthy of breaking your diet for. The potato gnocchi dish is pretty decent.  But dishes and drinks are pretty uneven. You might get an AMAZING coffee or sandwich one day, but the next week, it is "meh." They made me an extraordinary Americano with chocolate but then could not reproduce it, no matter how many times I gave the same instructions. It is a hip place with interesting people working and coming through there. And it is a fine place to study (if loud music does not bother you). But it is not without imperfections.

HInKOm0f0fvS61wDxK_yCA.text: A madhouse indeed. Pop art is the flavor of the ambience. Friendly, smiley, baristas greet and guide you to a good experience. Open late which is great for group study.   As for the menu... I have taken a bite of the Wannabe which includes chicken breast, pesto, provolone, and lettuce. Taste was just right. Quenched my thirst with an ice blended Nutella White Mocha which was absolute sin. It was made with just the right consistency of slushed ice with creamy mocha and Nutella. I shall return.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Had to get it topped with whipped CREAM and fudge. justincredible_memories
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella White Mocha justincredible_memories

AaL3LtPu0K6t4fzfy_a_kg.text: MadHouse Coffee is where you'll find high tech hipsters, New Agey vibes, and - most importantly - great coffee and food. One experience I'd like to share is when I drank their Matcha Latte everyday for a month. I gained 3 pounds in a month, yet that was the only change to my prior diet. It's a high calorie drink, at I think around 500-700 calories per drink. So beware of the matcha latte - I wish i had known.  Also it's open 24/7. I can't even count the amount of  times I've gone to pick up their raw vegan brownies in the wee hours of the night..

GU-LGFn2fVECTKwbfinO7w.text: Yesterday it was the second time for me here. I really like the coffee shop. Young people around and always cool music. They offer vegan cookies what I like and fresh brewed coffee or macchiato. The only thing I don't like is. Outside they have plenty tables but not really shade. It could be a bummer in summertime. Anything else is awesome!  That's definitely my favorite coffee place in Vegas.

TCOkjZrdCK3l8f_9BdgX1w.text: Great coffee. Great food. Great place to study. The fact that they are open 24/7 saved me over the summer months when I had to be up late studying. Overall just a fun environment to be in. I probably averaged coming to this coffee shop 4 times a week in June and July. Highly recommend the blended matcha.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x3ZFbU4tHS2IKXt9lRsXvw.text: Why is it nearly every time I come here I have to go back to the counter and remind them to make my order??

8erYZwURbuFMq2VJkcf63g.text: Ordered an iced chai, it was pretty gross.  I've tried a lot of chai's around the valley and this one was the worst. I couldn't even drink it, I had to dump it out. And $6 is so expensive too for a medium iced chai.

h6lQDBW386UrRFVxrCU2lQ.text: I liked this place the first time I was there and now not so much. You need a WiFi ticket password that last two hours. The coffee and the food is really expensive and there's no room anywhere because the place is always packed. Also they really don't like trump lol . If you like trump don't go there. Not that that's a big deal but I most likely won't be going back there anymore.

Wlu_M_iGXwbpLE4uO0l6VA.text: No no no no.  I have been coming here for as long as I have lived in Vegas (4 years??) I live around the corner from it now. I could walk here. Super convenient, right? I ordered a large iced latte. This is a local place, I could go to the national place but I didn't. I came here like have been doing.  So why is my drink over $8.00 add in a $2.00 tip because I'm not a cheapskate and one drink costs over $10.00.  I don't care what I have in it, the kind of milk, how much syrup, no drink has any excuse to be that expensive. With those prices I expect that the espresso being used has been walked over from Ethiopia.  I will from now on as my personal mission find local places I can get a large latte and a croissant for around $10. I used to love this place but makes no sense when I can go to The Bucks and get the same drink for HALF the price.

YQjdbIPiyfKxKmh6w39fRw.text: I love the apricot danish. They use Intelligentsia coffee and it's really good. Staff is hipster cool, and the patio is kick in' after 8pm. Cool place to hang, but hard to get homework done when it's so crowded. Wifi is decent. I love the vibe.

o-bHxIJLkbJXMkKLTRsynw.text: I decided to give this place a try since I've heard good reviews and saw the good reviews on yelp... Although I don't really understand why this place is so hyped.   It does really have that "madhouse" feel, but as for a coffee shop to do some studying or work in... I would never get anything done. The area is too small filled with many tables. I did notice that there were a lot of outlets which had USB ports.   As for the menu... it was so clustered I couldn't really understand it and some of the writing was so small I couldn't read it!  The lady who took my order was very nice and I ordered a coconut mocha. I ordered mine with non fat milk and no whip cream. The drinks were good!  I feel like this coffee shop would be great near a college or in a college town as it seems to be for that age group (especially since there's hookah).

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut mocha and monkey mocha

SHuGIZAZ4Qq9_811G-DdLQ.text: It's hard to believe that anyone in the service industry would let this out the kitchen. It's so burnt,  its black. Because I was starving, I picked off the black parts but the char smell had been absorbed by the entire sandwich. I had the burnt taste in my mouth for awhile, eeck. Horrible. coffee was good. Called in to go order on 6/20/17.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt!

8NE5W-d-_QcN_5rB_lJg5g.text: If you want fresh and flavorful coffee and tasty food go here! The staff is fun and always friendly. I love the iced lattes!

uN-m9GCmoyIhEuxj6ocnqw.text: Very cool environment, free wifi. A little pricey on the food and drinks, but the staff are usually very nice and accommodating. Wish they had some couches! But there's a lot of room on the patio to chill outside of the weather is nice too! Tons of local art on the walls up for purchase too.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qve7lnWysd6KPBoQnBe8Zg.text: I am obsessed with local coffee shops. This one is open 24 hours and close by where I live so I gave it couple of tries before writing a review. I have tried their regular brew, caramel macchiato, iced coffee, pastries and lattes. I do not think that they serve the best coffee in town, but they do serve decent coffee and espresso drinks. I've tried some macarons and I think they are mediocre. The best thing I like about MadHouse Coffee is the ambience of their coffee shop. Sadly, I cannot be a regular at a coffee shop if I am only after its ambience. :)

csE5VGLO7mHTLlunG8i49Q.text: At first I Yelped this coffee shop with 3 stars because I felt their drinks were a little too pricey for coffees but I find myself returning more and more because their coffee is so stinkin' good! I now can compare this shop to other coffee shops and chains around town, and hands down this is some of the best coffee I've ever had. One time I went to Dunkin's right around the corner, took a few sips and it was bad. I like Dunkin's but something wasn't right. They tried to remake it and were so nice but I pulled out of their parking lot and came straight to Mad House and that's when I learned.   Mad House offers so many flavors and milk alternatives. The milk alternatives include soy, almond, coconut, & Hemp. They also make their pastries and desserts in house and can I highly recommend the Vegan Brownie!! AMAZING! They also offer hookah, open 24 hours, have WiFi for customers and a patio that is puppy friendly!

MkV88emxZ8YSUZS6Rn1H6Q.text: This is possibly one of my favorite coffee shops. The coffee is great. The people are great. The atmosphere is great. It's definitely a cool place to hangout. It's a very "hip" place with all the cool decorations and food creations. Even the bathroom is awesome! It's black light and the walls are covered in glowing art. It gets very busy here especially in the evening but the workers are very good at getting your order out fast. I've tried the red velvet, the Nutella, the caramel, and the monkey mocha and they're all very good. My all time favorite is the monkey mocha! It's a chocolate peanut butter banana mocha and it comes blended. None of the flavors are overpowering it's a nice blend and the flavors complimented each other well. I have yet to try any of their food but I plan on it next time. Also, you can rent hookah from them and it's pretty cool to just chill at night with some friends, coffee, and hookah. Highly recommend this place as a spot to chill and just for their great coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bSRJDiJtnTYRBR2jwXn9XA.text: This is the best place to go hang out with friends and family specially it's 24 hrs located on the west side of town. I am here about 3-4 times a week whether to chill or to work something in my computer.   Staff is very friendly and owner as well.  Definitely would recommend this place to friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6d5F4XmHbSvybuyXXHQSHA.text: This place is a bit far from home, but the fact that is open 24/7 and has a nice ambience makes it worth the drive.   They got intelligentsia coffee!!! I tried the intelligentsia black cat cat project back in LA and love it. I ordered the caffe latte, and it was perfection in a cup. So creamy and rich it was dreamy.  I also ordered the threesome sand which. I want a huge fan of the sandwich.   This place is perfect in case you need to do an all nighter. I got there around 2am and to my surprise it had quite a bit of people in their laptops.   Will be exploring their menu more next time I visit and keep you updated. However with the perfect ambience, free wifi and delicious coffee you can't go wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Threesome !

J2fWk5ZhY4n_qF5kF0wv7w.text: Love this quaint breakfast, lunch or just to hang place Great natural foods, good drinks, coffees. I've had their tuna sandwich twice, it's better to stay in and eat as you do get a bit more of your order. I've also had a mozzarella and tomato sandwich that was very delish! Their ice teas are perfectly blended, lattes are smooth and creamy. People are kind as well.

ekWstCGBW4m_YtckOcbaqg.text: What a fun place! The servers are really nice, the art is unique and the coffe is good. I got the white mocha. (Side note: The bathroom is really cool)

lLR95b7UqeTvkJVful28kw.text: It's a small little spot but it's open 24 hours which is rad.  Great sandwich/wrap selection. Because I don't eat meat, I ordered the RABBIT HABIT sandwich which has pesto, sundried tomatoes, mushrooms, and provolone cheese. It was really good. I drink coffee from time to time but today I had the Italian hot chocolate which is the best hot chocolate I've ever had. My friend had the Nutella white chocolate iced coffee. I had a sip and it was delicious. The staff was friendly and the place was clean.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. RABBIT HABIT= YUM

S6gfbhi2KjNFPiByEXZkBQ.text: Very nice staff. I go there for the Impossible Burger, which is great. The atmosphere reminds me of the San Francisco Bay Area, where I'm from, so I really enjoy visiting. I've never tried anything but the Impossible Burger, but it looks like they have all kinds of tasty snacks there.

n_MnZUwVGPHFcFXeOT6ecQ.text: My kind of coffee joint,  laid back, local art, great food choices, organic, & open 24hrs. I didn't try the food this time, but I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

imC3VqAQU8uXXsKziJ_RRQ.text: Luv it's 24 hours!!!  The art is epic! So hipster chic. I get the grasshopper latte!  Support this place!  Yumma!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grasshopper Latte

B2lxWW9bClbBN1HuqqRIjA.text: Food was great, I had the green card and loved it. Place is a lot smaller than I expected from seeing pictures online however it was not crowded when I went. Cute place, love the vibe and style it has there. Will be back again, hopefully it's not too crowded. It's a bit pricey.

PqPxRoxST7Y-pV79Qc9-BQ.text: Exactly what a coffee shop should be. Open 24 hours, drive thru, indoor seating, outdoor seating, and amazing drinks! The staff is very knowledgeable and friendly, and they appreciate their regular customers. I stopped in one night after their 24 hour sign caught my eye and had a grasshopper. Pretty good, but it wasn't until I stopped in for a white mocha that I became truly addicted. I've since apologized to my friends & family, and now only drink a medium one here and there. But seriously, if you're looking for a sweet treat in west Vegas at any time of day, try an iced white mocha here. You will not be disappointed.

nSPJGoIDBwWrFC0aMuYUVQ.text: Came here based on all the reviews. As soon as we walked in the door we were stared down by laptop jockeys, but no biggie. It was very small, no room to sit. We stayed after reading the menu, it LOOKED good. ( who doesn't like to look at a nice chalkboard menu, with pretty font....???) We ordered and waited, and waited, and waited just for microwaved food. Who puts lettuce in a microwave ? Funny thing ! The staff even fought over who was going to make our tiny sandwiches- that (let's be real) should have only taken 5 seconds anyways (because they were being NUKED, ending up inedible). A small mocha frap was 5 dollars, ha....ha....ha.... it was mediocre at best.  We sat squished in the corner by the window surrounded by an uncomfortable silence, almost afraid to make any sudden movements that might have caught the attention of the zombified students who filled the entire place (which is saying a lot being that I'm a college student myself). Does anyone eat here or do you just sip your overpriced drinks while you pretend to study?  Sometimes we can even overlook average food for a good environment but, we ran out of there ....To this day we like to keep at least a 5 mile radius of distance between us, needless to say, we don't plan on going back.

MK8nGkR-_SyDPK3kIX_0Ew.text: Great coffee, good to great pastries, some tasty sandwiches and food, and a really eclectic, funky environment.  It's the perfect alternative to chain-coffeehouses (St******s).  This is the kind of place to come when you have a few extra minutes to burn.

3QxKlS29Lp-4tSFxJUOP5g.text: - Only Vegas coffeehouse I know of that's open 24/7  - Conveniently located next to a Vons supermarket which is also open 24/7

lTt2K4gOFTaBNYmAWw94Aw.text: A little overpriced but Madhouse is one of the better cafes in town. I like it for the ironic display of anti capitalist art, yet a very capitalistic way of pricing.

sOU6Fq-B7jqYhr7ob0rkXA.text: Good drinks, bad service. I love the drinks, but recently the services I've received haven't been up to par. One night I ordered a 16 oz. latte but upon receiving it, the cup felt quite light. Opened up the lid only to find out that they filled my cup up barely halfway. I could not believe I was charged $4 for barely even 8 oz. of a drink! Also, when I went through the drive thru, I was not once told my total. I expected to view my total on my receipt, but they failed to hand that to me too. They just charged me blindly. Now, I'm not particularly picky when it comes to most things, but with this, I just had to say it.  EDIT: I received a response not to long after my post, and I must say -- it's nice to see owners who take time to respond and attempt to solve an issue. I had no idea people actually read through all of these. It's nice to see an owner who cares about their customers as well as business. Although these may have been a couple iffy experiences, I'm still a Madhouse fan!

_smscYVKgGgspm5iE6FDUA.text: Don't go through the drive thru! We waited 20 minutes for 2 drinks.. Once we got to the window, we just watched people walk by, no greeting, nothing. And there are no cars behind us. Not worth the trip. They made us miss our Jimmy Fallon.

PgjAytz6HwrsMKESikFfeg.text: This is my favorite place in town..Im here almost every week  and I enjoy every minute of it..Andrew is the best..he is always friendly, nice and offers the best customer service..highly recommended place

Yjsaf-dFj2Rep31XgdMqGw.text: Male Barista on night shift wearing the headset and printed colored shirt did not greet customers in line. Hr seemed distracted on the order and didn't put effort in.

198A3aPzsN-B190AZ_LP1g.text: I like the place and the atmosphere; but the prices are the higher than a Empire State Building! I have never paid $7 for a coffee in my life before!!

JN6s567Hw6nF5qZ7lKYKJA.text: A pretty chill local coffee house with a nice atmosphere and good coffee. They're also open 24 hours, which is great. Only downside is that I find it pretty pricy. Granted the quality is good, but more than $5 for a medium iced coffee is a tad too much for me to afford being a regular here.

ZtAZpspeop2q3BVgD79sXQ.text: Spiced chai is really good. I got mine with coconut milk. My only complaint is that I asked for them to warm my croissant up and they didn't. But it's ok, I just popped it in the microwave. Very delicious!

Foksr_Hyjcbx7GlbbhobuA.text: I've only been here once before, but tonight was unfortunately not a good experience . I ordered my coffee and my pastry ...and proceeded to wait only to see a couple of other people getting their drinks before me, that had been behind me in line... The employees were all gathered up having social hour in the corner and eating takeout food and drinking sodas in clear view of us customers... I was actually really disappointed...coming from my experience working in the food industry. After 15 minutes of me waiting for my one drink , I was on my way... They didn't even say sorry. This will be my last time coming to this location.

AKZ7fJ-jC2Nu1ZU3R62phw.text: I have been coming to this same coffee house for some time now..  Its always very relaxing just to chillax and look across the way to Dessert Breeze park and enjoy the beauty of the surrounding environment , Music is soft and calming usually sometimes odd but not crazy wierd , i would say more interesting ..  The service is great for the most part , except for the occasional hiccups with new employees witch is quickly corrected buy veteran staff.. there is nothing cooler than hearing the barista saying " goodmorning jesse,  the usual ?"  ppppssttt mmmm yeah :p Good day everyone as i sip my cup of Jo and devour my favorite almond croissant ...

7RAJ4VCzVkHHCC5cWVbDvg.text: Music too loud service too long more expansive than starbuck or coffee bean but i do not think it taste better!!the 2 stars are because they are open 24hours!!

PKXs2221vaq4BEmYbHR3Sg.text: Omg! Pesto pasta is sooooo yummy and the coffee has been on point every single time!!!! Love love love madhouse! It's one of Las Vegas's super cool coffee shop that isn't pact all the time and has great service ! Love madhouse coffee shop!

d2bJhJyw_1Np5MUbXU-qAg.text: Friendly staff! & yummy coffee! Haven't tried the food yet but definitely will! Only reason it's 4 is because the menu isn't very descriptive!

Wpp8_9IVxOMVtlHTqkx7eA.text: I love the late night coffee and tea concept. Only problem is they need to clean up the place a bit. They lost a 4 star rating from me due to  atmosphere. The staff was super nice but they dont have a clean professional appearance. Also, smokers outside just fyi if you mind that.

XD0iuyKDSH9-7V3TsjyBOg.text: During my last trip to Las Vegas, I think I went to Madhouse every other day ... and that was only because I would have been embarrassed to be there every day!  In fact, we (our family) is headed out tomorrow, and the very first thing my newly-16-yr-old driving son wants to do is go to Madhouse by himself for The Gobbler.  Yes, we are addicted to a sandwich at this coffee shop.  It sounds so simple:  roasted turkey on ciabatta roll, with some kind of mascarpone cream mixed with cranberries ... it is absolutely heavenly!  Factor in the 24-hour drive-thru, and you have  my perfect "pretend I'm an in-the-know local" spot.  I have dreams about this sandwich - it's that good.  I wish I could review the coffee drinks because they all sound amazing, but doc outlawed coffee for a me a few years ago (a dark day, indeed.)  If you are even remotely on the west side of the Strip, this place is worth a trip!!

Y6mabBHxzAhQfMnv6rRJlw.text: Just went for my first visit. Kind of a version of Starbucks. Smoothie is great but pricey and sandwich as well. All in all just another coffee shop.

_lKgYmZHtwZdtniGR05q1w.text: Good service wonderful drinks and love the atmosphere. Good place for studying, its 24/7, dating, hanging out with friends

de2E3lHXjyNgLtBf7yAYjQ.text: Amazing coffee. Fantastic gigantic macaroons. Great relaxing atmosphere. This place is awesome!

blzdhPhtfGXNjXjiSdP7mw.text: Get off the beaten path and enjoy this place! Close to the park, dog friendly, great staff, friendly customers.

wIyNFhvvNbOLoZ2FmqLAnA.text: I'm going to be honest. MadHouse is the one place that constantly makes a solid cup of coffee. But for me, no matter what drink I order, it's always just a regular tasting cup of coffee.  However, the flavors are not always up to par. I felt that even the popular flavors were not very flavorful..in fact, the taste was a little too subtle for me. Often, my cup is too sweet and sugary to drink and just tastes like regular coffee (sometimes with a hint of chocolate) and a huge sugar rush to keep me going for an hour and a half into the night!   Because they are open 24/7, it is a place that I frequent when I need that pick-me-up and I'm on the go. I just wish that everything was more flavorful and wasn't crazy sweet, because lately, I've been making some comparable coffees at mi casa!

2fIzMFo4MJUiy68y-ntBcw.text: Calm and fun. It's a good place to study since it's easy to stay awake or eat without any overly active distractions. The most distraction would be music or the busy kitchen, and it was an easy fix with headphones.  They have indoor and patio areas.  Indoor: plugs are only on the non-window sides of the room. Although the indoor area is small, the large windows give a spacious feel.  Patio: three of the eight tables have umbrellas  The food options are unique, good in quality and quantity. I was happy with my sandwich, and I like that there are more options than what the usual coffee shops offer.  The Hibiscus with cinnamon iced tea is refreshing and yummmmy!   It's at the top to return for studying.

6iOxk_DiVBWq5uSRcQ49xA.text: FREE WIFI AND SOLID WORK SPACE, I'm a super big fan of this place! Late night coffee just needs to happen sometimes. So does super duper early morning coffee.   I needed a place to finish a research paper while in Vegas, and I wanted to go somewhere I could have a work space without feeling rushed or like I was camping.  The customer service here is top notch. Tall guy with the mini pony tail took time to explain options to me on their popular items and was so big about letting me know I could camp as long as I wanted. I could hear both of the guys working be nice to the folks with drive thru orders.   I didn't enjoy the frozen matcha green tea since it was very sweet for my taste, but the barista made me another drink of my choice! (Caution, if you're afraid of too sweet, get their opinion first.)  Some of these drinks are like whoaaaa $$$, but their ingredients are really quality. No funny review here to write. Just that this place is awesome and reliable.

_xXZlZCn6X7TRfAU1NwaFA.text: I definitely enjoy the drinks here, especially if I want a super sweet, blended coffee.  I love their espresso in iced/hot lattes as long as they don't overload with syrup. It's a big PLUS that they are 24/7. Every girl's dream, right?   I do think their prices are pretty steep, but hey you pay the price if you want it..  I actually understand the pricing, and I don't think it is fair to compare their blended coffees to Starbucks because Starbucks uses regular coffee and coffee syrups in their blended "frappuccinos," not espresso. Madhouse actually gives you the real deal for the blended coffees!    I just think they lack consistency. You will come in and order the same drink for 3 days and on the 4th day a different employee makes it differently and it's not what you wanted. You want what you had originally, you know? Maybe that's because they ran out of certain ingredients, but it shouldn't be that hard to keep up with stock if you make it a priority. Besides that minor detail, it's a great ambience with pretty good drinks.

kT937Wa356-Jf_XOQuHPQg.text: Open 24/7. Delicious unique coffee drinks. Huge variety of food, sweets, and pastries. Great artwork on the walls which is also for sale.

-uEv_eZ_6LPAb6IPG_fTUQ.text: Will never return here.  Been here a few times and I like supporting local businesses not just Starbucks...came in and the Internet was down and the guy would flat out refuse to help me. There were no other customers and he wouldn't even try to reset the router.  Red haired awkward loser.  Well there is a reason Starbucks is in business it's because these places do not help the customer and this would never happen there.  There are 24 hour Starbucks 3 miles away I can go to adios madhouse.  This is my first yelp review...the only reason I did it is because these douchebags have it all over the place to leave a review and I did so there you go madhouse.

WOTbbN0nIIBffexDcpCjfA.text: Loved their drinks! I usually get the Nutella white chocolate or the matcha green tea  staff is also very friendly

avMmCuFx4aHr30nqhqbnDg.text: ok, I don't like leaving a bad review, because I like a few people who work there, but saw something that I just can't un-see.  I've been there dozens of times over the last year or so, the cold brew is great!  The last several times the service has been, sorry to say rather poor. And the very last time was the reason why I will never step foot in that place again.   First of all it seems that now every time I go in, there is a new person who is in training and the old people no longer work there, high turnover rate? My price for the same cold brew drink I get every visit, fluctuates at times depending on who's working.   Second, some of the last few times I've been in, the music is just so loud while you're trying to order that you have to repeat yourself a few times just so the barista can hear what you're saying.  I mentioned one time that perhaps they should lower the volume since it was 7:30ish in the am and the techno music blasting was a bit much for as early as it was.  I was told that they had no control over the volume and that the owner is the only one who can control it and that he gets mad when they used to adjust the volume.   I don't like having to yell my order at people.  Third and final reason, while I was waiting for my cold brew to be poured, a barista was out in the table area cleaning up.  I saw him sort of stomp at something on the floor out of the corner of my eye. I turned to look at what he was doing. He started cleaning something brown off of the floor.  I didn't think anything of it, I thought it was weird, but I thought he dropped something? Anyhoo, I got my drink and started to walk towards the door.  His back was turned to me so he didn't see me coming up.  This time I saw what he was stomping at.  Cockroaches.  He stomped again, and he got it.  He noticed me, then tried to hide it from me by keeping his foot on it while I walked past him, but it was too late, the damage was done.  So gross.  He had just killed two cockroaches.  I left immediately and promptly discarded my drink.  Its been a couple of weeks and I have not been back.  It was so gross.  My coworkers told me that I should call in, but there is nothing more that I want from that place.  It really started to go down hill over the last several times for me, but the cockroaches was the icing on the cake.  I will NEVER return.

oTiHbdNflBtQGWC2MB23-w.text: Hands down best coffee in the world!!!! I have traveled to several countries & I bring back coffee from every country & I still can't find any that compares to this magnificent cup of coffee!!! I can't shy away from my all time favorite iced white chocolate mocha! It wins every time! I haven't had coffee in over a month & I'm such a happy girl right now! You have to check out madhouse coffee!!! I would drive across town just to have it

FINI3QmEb9a0tdIjKWB20Q.text: I came, I saw, I drank the red velvet mocha and I can only wish that this little boutique coffee house that isn't overpriced was out here on the east coast. I was lucky enough to convince the family to drive off strip before we caught our plane home, brother had a hot chocolate that he loved and mom had some banana coffee that she was impressed with also. So many neat flavors and then lots of choice pastries that are made in house... If I lived there... I'd have to make a habit out of this place. Even it's small scale and colorfully funky decor had me smitten, I was even wowed that they didn't have a register, but used an iPad and credit card square to take payment. Awesome!  All in all, come to the east coast please, mostly northern va, because when it comes to choices for coffee there are only two and they aren't hip, young, nor have that hangout quality.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet mocha amazingness

3MxEY3NhAXUFaT5EeRVH9w.text: This place was dope. I am currently on a vegan diet and they were able to accommodate for my request and suggested the mustachio iced coffee. It was so Delicious that i want a second one but im going to order it in a 32 oz.

dizvIr8kWNO6XafyqXmo5g.text: This place is awesome for studying and even better for coffee. The vibe here is really good too and the staff are all really nice.

5aKiEOK066AaTHmXvmRB-A.text: Honestly used to be my favorite coffee shop in town but I'll be taking my business elsewhere due to what I assume is a management problem. The coffee has gone down in quality, the prices have gone up, new baristas consistently use way too much milk in drinks, and you can't access wifi unless you have Facebook. If I'm paying $15 for a coffee and sandwich, I should have wifi access without the hassle.

qG2nSSKd8dAefJ5AdzhSbA.text: Definitely one of the best coffeehouse in Las Vegas. If you didn't know...well now you know!!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KkXr3u61-sn4obzErVuwTA.text: 24 hours, say what?!?!  If you're looking for a place to study or just relax and have some good eats, this is the place to go. They have awesome interior seating and even better exterior patio! I got the nutella white chocolate mocha, I believe it's called, and it's super delicious. Not too sweet for me either, but I do have quite the sweet tooth! I also got the butter croissant and it was flakey and warm and just perfect. I can definitely see myself coming her more often now that I know they're 24 hours.   Awesome staff. Awesome service! Definitely a 5 star coffee shop.

mHIt1_QRxNCoBuzW8Uzh-g.text: Every time I come here, the barista's always have some sort of attitude. They see as if they don't want to be there, or as if the customers are bothering them. The advertisements for the drinks outside on the door are completely old and faded, I don't know if it was meant to be that way, but it's cheesy. The drinks are good though, and they're LGBT+ friendly in a city that isn't too friendly to the community.

RcebyLq_z9ZROWE8SYSOPQ.text: Visiting Las Vegas I found this original place, nice people, "Mustashio" was a perfect selection to drink, I recommend this place,

v3WF4yAiUuzwoFZTE9adLw.text: Um...a coffee shop that is opened 24 hours a day!?!?! I repeat, 24 hours?! That alone already deserves an automatic 4 stars in my book.  Hi, my name is Cynthia and I'm a HUGE COFFEE ADDICT! O_O I love coffee!!! Esp iced coffee. When I'm having my gloomy and "blah" days...once delicious iced coffee touches the tip of my tongue, I'm as happy as a fat kid holding a two-scooped ice cream cone.  Not only does this place have plenty of drinks to offer, they have what it seems an endless amount of flavoring to add to your drinks too. You got your usual caramel, vanilla, hazlenut, chocolate, sugar free...etc. AND THEN...you got your passion fruit, your coconut, peppermint and other syrup that slipped my mind because the word COCONUT instantly won me over.  So what did i end up getting? An iced coconut latte. Now, not only is this different...it is a good, different, delicious drink!!!! Ahhh....love at first taste!! My boyfriend got some triple chocolate blended mocha drink in a large size. Probably equivalent to a venti at starbucks.  Only negative thing about MadHouse is that it IS on the pricey side. Both our drinks came out to be $11!!!!! Granted he got a large drink and mine was a small but damn....Unless you got money to throw around, this is definitely an indulgence special treat.  I'll still probably stick to my True love, Starbucks since there's more locations around where I live plus I got a never ending supply of giftcards to use....haha =)  However....if it's ever 12midnight and I got a super bad craving for a coffee drink...I won't hesitate to drive my ass to MadHouse and get myself some yummy-goodness!

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iced coconut latte. They gave me a hot pink straw!!! How cute is that?! :)
Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Triple chocolate blended mocha

M5NoKvuQURY1vMO4wMlMig.text: Very Good please that's work 24 hr.  Came with my wife Wednesday night to have same coffee and just relax, so this place is exactly what I was expecting to be!  A lot of young people and nice music as well . I'll come back here for sure

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KQQLCPABFqhxTMeJe7w0QQ.text: They open a coffee shop around the clock. The owner is nice always and employee too. I'm glad to know this place :) one of best coffee shop in this town. !!

Y7X3OeN4DUHPmXxi9hPuUQ.text: Heard about this place & was looking forward to it but did not have a memorable experience....food was too pricey & was disappointed that they didn't have tea leaves (although this is a coffee place). I ordered the Vegan Wrap but they didn't have collard greens. The "wrap" came with romaine lettuce which was too thin to actually make a wrap. Had to use a knife & fork which was tricky with the garbanzo beans. The food & drinks took a while to arrive & for the price didn't seem like there was enough. My daughter's sandwich was extremely tasteless. The place was really funky & I'm sure for just coffee & a pastry it would have been better but I won't be choosing this place for a meal again.

s-vff19kmTUdZyPfbDnQGg.text: I got the $10 for a $20 gift card groupon here.  Used the gift card in exactly three trips and every visit was very pleasant.  The coffee drinks are very good.  I also tried a bagel breakfast sandwich.  The filling was good but the bagel wasn't.  I ended up eating the filling sans bagel.  But, in their defense, I still have yet to find a bagel in Vegas that I like.  Except for Brueggers, which closed.  :(  The monkey mocha is pretty tasty and I like the dominant peanut butter flavor.  The staff is accomodating with my decaf and nonfat requests.  They also make a very good flat white in a variety of sizes at a very reasonable price.    And the service is just as good at 3am as it is at 8am.  That's impressive.  I agree with Angela H. - it's better than Starbucks but can't beat Sambalatte and Bentley's, especially on the food front.  But I need to try more items, too.  Will definitely be back to try the homemade tiramisu with my husband.

Xijrg4W3urH1xrNdxfEzQQ.text: They have cold drip coffee. It will blow your mind. And Madhouse is open 24 hours, 7 days a week.

75_afSeYNKKJQbkjYp85YQ.text: This is a decent place to get a coffee drink or a solid sandwich. It is a popular spot. Bust in the evenings. Wait staff is OK not the most personable.

xq1Qgco1J1Nm6QZMty039g.text: This used to be my favorite coffee shop in Las Vegas. They served high quality coffee consistently prepared with care, offered amazing desserts, and provided good wifi--24 hours a day!  Unfortunately, my last two visits have left me disappointed.  The baristas are no longer knowledgable about the coffee they serve or how drinks should be prepared.  The macarons were stale and crumbly.  And it seems that prices have crept up to Strip territory, which is unconscionable for a strip mall on DI & Durango.  At least the internet is still good.

aFzo_zf3bcM_cAqxStpg7Q.text: I think if I would give any points off for this place it would be for price..... But I didn't bc they aren't far off from Starbucks and the quality is heads and shoulders above them.  I tend to stick to iced coffee mainly. Their iced coffee is pretty superior!  The French macaroons are literally the size if your palm... Aren't the best but certainly not the worst either. Their sandwiches are clever and delicious and all the various blended drink options are to die..... Red velvet and monkey mocha?! Come on! I'm a self admitted coffee snob and this place really hits the mark. Anytime you can have a coffee joint open 24 hrs is a win win in my book!

Vv6JZSAMpBNS52tkab_GqQ.text: Seriously. This place is legit. I'm a local and I've been going around coffee houses and I have to say, this place knows how to brew and make a mean latte. Kudos.

9P3gWUmiOtBVmWp6tzOvcQ.text: After wanting to meet up with a friend for a catch-up sesh, we settled on MadHouse for the location and for the high reviews.   The staff were friendly and very welcoming. Loved that type of attitude, just brightened up our day! We ordered a cappuccino and a few pastries - the nutella-misu (isn't that brilliant!?) as well as the brightly colored, oversized coconut and strawberry macarons. We sat down in some leather chairs - was pleased that there were plenty of places to sit.   Of all the things, the coffee was to die-for. Strong, earthy, delicious. I absolutely loved it.   However, the pastries were not my favorite. As someone who regularly makes tiramisu and has made macarons numerous times, the Nutella-misu cream was delicious but the cake was dry, and that totally ruined it for me. The french macarons were artificial tasting and there were huge air bubbles - the crust needs to not shatter when you try to bite into them. We threw them away.   I highly recommend the coffee, and the service was awesome - just maybe they should re-work the pastries I described.

IGcXhUTihS4v94aUnaAI5w.text: I love this little coffee spot I still have never gone in the I never have to wait in line in the drive through more then one car my only complaint it the drive through speaker is so low its hard to hear to I end up just driving to the window and telling them what I want.

3_A2hJMJaHMPyD6-iWY0EQ.text: Great location, great drinks, free wifi! This used to be my spot while in college to study. They have raised their prices a bit, but it's understandable given the amount of foot traffic and 24 hr service. Everyone is always so friendly and the drink are consistent.   Iced white, the threesome or more cowbell sandwiches, and fresh desserts make this place great!

lrEnGha35pVThtT75WgkOQ.text: Love love love that they're open 24 hours!!!  They'll make just about anything you want....even off menu items. The 50/50 is not what you think but super yummy!  Play a variety of laid back music and have out door seating, though the smoking outside could go but you can't control everyone. Amazing variety of sandwiches with alternative varieties for diet restrictions.....just have to ask and they'll try to accommodate you.   Good stuff!

ddvSBWbh6pNcEk0dM3w5Yg.text: My favorite coffee stop in all Las Vegas! Me and my guy go to madhouse a couple times a week. It's my treat to myself . I usually get the coconut mocha iced or the vanilla latte iced. Both are great drinks. MH is always a fun environment instead of going for drinks my guy and I go out for coffee even late at night. I love that it's open later than most coffee spots. Employees are always on it and we always get our drinks lighting fast! MH is the spot

m-mN8VZbdLrJG_t5YOsYQQ.text: I would give no star but its not possible....... Just called to place an order and was told by "Christian" that they were too busy to take to go orders despite the very first thing on the top of the menu saying place your order 24/7 with their phone number listed.

QxoFWd8SxOuFUjCQByiAyg.text: Madhouse coffee is the cute comfortable coffee place I have been looking for all my life. My boyfriend and I like to go get coffee together on date night and often have trouble finding places that are open past 8! This place is open 24 hours to sit inside/outside OR go through the drive-thru!  Lots of different coffee kinds that I have yet to try.. But their pour over's are great. :) they also have a good sized menu for food/small dessert bites.  Overall I thought the ambience of the place is awesome and matches with what is served. Good music, good lighting, friendly staff, delicious drinks.. It did not disappoint and we will be back. :)

wy60o4mWyymgc0kQf5LClw.text: I really like the ambiance of the place and the cashier/barista was very nice. I also like how they have a lot of selections of coffees & food! The only complaint I have I that I wish there was more space for individual seating (for studying). I wasn't sure on what to get, so I just got a regular Americano & it was alright. I think I'm gonna get something with a little more flavor... Finally, I LOVE how it's open 24hrs :)

G4nnDRNe5TyhYffkOLF36Q.text: The place is probably the worst non-Starbucks coffee shop I've ever been to. And I love non-Starbucks coffee shops.  The seating is horrible. You have this steampunk cafeteria table with these awful seats with no back support to them. So you literally have to just drink your coffee and leave quickly before you have to see a chiropractor. The sad thing is that everything there is just stupid good too. But I saw one of the employees microwaving the meat in plastic when making the sandwich and I have a huge problem with that when a good bing or google search will show you that burnt plastic causes cancer. The chicken also tastes like a wet sponge.  The inside of it looks like a watered down Starbucks. If your idea of a Starbucks alternative is to just make your shop look like a dollar store bootleg of Starbucks then just don't. Also, what is up with that cafeteria table? And the music is flat out horrid as well. Sounds exactly like the music played at Starbucks. How many times I gotta hear that stupid Take Me To Church song in one day? We get it, your child is more likely to get molested at church than anywhere else on the planet. You don't have to tell me, I'm a devout atheist. I personally find it quite pathetic that they can't even get the order right half the time or even remember that I order anything at all. Then they do that upcharge crap. If you're not careful you can end up spending 30 dollars+ on a meal for two. And I can go to a nice restaurant or grill steaks at home for that price. So spending that much on a sandwich I could make at home and a cup of ice with a shot of tea? Never again  I also notice that quite a few of the patrons are very sketchy. Although with these prices, you would have to sell coke and have a good hustle to afford this stuff. I came in expecting hipster millennials, got a handful of European immigrants staring at me like I came to the wrong neighborhood. They seemed sketchy because they were wearing windsuits with leather sandals. There was also a guy driving around the parking lot offering to repaint my car. He then asked if I knew where I could get some "black". I had to google what he meant by that. Then there was that one guy with 4 flip phones. Gee, I wonder what he does for a living.

iWtvGTs42-AYHFoqEzUDqw.text: Coffee is nasty here.... Pastry are worst! You want really good coffee and cool place to hang out try Samba Latte at Boca Park!

bdapAOJInfe8v0fMpcx7Gw.text: I've been coming here for so long and I always run into old friends! It's so great because the atmosphere conjoins with the happiness of seeing my old buddies that it just enhances the overall experience tenfold! Jesse has to be my favorite barista. He's so charismatic and so good at recommending drinks. All I have to do is come in, say make me something good, and he takes care of the rest and makes it amazing. The owner Marco is great as well, I was just standing by the register and he included me in deciding whether or not to bring a new food item in! The workers make you feel at home and the ambience is just fantastic. Foods great, drinks are tantalizing, and this place makes my late nights worth going through the troubles of the day. Thank you guys so much for everything you do.

photos.caption: Photo of MadHouse Coffee - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EzcXf5272n4iMr5mODbrbg.text: Latte was overly sweet, the Cheesus Christ was the worst attempt at a grilled cheese I've ever tasted.
